loans.name: Elisha

texts.en:
Elisha is 62 years old and married with 4 children.

Elisha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery products to sell at her store.

Elisha has been in this business for eleven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Elisha aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products to sell at her store.

loans.name: Safina Group

texts.fr: La cliente Maneno est conseillère du groupe d’affaire Safina, entrepreneur courageuse, âgée de 42 ans et mère de 7 enfants, qui  étudient tous. Son conjoint est un boucher, vendeur de chèvres. La cliente est vendeuse de denrées alimentaires. Elle s’installe ses produits dans un entrepôt. Elle commença cette affaire vers les années 1994 avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 15 sacs de maniocs. Les pertes liées à la détérioration de ses produits constituent un blocage pour le développement de son entreprise.  Elle souhaite voir ses enfants terminent leurs études. Ainsi, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit.
texts.en:
This client, Maneno, is the advisor of the business group Safina. She is a brave entrepreneur, 42 years old, and the mother of seven children, who are all students. Her husband is a butcher and sells goats. This client sells foodstuffs. She sets up her goods in a warehouse. She started this business around 1994 with her own funds received from her husband. 

This new loan will serve to purchase 15 sacks of cassava for her. The losses associated with spoiled goods constitute a stumbling block to developing her enterprise. She would like to see her children finish their studies. So, she thanks Hekima very much for supporting her with micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sacks of cassava

loans.name: Esperance Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mihali est doyenne du groupe d’affaire Esperance, entrepreneur courageuse, âgée de 50 ans, veuve et mère de 6 enfants, qui  étudient tous. Son conjoint fut tristement décédé suite à une courte maladie. La cliente est vendeuse de souliers. Elle s’installe ses articles au marché, dans le centre ville. Elle commença cette affaire vers les années 1992 avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari, de son vivant. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter  30 paires de souliers.  La cliente souhaite voir ses enfants terminent leurs études. Ainsi, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit.Il sied de signaler que, il ya de clientes dont leurs visages étaient invisibles, suite à la petitesse de l’espace de prise de photo.
texts.en:
This client, Mihali, is the head of her business group Esperance. She is a brave entrepreneur, 50 years old, a widow, and the mother of six children, who are all students. Sadly, her husband died following a brief illness. This client sells shoes. She sets up her merchandise at the market downtown. She started this business around 1992 with her own funds received from her husband when alive. This new loan will serve to purchase 30 pairs of shoes for her. 

This client would like to see her children finish their studies. So, she thanks Hekima very much for supporting her with micro-loans. It should be noted that some clients are obscured due to the small space in which the photo was taken.

loans.use: to purchase 30 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 27ans, Dédé est revendeuse de friperies(habits, sacs de sortie et chaussures) dans une boutique. Son premier crédit lui servira à s’approvisionner en marchandises. Le profit lui permettra d’ouvrir d’autres points de vente et fonder une famille financièrement stable.  Elle a une ancienneté de 03ans dans l’activité.
texts.en: A young, 27-year-old woman, Dédé sells second-hand items (clothing, handbags and shoes) in a shop. Her first loan will be used to restock on merchandise. The profit will enable her to open other points of sale and to start a family with financial stability. She has 3 years experience in her line of work.

loans.use: to buy handbags and shoes.

loans.name: Ramonita

texts.en:
Ramonita is 51 years old, and is widowed with two children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 10 years and earns 30,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2008, and now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods, soap, shampoo, coffee, sugar and noodles. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods, soap, shampoo, coffee, sugar and noodles.

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr: Madame Kayi est une dame de 35ans. Elle est mariée à un infirmier et maman d’01 enfant d’1an 3mois. Elle est tresseuse et revendeuse de mèches. Après sa formation, elle a ouvert son atelier en 2000 et a 04 employés qui lui prêtent  main forte. Afin d’acheter des mèches et des pagnes, Kayi fait son premier crédit à WAGES. Comme perspectives d ‘avenir, elle espère avoir un grand atelier et assurer au mieux un avenir meilleur à sa famille.
texts.en: Kavi is a 35-year-old woman. She is married to a nurse and the mother of a child who is 15 months old. She is a hair braider and sells hair extensions. After her education, she opened her studio in 2000, and has 4 employees to assist her. She is requesting her first loan from WAGES in order to buy hair extensions and pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing). Her plans for the future include owning a large studio and doing her best to ensure a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy pagnes and hair extensions.

loans.name: Abizigirwa Group

texts.fr:
Lela  fait partie du groupe Abizigirwa  et est une des victimes de  l’incendie du marché central de Bujumbura. Elle est cliente de Turame depuis  7 ans. Elle  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle est mariée à Martin. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants  âgés de  1 à  24 ans.

Elle faisait le commerce des habits   au marché central de Bujumbura. Elle a perdu des marchandises d’une valeur de  1 500 000FBU (961,55 $) par l’incendie. 

Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  reconstituer son capital en achetant des  habits, à revendre pour  continuer de gagner sa vie.
texts.en: Lela is a member of the Abizigirwa group, and one of the victims of the fire at the Central Market of Bujumbura. She has been a client of Turame for 7 years. She lives in Bujumbura and is married to Martin. The couple have 5 children, aged between 1 and 24 years old. She used to sell clothing at the Bujumbura Central Market. She has lost merchandise with a value of 1 500 000 francs ($ 961,55) because of the fire. Her Kiva-sponsored loan will enable her to rebuild her capital by buying clothing for resale, so that she can continue to earn a living.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Emelie is 29 years old and has two children who are in school.

Emelie has a livestock business in the Philippines. Emelie requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Emelie has been in this business for two years. Emelie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 33 years old and married with two children.

Emily works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store.

Emily has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Emily aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Milleza

texts.en:
Milleza is 56 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Milleza is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional feeds for her pigs and materials for the repair of her pig pens.

Milleza has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds for her pigs and materials for the repair of her pig pens.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda, 52, is married with seven children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rosalinda has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 20000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy shampoo, soap, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs and other items to sell. 

Rosalinda has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Rosalinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, soap, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs and other items to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 43 years old and married with one kid who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Elizabeth has a frozen foods retail business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy more frozen foods to sell.

She has been in this business for two years. Elizabeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
This is Angelina. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more products for her grocery store so she was able to generate more income. Her business is just in their house, and she has been operating it for six years now. She is working hard to provide income for their everyday needs and expenses.

She would like to apply for a new 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Angelina dreams that her business will continue to be successful and to be able to help others. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El cliente vive en Guayaquil, el tiene 58 años de edad. Empezó recorriendo en un triciclo vendiendo mercadería, pero después se enfermo es PVVS (paciente viviendo con Vih Sida). Tambien tuvo un accidente, que lo dejo mal con su pie, por eso tuvo que tener una tienda y recargas de celulares para tener mas ingresos y comenzar con lo que sabia ya que el es técnico en refrigeración. 

El atiende su negocio desde las 9:00 de la mañana hasta las 22:00 de la noche, y lo realiza solo. El nos cuenta que tiene dos dificultades en su negocio, la primera, es cuando a él se le bajan las defensas y en esos momentos tiene que estar en absoluto reposo, la segunda es cuando llueve demasiado tiene problemas en su hogar. El no está casado, si tiene hijos pero ya son todos mayores de edad.

Con el préstamo el va a reforzar su negocio con mercaderías comprando viveres, granos, bebidas, recargas de celulares para tener más ingresos económicos. El cliente para el futuro desea seguir viviendo, también quiere conservar su negocio y incrementarlo para poder tener más ingresos económicos, poder disfrutar su vida junto a su familia, y poder darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The client, age 58, lives in Guayaquil.  He started out by traveling around and selling merchandise on a tricycle.  However, he later became ill.  He is a PVVS (patient living with HIV/AIDS).  Also, he had an accident that left him with a bad foot.  That is why he had to have a rechargeable cell phone card store in order to have more income.   He had to start with what he knew because he is a refrigeration technician.

He tends to his business from nine in the morning until ten at night, and he works alone.  He tells us that he has two difficulties in his business.  The first is when his defenses are lowered.  At these times he needs to rest completely.  The second is that when it rains too much he has problems at his house.  He is not married.  However, he does have children who are already grown.

He will use the loan to strengthen his business with merchandise.  He will buy supplies, grains, drinks, and rechargeable cell phone cards in order to have more income.

In the future, the client wishes to continue living.  He also wants to preserve his business and increase it in order to have more income.  He wants to be able to enjoy his life together with his family.  He wants to be able to give them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies, grains, drinks, and rechargeable cell phone cards.

loans.name: Emefa

texts.fr: Emefa est une femme âgée de 28 ans. Elle est mariée et n’a pas d’enfants en charge. Emefa travaille comme coiffeuse depuis 2010. En plus de sa profession, elle revend également des mèches et des défrisants dans son salon de coiffure situé à Lomé. Elle achète les produits à Lomé et exerce seule son activité. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas avoir d’employées pour satisfaire au mieux ses clientes quand elle est débordée. Emefa a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des mèches et des défrisants. Elle veut réaménager son salon avec les profits obtenus.
texts.en: Emefa is a 28-year-old woman. She is married and has no dependent children. She has been working as a hairdresser since 2010. She also sells hair extensions and relaxers in her hair salon, located in Lomé. She buys the products in Lomé and runs her business alone. Currently, her main challenge is that she does not have employees to help her better satisfy her customers when she is swamped. Emefa is requesting her 2nd loan from WAGES in order to buy hair extensions and relaxers. She would like to use the profits she earns to refurbish her salon.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and relaxers.

loans.name: Maa Tarini Group

texts.en:
Maa Tarini is a Joint Liability Group formed by five active women of Bhawanipatna town in Kalahandi district of Odisha, India. 

Laxmi, standing on the left and raising her hand, is the featured member. She is 32 years old and lives with her husband, one daughter, age 16, and two sons, 12 and 7.

Laxmi has been smoothly running a tea stall with snacks for last five years in her locality with the help of her husband. She is energetic and hard working. Usually Laxmi does the household work and in her leisure time she helps her husband in running the tea stall. Her monthly net income from the present business is round 8,000 INR. 

With the present income she is unable to provide better education for her children and unable to save money for the marriage of her grown daughter. So with the present loan, Laxmi has planned to enhance her business by purchasing a refrigerator to keep cold drinks, soda and other daily needs as per the demand of the customers. She has a dream to provide better education for her children and marry her daughter in a respectable family.   

The other four members of her group, Arati, Pramila, Puspa and Babi, are running a cycle repairing centre, a tiffin (lunch) stall, a betel nut shop and an auto repairing centre respectively.

loans.use: to pay for a refrigerator and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 31 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Rosemarie is borrowing 24,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies for her business.

Rosemarie has been farming vegetables for four years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies for her business.

loans.name: Mahalaxmi-1 Group

texts.en:
Rebati, a married woman 48 years old, lives in the district headquarters of Kalahandi district, i.e. Bhawanipatna, of Odisha, India. The lady standing second from left in the sky color sari with raised hand is Rebati.  She lives with her husband and two sons, age 29 and 20. She is very energetic, hardworking and enthusiastic and she always devotes her efforts to get her family ahead. 
 
For 20 years, Rebati has been running a general shop. Initially, she started the business in a low profile with limited items like potato, soap, sugar, tea dust, tobacco, chocolates, etc. Gradually, she expanded her business and added extra items regularly. Now her son is looking after the business. 

In the year 2009, Rebati, along with three other women of her locality, formed a Joint Liability Group named Mahalaxmi-1 and took a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the development of their business. All members hail from poor backgrounds in the Below Poverty Line category. This is the third loan of her group. 

During the last three loans, Rebati has been able to add some grocery items like dough, oil, spices, etc. Now she is earning 500 INR daily from her business. Rebati wants to keep more stock for her shop, but due to financial scarcity, her son has to go to the nearest market to buy items for her grocery shop regularly. Due to frequent purchases, she incurs losses due to transportation costs. So from the present loan she has planned to buy in bulk merchandise for her business such as rice, sugar, oil, noodles, potato, onion, dough, etc. She expects to increase her sales and thereby her income for her overall development. Rebati hopes to build a permanent house for her family and get her sons married. 

The other three members of the group are Padmalaya, Binodini and Purnima running tailoring center, auto repairing center and betel nut shop respectively.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing rice, sugar, oil, noodles, potato, onion, dough, etc.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Enriqueta works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a general store. Enriqueta is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Enriqueta has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 55 years old and a widow with six children, three of whom are in school, Teresa works very hard to provide for them.

Teresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, bread, biscuits, etc. She has been in this business for 25 years.

In the future Teresa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, bread, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Mahalaxmi-2 Group

texts.en:
Sanjukta, a young and energetic lady of 35 years, is residing in a slum area of Bhawanipatna town in the Kalahandi district of Odisha, India. She, along with other three women of her locality, has formed a group named Mahalaxmi-2. The lady standing second from left with raised hand is Sanjukta. She lives with her husband, two daughters and one son.

Sanjukta is running a bricks-selling business with the help of her husband. She herself runs her own brick kiln and sometimes purchases bricks from other vendors and supplies them to contractors and house builders. Her monthly net income from the bricks business comes to 10,000 INR. There is a heavy demand for her product due to the growing demands of house construction. 

To improve her business, she wants to take a loan from Mahashakti. From the loan, Sanjukta has planned to purchase materials like firewood, sand, coal and rice bran for her business. Sanjukta has a dream to provide better education to her children and construct a house of her own in due course. 
  
The other three members of her group, Santilata, Kiranmayee and Manilata, are doing a fruits business, tailoring and an auto repairing center, respectively.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing materials like firewood, sand, coal and rice bran for the brick kiln.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat. She has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Rosa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is engaged in the variety store and direct selling business. She has been operating her variety store for ten years and her direct selling business for three years. Mercedes is 40 years of age, married with four children. Her eldest child is married; two are still studying and her youngest child an infant.

Mercedes would like to buy stocks of merchandise such as instant noodles, canned goods, eggs, cooking oil and assorted biscuits for her retail store but she struggles with a shortage of income. With regard to this situation, she is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000. She hopes that her requested loan amount will be granted so she could earn better income to enable her to educate her three children and cover all their household expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as instant noodles, canned goods, eggs, cooking oil and assorted biscuits for her retail store

loans.name: Ayélé Akpédzé

texts.fr: Ayélé Akpédzé est une femme âgé(e) de 32 ans. Elle est mariée å un employé de bureau et 02 enfants de 04 et 01an. Ayélé Akpédzé travaille comme revendeuse de mèches, de chaussures et sacs. Elle revend à ses clients de façon ambulante et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Ayélé Akpédzé a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des mèches, des chaussures et des sacs. Comme perspectives d ‘avenir, elle veut assurer l’éducation des enfants et ouvrir une boutique pour éviter de se promener dans la ville.
texts.en: Ayélé Akpédzé is a 32 year old woman. She is married to an office worker and has 2 children who are 4 and 1 year old. Ayélé Akpédzé works as a reseller of hair extensions, shoes and bags. She resells to her customers as an itinerant saleswoman and gets her supplies in Lomé. Ayélé Akpédzé requested her second loan cycle from WAGES in order to buy hair extensions, shoes and bags. For the future, she wants to ensure the education of her children and open a shop to avoid having to walk around town.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, shoes and bags for resale.

loans.name: Veniranda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Veniranda works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling fermented shrimp and fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried fish. Veniranda is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of fermented shrimp and fish to sell for her business.

Veniranda has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of fermented shrimp and fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a lot of items for his shop (beans, sugar, rice...) to resell to make more.

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia is 43 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Verginia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Verginia has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Henriette

texts.fr:
Henriette  fait partie du groupe Bikorwavyimana et est une des victimes de  l’incendie du marché central de Bujumbura. Elle est cliente de Turame depuis  2007. Elle  habite à  Bujumbura. C’est une veuve avec 4 enfants   âgés de  5 à  18 ans.

Elle faisait le commerce des produits vivriers (manioc, banane, patate douce,…)   au marché central de Bujumbura. Elle a perdu des marchandises d’une valeur de  1 500 000FBU (961,55 $) par l’incendie. 

Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  reconstituer son capital en achetant des  produits vivriers (manioc, banane, patate douce,…), à revendre pour  continuer de gagner sa vie.
texts.en:
Henriette is part of the group Bikorwavyimana and is one of the victims of the fire in the central market of Bujumbura. She has been a client of Turame since 2007. She lives in Bujumbura. She is a widow with 4 children aged from 5 to 18 years old.

She was a shopkeeper selling foods (manioc, bananas, sweet potatoes...) at the central market in Bujumbura. She lost merchandise valued at 1,500,000 FBU (961,55$) in the fire.

With the Kiva loan that she receives, she is going to reconstitute her capital by buying food products (manioc, bananas, sweet potatoes...) to resell to continue to make a living.

loans.use: to reconstitute her capital by buying food products (manioc, bananas, sweet potatoes...) to resell to continue to make a living.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new sign and marketing materials to help her continue to grow her business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 53 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. 

She fishes to earn a living. She has been in her business for over eight years and earns 6,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2010 and now she has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fishing materials such as hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials such as hooks and nets.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia es una señora de 55 años, casada, madre de familia de dos hijos los cuales ya son independientes, originaria del municipio de El Sauce ubicado a 90 km del departamento de León.

Desde hace 25 años se ha dedicado a dar clases a niños de primaria en un colegio de la localidad. Le ha tocado una vida dura porque por muchos años alquiló vivienda ya que no contaba con una propia pero con el apoyo incondicional que le ha brindado Kiva a través de Ceprodel con los financiamientos logró adquirir un patio donde inició a construir su casita la que ha ido mejorando poco a poco, su sueño es tener una casa con todas las condiciones adecuadas.

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena y piedrín para repellar y embaldosar la casa, ya que el piso es de suelo.

Se siente muy agradecida con Kiva y Ceprodel por los financiamientos que le ha otorgado porque ha mejorado su nivel de vida.

Confía en Dios que le sigan apoyando para terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Virginia is a 55-year old woman, married and mother of two children, who are already independent. She's from the municipality of El Sauce, located 90km away from the department of León. 

She's been teaching in primary education at a school in her town for 25 years and has had a tough life because for a long time she had to rent a house. She didn't have one of her own, but thanks to the unconditional support from Kiva through Ceprodel she was able to buy a patio where she started to build her home. She's been making improvements little by little and her dream is to have a house with all the appropriate conditions. 

She's now requesting a loan to buy cement, sand and gravel that she'll use to plaster and tile, given that there is still soil as floor. She feels very grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel for the financing as it has improved her quality of life. She trusts that God will keep supporting her to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.fr:
Angeline  fait partie du groupe Bikorwavyimana et est une des victimes de  l’incendie du marché central de Bujumbura. Elle est cliente de Turame depuis  5ans. Elle  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle est mariée à Melchior. Ensemble ils ont  4 enfants   âgés de  18 à  39ans, dont 1 étudie.

Elle faisait le commerce des  habits (sous- vêtements, pyjama,)   au marché central de Bujumbura. Elle a perdu des marchandises d’une valeur de  1 000 000FBU (641,03 $) par l’incendie. 

Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  reconstituer son capital en achetant des  habits  
(sous -vêtements, pyjamas,…) à revendre pour  continuer de gagner sa vie.
texts.en:
Angeline is part of Bikorwavyimana Group. She's one of the victims of the fire of the Central Market in Bujumbura. She's been a client of Kiva's partner, Turame, for five years.

She lives in Bujumbura and is married to Melchior. Together, they have four children, aged 18 to 39. One of them attend school.

Angeline used to sell clothing (underwear, pajamas) at the Central Market in Bujumbura. In the fire, she lost merchandise valued at BIF 1'000'000 (ca US$ 640).

With this Kiva loan, she will rebuild her working capital and buy clothing (underwear, pajamas) to resell, in order to continue making a living.

loans.use: to buy clothing (underwear, pajamas)

loans.name: Lilita

texts.en:
Lilita is 47 years old and married with six children.

Lilita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like noodles, bread, soft drinks, soap, etc. Lilita has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Lilita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like noodles, bread, soft drinks, soap, etc.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita dreams to lift up her children from poor living. She is married to Ronald, a father who helps her to meet their daily needs. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with three children. 

To earn a living, Juanita is engaged in a coconut and "malagkit rice" grinding business. She has been in this business for 10 years. To this end, Juanita is asking for a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to buy sugar, coconut and "malagkit rice" for her grinding business. Juanita hopes to grow and expand her business as well as their family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coconut, and "malagkit rice" for her grinding business

loans.name: Mariacil

texts.en:
Mariacil works hard to support her family. Mariacil is married and has a business selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years now. Mariacil requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ready-to-wear to sell.

In the future, Mariacil would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ready-to-wear to sell

loans.name: Jurine

texts.en: Jurine is 38 years old and married. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a business, planting and harvesting vegetables and fruits, to earn a living. She has been in business for over five years and earns 20,000 PHP every month. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. Now she has applied for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy fertilizer, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve and expand the business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, such as manure, for her fruit and vegetable farm.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 48 years old, married and has six children, five children are in school.

Merlinda is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Merlinda has been raising pigs for 2 years now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. Merlinda requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Emily has applied for a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business. Emily has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en: Leonisa is 27 years old, married, and has two children. Leonisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has applied for a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock, such as rice, biscuits and other groceries needed for her business. Leonisa has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years, and she also earns income from farming sugarcane. Leonisa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock, such as rice, biscuits and other groceries, needed for her business.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is married and has 6 children. Her husband is working in a NGO. Josefina has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. 

Josefina is taking a loan of 1,000 USD from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She feels better when she applied for her first loan. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as secondhand clothes, secondhand shoes and secondhand bags. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes, secondhand shoes and secondhand bags

loans.name: Vinna

texts.en: Vinna is 30 years old, married, and has one child. Vinna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has applied for a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy stock to sell, including canned goods, soap, spices and soft drinks. Vinna has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years, and she also earns income from a bakery. Vinna aspires to build and expand her business, in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell in her general store, including canned goods, soap, spices and soft drinks.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is 48 years old, a widow with five children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a business, planting, harvesting and selling bananas, to earn a living. She has been in business for over five years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has applied for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy chemical fertilizers for her banana farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve and expand the business.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for her banana farm.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Rosita works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a general store. Rosita is borrowing 9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell for her business.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Bayarbayasgalan

texts.en:
Mrs. Bayarbayasgalan is 28 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in a Ger in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband, Batbayar, works at a local company, and her daughters, Michidmaa and Maralmaa, both go to a local kindergarten.

Bayarbayasgalan has been working as a salesperson since 2009. She is now starting her own clothing retail business at a rental counter of a shopping center. She is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory for her newly starting clothing retail business. She is a hardworking, goal-oriented and modest woman.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for her newly starting clothing retail business

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo works hard to earn a living. He is a business oriented person who is married with three children. Rodolfo aims to earn a greater income so his children can finish their studies and he can secure his family's future.

Rodolfo plans to purchase additional kilograms of fish and meat for his food sales business because it's harvest season. With his determination to get ahead in life, he is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP. He knows that it will help him realize his goals in life. He just hopes that lenders will continue to support him financially so he can have a comfortable way of life someday and educate his youngest child.

loans.use: to buy fish and meat for sale.

loans.name: Federico

texts.es:
El Sr. Federico tiene 62 años está casado con la Sra. Francisca, tienen 5 hijos todos mayores que ya formaron sus propias familias y ya no viven con ellos.
El Sr Federico se dedica al comercio y tiene una despensa bien surtida con productos de primera necesidad que es atendida junto con su esposa y también se dedica a la Compra- Venta de carbón, para lo cual compra por cantidad semanalmente y los empaqueta para vender por kilos.
Su esposa también trabaja arduamente y cuenta que fue integrante de un grupo de comité de mujeres donde participó hasta el ciclo 11, debiendo retirarse para poder solicitar mayores montos y alargar su plazo. Siempre fueron personas muy trabajadoras que lucharon por salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
Solicitan de este crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, productos a granel, con los que podrá seguir ofreciendo una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Federico, 62 is married to Mrs. Francisca. They have five children together, all of them independent adults with their own families.

Mr. Federico is a merchant. He has a well-stocked store with essential products, run by him and his wife. He also buys and sells coal. Every week, he buys in bulk and repacks in one-kilo bags. Federico’s wife also works hard and he says that she was part of a group composed of women until its eleventh cycle. She had to leave in order to be able to request larger amounts and extend her repayment periods. They have always been hardworking persons, struggling to get ahead and help their family.

This loan is to buy rice, sugar and other products in bulk, with which they will be able to continue offering their clients a wide variety of products.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and other supplies in bulk.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 58 years old and married with five children.

Virginia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, milk, coffee, and spices.

Virginia has previously borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income buying and selling fermented shrimp and fish as well as dried fish.

Virginia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, milk, coffee, and spices.

loans.name: Jeannette De La Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Jeannette  vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja en una institución del estado en el área de informática casada con dos hijos en edad escolar.

Doña Jeannette está solicitando un crédito a kiva ceprodel para la compra de materiales de construcción como cemento piedra arena para hacerles unas mejoras a su casa ya que considera necesario  para darles mayor comodidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jeannette lives in the city of Managua and works with computers for a governmental institution. She is married and has two children in school.

Mrs. Jeannette is requesting a Kiva-CEPRODEL loan to buy building materials such as cement, rocks and sand for some home improvements needed to give her children a more comfortable space.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron and other materials.

loans.name: Godelieve

texts.fr:
Godelieve  fait partie du groupe Bikorwavyimana et est une des victimes de  l’incendie du marché central de Bujumbura. Elle est cliente de Turame depuis  8ans. Elle  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle est mariée à Jean. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants  âgés de  6 à  17 ans,tous étudient.

Elle faisait le commerce des  poissons    au marché central de Bujumbura. Elle a perdu des marchandises d’une valeur de  4 000 000FBU (2564,15 $) par l’incendie. 

Il voudrait faire le commerce d’importation, ce projet est arrêté.


Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  reconstituer son capital en achetant des poissons, à revendre pour  continuer de gagner sa vie.
texts.en:
Godelieve is a member of the Bikorwavyimana. She is one of the people who have suffered losses during the fire in the Bujumbura central market. She has been a customer of Turame for eight years. She lives in Bujumbura. Her husband’s name is Jean. They have five children ranging from six to 17 years of age, all of whom study.

Godelieve sells fish at the Bujumbura central market. She lost her merchandise in the value of 4,000,000 FBU (US $2564.12) in the fire. 
Thanks to this Kiva loan, she will rebuild her working capital and buy fish  for resale  in order to continue making a living.

loans.use: rebuild her working capital and buy fish  for resale  in order to continue making a living.

loans.name: Enkhtuvshin

texts.en: Enkhtuvshin, 27 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He has been running a grocery store since 2011 and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in this field. His acumen, charisma and politeness have helped him to stabilize his business by attracting customers even though the store is not located in a good location. In order to generate more income for his family, he wants to increase the circulating capital of his grocery store. So he is requesting a loan of 3,400,000 MNT to purchase foodstuffs in large quantities. As a result, he can continue to run his grocery store without worrying about an inventory shortage. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future. Also during his free time, he renders taxi service to local people using his automobile.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs in large quantities

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en:
Tha, 29, is married with two dependent children. Her family lives in a house with a thatch roof located in Kampong Cham province’s Damabe district. The main source of her family’s income is growing cassava. To supplement that income, Tha's husband also works for others for a fee. Tha and her husband have been running their business for nine years, earning about 34,000 KHR per day. Tha is able to save about 15,000 KHR each day. 

Tha is new to VisionFund this cycle. She is leading her group of three to request a loan of 4,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Tha is going to use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her cassava. She hopes to increase her crop yields to earn more income and to send her children in school.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her cassava.

loans.name: Saron

texts.en:
Saron is 26 and married with three children. Her family lives in a village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, and she and her husband earn a living through growing cassava and raising pigs. She and her husband work for others for a fee to earn additional income for the family. The current business earns her approximately 16 USD per day; she manages to save about 6 USD each day after daily expenses. 

Saron is an existing client of VisionFund who has received previous loans for one cycle. The past loan helped relieve her family's financial burden to a great extent. She is now requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend planting rubber trees to earn extra income for her family. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow cassava as well as rubber trees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en: Chanthy, 38, is married and lives with her family in a village in the Tbaung Khmum district. She has five children, all of whom are dependents. Some of her children are still in school while others run their own businesses. For the last 18 years, she has earned a living by working in a rubber field where she earns about 30,000 KHR per day. Chanthy leads a two-person loan group and is requesting her third loan from VisionFund. She will use her portion of this loan to support her children's business. She hopes this loan will help her children do well and earn a good income.

loans.use: to support her children’s business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Hermie

texts.en: Hermie is from the village of Minanga Proper, Angadanan. He runs a transportation business using his motorcycle. He has been in this business for ten years and usually earns about 300 PHP a day. Hermie is 28 years old and still single. He hopes to become a good husband and father for his future family, and that's why he works hard. At this time, Hermie is asking for a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to buy oil, sprockets, and gasoline for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy oil, sprockets, and gasoline for the maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 54 years old and lives in Payatas, Philippines. She is married and a mother, and earns a living by making wallets out of straw. She works hard because she wants her wallets to be high quality. She supplements her income by making peanut butter. Her regular customers are her neighbors and she earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. She is requesting a loan for 12,000 PHP to buy the supplies she needs to make wallets and ingredients to make peanut butter. She dreams that her businesses will continue to grow and expand, and meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who meet weekly to study religion, build social capital, and repay loans.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to make wallets and ingredients to make peanut butter.

loans.name: Thoern

texts.en:
Thoern is 46 years old living with her husband and five children in a rural village of the Kror Kor district. One of her children is still in school. Rice farming and cassava planting are the only main sources for her family’s income to make a living. To supplement the income, her husband makes palm juice. Engaging in this business for 25 years, the current business earns her family a daily income of about US$5 but she is able to save US$2 each day. 
This is the fifth loan for Thoern with VisionFund. With the successful past loans, she has been able to better support her current business. Now she is applying for another loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy a decent vehicle for her family to use.

loans.use: To buy a decent vehicle for her family to use

loans.name: Ar's Group

texts.en:
Ar is 49 and lives in the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province. She is a rice farmer on about two hectares, and she raises pigs in the local area to support her daily cost of living. She has been in this business for ages.

Ar joins VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) as a first time borrower. She is in a group of two to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her portion of the loan to buy pig feed. She hopes to fatten her pigs to a healthy condition and progressively to better her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Rojita

texts.en:
Rojita runs a kiosk to generate income for her family. Rojita opened her kiosk in 2005 with her own working capital of $ 400.

She is taking a loan of $600 to add inventory to her business; she will use the loan to buy sleepers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits.  

Rojita  is a hard-working woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sleepers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta), and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Pom's Group

texts.en: Pom is a 35-year-old married mother of five children who lives in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, where she earns a living by growing cassava.  She has been in this line of work for 17 years and earns up to 21,700 KHR a day. She uses her income to support her three children, all of whom are in school. She has received three previous loans from VisionFund, and repaid them after using the money to expand her business and keep her children in school. She leads a two-person loan group, and will use her portion of this loan to buy fertilizer, rice seeds and pesticide, and to pay a plowing fee. She hopes to increase her income and help her family live a better life.

loans.use: to buy supplies and hire laborers for her farm.

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en: Pheap is 39 years old, married and lives with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.  Her children are in school, and she and her husband earn a living by growing cassava. She has been in this business for 10 years and has received three previous loans from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She now leads a four-person loan group which is seeking a new loan for 4,500,000 KHR. Pheap will use her portion of this loan to buy fertilizer, cassava seedlings, insecticide, and to pay a plowing fee. She hopes that she can grow a large crop because this will allow her to take good care of her children.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and pay a plowing fee.

loans.name: Buntheoun

texts.en:
Buntheoun, 38, is the father of a little girl; they reside in the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province. Buntheon farms rice and raises pigs, and he struggles to make a decent income for his family. This business earns him about 19,000 KHR per day. 

This is not the first loan for Bunthoeun with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has completely repaid previous loans, which helped him to sustain his standard of living and increase his family's income. Now, he is seeking a new loan in the amount of 3,400,000 KHR. With this loan, he will buy a mini-tractor to support his farmland as well as for commuting. He hopes this purchase will lessen the burden of transportation fees so that he can make good use of his income to support his children.

loans.use: to buy a mini-tractor to support his farmland.

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab is 52 years old. He lives with his brother in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. Merab requested loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Nowadays the family is out of resources. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Merab requested loan from Credo for start-up of a family business. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to a country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Merab will pay a toll for his car. After the toll is paid, he plans to serve local people as a taxi driver and earn money. The family will have a source of income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to pay a toll for his car.

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en:
Sarom, 63, is a widow and mother of a schoolchild. She is a local farmer who plants edible arum and mango as the main source of family income. She has been in this business for 18 years, and it earns her about 11,400 KHR per day. 

Sarom, a third-time borrower, forms a group of two with a second-time borrower. After her past loan which she has repaid completely, she feels empowered to stabilize her business and improve her standard of living. Now, she and her group member are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, Sarom will use her loan portion to buy a good arum seedling and to plow the land for the planting season. She hopes that she will receive double yield and increase the income from her business so she can keep her children in school until the tertiary level.

loans.use: to buy a seedling and to plow the land.

loans.name: Neat's Group

texts.en:
Residing in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Neat is 31 years old and married. Rice farming and cassava planting are her primary source of income. Her 13 year engagement in farming has helped her to earn a current average of about 15,800 KHR. 

This is the second microloan for Neat’s group with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. Neat managed her past loan wisely to expand her business and sustain her lifestyle. For this cycle, she and her co-borrower are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, Neat will use her loan portion to buy rice seed, cassava seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticide, and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes to gain high yield and earn a better income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, cassava seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticide and to pay for plowing.

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager residing in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Kong is married and has four children. One hectare of cassava and a half hectare of rice are her main sources of income, which is used to support her daily food consumption. Kong has been in the farming business for ages, and she earns about 20,900 KHR per day. 

Kong, a third time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), is a member of a three-person group applying for a new loan. Kong has utilized her past loans wisely to sustain and grow her business and to afford three meals a day for her family. Now, she and one of her group members are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each, while a remaining member is applying for 1,200,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to purchase potash and pesticides and to pay for farming labor costs. She hopes to grow her cash crops fruitfully and on time so that she can buy an additional plot of farmland to enlarge her profits.

loans.use: to purchase potash and pesticides and to pay for labor costs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru: Сафаргул жительница города Сарбанд, расположенного на юго-западе Таджикистана. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем и у нее есть сын и дочь. В данное время ее муж и сын находятся на заработках за пределами страны, а дочь работает в Дорожно-эксплуатационном управлении города Сарбанд. Сама Сафаргул раньше в течение 5 лет работала в сфере торговли, однако по причине болезни она вынуждена была прекратить свою деятельность и больше года как не работала. Теперь после полного выздоровления она хочет заново начать свой торговый бизнес. Для этого у нее есть торговая точка, но нет товара. Поэтому она обратилась за кредитом. На полученный кредит она намерена закупить картошку и начать торговлю.
texts.en:
Safargul is a resident of the city of Sarband, located in south-western Tajikistan.  She is 50 years old, married, and she has a son and a daughter.

At the moment, her husband and son are working abroad, and her daughter is employed by the administration of road management of the city of Sarband.

As for Safargul, she used to work in retail (for five years), but was forced to cease her activity because she became ill, so she did not work for more than a year.  Having completely recovered, she now wants to resume her commercial activity.  She currently has a retail outlet, but no merchandise.  This is the reason why she has requested a loan.

She intends to use her loan to buy some potatoes and start selling again.

loans.use: Для закупа картошки, чтобы начать свою деятельность

loans.name: Ramaz

texts.en:
Ramaz is 33 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. His parents also live with him in Ditsi village, Gori district. The family has a milk cow which is milked to make cheese which is sold locally at the markets.  They also own a plot of land where they grow haricot, maize, and tomatoes. The harvested products are sold among their villagers and they receive a small monthly income. 

Ramaz requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were always rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. Ramaz is requesting a loan from Credo to start a family business. The Kiva/Credo start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-ups and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Ramaz will use the loan to purchase liquid gas to fill up his gas containers which will be installed in his car. In their village, there is no gas installed in the houses, so he will fill up the big containers and help his villagers to charge their small gas balloons, which is used mainly for cooking. Ramaz is very experienced in this field as he had this business before and still has the containers, which will economize his expenses and grow the profit. Part of the profit will be reinvested in the same business and another part used to cultivate more land and plant more vegetables. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a liquid gas.

loans.name: Odina

texts.ru: Одина живет в сельской местности, не далеко от города. Замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Двое детей дошкольного возраста. Супруг занимается ремонтами и строительствами домов и работает он по сезону. Сама же Одина много лет проработала на ферме дояркой. Во время кризиса в мире так получилось, что сначала задерживали зарплату рабочим , а потом и совсем она попала под сокращение. Она была одна из передовиков на ферме. Бывало, что она в день доила коров  до 100 литров молока. Ей тяжело было расставаться со скотом, она была привязана к нему.  Но была вынуждена покинуть ферму. У нее большой опыт в сфере животноводства. После сокращения она начала разводить скот у себя дома. По началу было тяжко,  но со временем она преодолели все трудности.  По уходу за скотом ей помогают ее старшие дети.  Через соседей она узнала про Арванд, обратилась за кредитом. На полученный кредит она приобретет скот.  Она очень благодарна Арванду за поддержку и планирует дальнейшее сотрудничество.
texts.en:
Odina lives in a rural area just outside of a city.  She's married and has five children.  Two are school-aged.  Her spouse works building and repairing homes and only works seasonally. Odina herself worked for many years on a dairy farm.  During the recent, worldwide crisis, her wages were at first withheld, and then she was laid off all together.  She was one of the farm's best workers, sometimes milking up to one hundred liters.  It was difficult for her to part with her cow, she had bonded with them.  It was, however, inevitable.  

She has quite a bit of experience with livestock. After she was laid off, she began breeding cows on her land.  At first it was difficult, but with time, it became easier.  Her older children help her with the work.  Her neighbor told her about Arvand and she came in for a loan.  With the funds, she will buy livestock.  She is very grateful to Arvand for the support and she plans on further collaboration.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Rer's Group

texts.en:
Rer, 38, lives with her husband and four children in a rural village of the Sangke district, Cambodia. Three of her four children are dependents and still in school. To feed the family, Rer and her husband earn a living through buying and selling garbage and by working for others for a fee in the local area. Having been in this business for 10 years, they earn about 8,000 KHR per day to spend on their family’s needs. 

This is not Rer's first loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans with VisionFund. Rer has used the loans to improve her family’s standard of living and to keep her children in school. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy garbage to resell. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income in order to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy garbage to resell

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en:
Nargiz is from a small village in the Kvareli district. She is married and lives with her 33-year-old son, her daughter-in-law, mother-in-law and two infant granddaughters. Her mother-in-law is provided with a retirement pension. Nargiz is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has a milk cow, a calf and a pig. She milks the cow and produces dairy products for selling. 

In addition, the family has a 0.46 hectare vineyard and 1.75 hectares of agricultural land, where cucumbers and watermelons are grown. They sell the harvested products locally. Nargiz is a very hardworking woman and has rich experience in her business. She requested a loan for purchasing watermelon seeds and fertilizers for the land. The family will be able to grow watermelon for selling and thus increase their income. With increased income Nargiz will provide better living conditions for her family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and watermelon seeds.

loans.name: Serafina

texts.en: Serafina is taking a loan of $1000.00 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks of items to keep in her store such as sleepers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $50.00. Serafina is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sleepers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is 61 years old and is widowed. Josefina sells vegetables in the market. She has been doing this business for five years. She usually receives an income of PHP 2,000 a week. At this moment, Josefina is asking a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy onions, garlic, cabbage, tomatoes, and string beans to sell. She believes that through her loan, her business will improve as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy onions, garlic, cabbage, tomatoes, and string beans to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria has operated a retail store for three years and one month. Aside from the retail store, she also offers viand (tasty dishes) as an additional source of income. Gloria is married with five children; only her youngest child goes to school.

Gloria would like to take out a loan of PHP 30,000 to allow her to buy grocery items such as cooking oil, trays of eggs, kilograms of sugar, canned goods, and soap for her retail store. 

She hopes that lenders will approve her requested loan so she can earn a greater income, which will enable her to cover her household expenses, educate her youngest child, and improve her way of living.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as cooking oil, trays of eggs, kilograms of sugar, canned goods, and soap for her retail store.

loans.name: Foziljon

texts.ru: Фозилчон молодой парень в возрасте 29 лет, женат имеет одного ребёнка. Занимается откармливанием скота у себя дома. Ему помогает в этом жена. Сам Фозилчон по профессии каменщик. Собирает камни в горах и продаёт жителям села для стройки домов. Жена также дома в свободное время занимается шитьем. От купли продаже скота они получают приличный доход и поэтому Фозилчон хочет получить  в Арванд кредит  для  покупки одной головы скота и увеличить свое деятельность. Фозилчон заранее  благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Foziljon is a young man, age 27.  He's married and has one child.  His profession is fattening cattle on his property.  His wife helps him with this work.  Foziljon is a stonemason by trade.  He gathers rocks in the mountains and sells them to villagers to build their homes.  In her spare time, his wife works in the home as a seamstress.  They receive a decent income from the sale of cattle and therefore Foziljon wants to take out a loan with Arvand to buy one cow to expand his business.  Foziljon thanks Arvand for the support.

loans.use: for the purchase of livestock

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
Arif is married. He has four children: a married daughter, aged 35, a married son, aged 34, another son, aged 32, and his youngest, who is 26 years old. The youngest works as a driver, at a water supplies department. Arif is a taxi driver, and as the head of household, his income helps cover the family's expenses, such as food and basic services. His youngest son supports the family financially, as well.

The loan Arif is requesting is to cover the expenses for his car repair work. Arif's dream is to buy a new vehicle, which would provide him with opportunities to work without any risks on the road. He needs Kiva's support, because he has great aspirations to improve his and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To cover the expenses for his taxi car repair work

loans.name: Goychak

texts.en:
Goychak is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. He stands at their yard in front of the stable for the animals.
Goychak is 48 years old and the mother of three children. The children are all grown and have their own families who also need help. This is why Goychak would herself like to help her children. The scope of her engagement is cattle breeding. She keeps cows by her home and sells meat and milk products at the bazaar. She also decided to raise sheep. Goychak plans to sell wool from the sheep and earn a small income from this.

With the loan has applied for, she will buy sheep and cattle for breeding and hopes that her plans are realize.

loans.use: To buy sheep and cattle for breeding.

loans.name: Vi

texts.en:
Vi is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living
conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages

loans.name: Vahan

texts.en:
Vahan has been involved in agriculture for more than 15 years. He runs a farm which includes 10 cows, 2 pigs and 20 chickens. Vahan is a very hardworking farmer and he does his best to gather income and sustain his family. He lives with his wife, son and daughter who help him with the farm.

As Vahan does not have sufficient financial funds to expand his farm, he has applied for this loan. With the loan's help Vahan will purchase  8 oxen for increasing the number of livestock. This will enable him to gather more agricultural income and improve his family's life.

loans.use: to pay for 8 oxen for increasing the number of livestock

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh is requesting a new loan to buy more veterinary medicine and equipment to sell. Her previous loan enabled her to improve both her business and her sales. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, her income, and her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more veterinary medicine and equipment.

loans.name: Nhu

texts.en: Nhu is requesting a new loan to repair her stall in order to have a good place to serve her customers. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To repair her stall in order to have a good place to serve her customers

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Lien is requesting a new loan to buy hairdressing tools and cosmetic products. She took out and repaid a previous loan which helped her expand her business, earn a higher income and provide better support to her family. She hopes that another loan will help her continue to increase the size of her business, raise her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy hair dressing tools and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong is requesting a new loan to buy snack foods and beverages to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy snack foods and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa is requesting a new loan to expand his business. He will use the loan to buy old televisions and speakers so he can repair them and sell them to his customers. Hoa's previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attracting new customers and increasing his sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy old televisions and speakers to repair

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El cliente vive en Guayaquil, el tiene 31 años de edad, empezó vendiendo llaveros en la esquina de la nueve de octubre, luego le sugirieron que vendería más en los centros educativos, y desde ahí a tenido muchas ventas, y a podido abrir un mercado bueno de venta de llaveros.

El trabaja solo, no recibe ayuda de nadie, su labor empieza a las 8:00 de la mañana, termina a las 20:00 de la noche. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de llaveros, las dificultades que se le presentan en su trabajo son: su discapacidad ya que es ciego y en ocasiones le pasan billetes falsos. También cuando llueve y el piso esta mojado suele caerse y es muy peligroso. El no está casado, y no tiene hijos.

Con el préstamo el cliente va a comprar llaveros, y artículos, para poder incrementar su negocio y así tener más ingresos económicos.  Sus metas para un futuro es de tener salud, mejorar su situación económica, tener una casa propia, dar empleo a personas que tienen la misma discapacidad que tiene el, para que esas personas puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
This client is 31 years old and lives in Guayaquil.  He began selling keychains on October 9.  Later it was suggested to him that he could sell more at the schools.  He has made many sales since he has been able to create a new market for keychains.  

The borrower works alone and receives help from no one.  He begins his work selling keychains at 8:00 A.M. and finishes at 8:00 P.M.  The difficulties that he must face in his work include dealing with his disability (he is blind) and the occasional customer who pays with counterfeit money.  Whenever it rains, the ground becomes wet and dangerous since he is at risk of falling.  The borrower is not married and has no children.

With this loan, the borrower will buy keychains and other items so that he can increase his business.  As a result, he will earn more income.  His goals for the future include being healthy, improving his financial situation, and having a house of his own.  He would also like to provide jobs to people who have the same disability so that they can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy keychains and other accessories.

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village in Pursat province’s Kror Kor district, Man is a 43-year-old father of five children. He has been farming rice and repairing motors for several years, earning about 20,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Man is requesting a loan of 4,000,000KHR from VisoinFund to buy fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to grow his rice more productively so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farmland.

loans.name: Luong

texts.en:
Luong is requesting a new loan to buy good quality rices and food ingredients to better serve his customers. This purchase will help him to better attract and satisfy his customers. 

His previous loan enabled him to improve his business. He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his food stall, increasing sales, and help him improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy good quality rices and food ingredients in order to better serve his customers.

loans.name: Nasanbat

texts.en:
Mr. Nasanbat, 38 years old, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. 

His wife has been working as a saleswoman at a private business entity since 2008. He has been rendering taxi service to local people for six years, and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in this field, such as knowing where to pick up customers, and which road is quicker to reach the desired destination. 

The house the family lives in has been deteriorated over the years, and needs some serious repair as well as insulation. Because of the vulnerable house door, the family freezes down to their cores, and frosts forms around the side of the door.  

Nasanbat is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase insulation and building materials such as fiberglass, bricks, cement, and planks. As a result, the family will live in a comfortable and warm place, and burn less coal thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials such as fiberglass, cement, bricks, and planks to repair his house.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
This is Eugenia, 48, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She has children and is married to Larry, a taxi driver. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Eugenia operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy biscuits from a wholesaler, then sell them to customers with a profit. She also has a direct selling business for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales daily.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of biscuits to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Eugenia dreams to have a room for all her products and have more customers. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more quantities of biscuits for repacking.

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en:
Mr.Ganbold is 42 years old lives with his wife and two children in a ger in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife, Dolgor, is a nurse in a local hospital; his son Gantogtoh, 4, and daughter Ganzaya, 3, go to a local kindergarten. 

The borrower has been running organic dairy products sales in a rental counter of a local market since 2010.  To run his business successfully, he has built close relationships with herders and customers. 

He is now requesting 6,900,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of organic milk and dairy products to sell to local customers. He is a hardworking, diligent, and responsible man.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic milk and dairy products to sell to local customers.

loans.name: Marina Del Socorro

texts.es:
Marina es originaria de la linda ciudad de Estelí, su estado civil es soltera no tiene hijos y su edad es de 49 años.

 Se caracteriza por ser una mujer de buenos valores morales.
Marina trabaja como empleada domestica en una familia en Estelí desde hace mas de cinco años su función es preparar los alimentos, lavar ropa y cuidar a los hijos de la familia empleadora.
