solicita un crédito a Marina para comprar un refrigerador, ya que lo necesita para refrigerar sus alimentos. 

manifiesta que los créditos anteriores han sido de gran importancia para el desarrollo de su familia, ya que ha mejorado su vivienda y ha comprado algunos electrodomésticos.
texts.en:
Marina is 49 years old, single, and does not have children. She is a native of the beautiful city of Estelí. She says she is known for being a person with good moral values.

For more than five years Marina has been a domestic worker for a family in Estelí. She prepares meals, washes clothes and cares for the children of her employer.

Marina is requesting this loan to buy a refrigerator to keep her food fresh. She says the previous loans she has received were very important for her family since they allowed her to make home improvements and buy a few appliances.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Seam

texts.en:
Seam, 52, lives with her husband and seven children in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. Three of their children are dependents and still in school. To feed the family, Seam and her husband earn a living as farmers and have been farming rice and chilies for 18 years, earning about 20,000 Riels (KHR) per day to spend for their family's needs.

Seam has had and repaid three loans through VisionFund, which have helped her to relieve her family's financial burden. Now she is leading her group to request a loan. Seam wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor costs. She hopes this loan will her to get a high yield from her plantation so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: María Girlesa

texts.es:
María de 43 años de edad, desde que se casó se dedicó a su hogar y posteriormente al cuidado de sus dos hijos de once y ocho años de edad. Para contribuir con  los gastos del hogar comenzó a vender calzado importado de España, ya que una prima se encuentra radicada en este país.
Desde hace año y medio se separó de su esposo y debió asumir todas las responsabilidades de su casa y la educación de sus hijos ya que su cónyuge no se hizo cargo. Gracias a su actividad esta mujer les brinda a sus hijos alimentación y una vivienda diga. Hoy quiere dedicarse de lleno a su negocio con el fin de generar mayores ganancias y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, por esta razón se  encuentra solicitado un crédito para la compra de calzado.
Su mayor sueño es poder garantizarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad y mejores oportunidades económicas.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old. After she was married, María worked maintaining her house and then caring for her two children, ages 11 and 8. To contribute toward household expenses, she began to sell footwear imported from Spain, which is where her cousin lives.

A year and half ago, María separated from her husband and had to assume all of the responsibilities of her home, including the education of her children, because her husband has not taken responsibility. Thanks to her footwear business, María has been able to provide her children with food and a good home. Now María would like to work full-time at her business with the intention of generating more profit and improving her family’s living conditions. For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy footwear. Her greatest dream is to be able to guarantee her children a quality education and better economic opportunities.

loans.use: to buy footwear.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Las Emprendedoras es un grupo de 17 mujeres de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, son conocidas en el barrio por su gran unión y trabajo. Se esfuerzan por salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias para que puedan tener todo lo que necesitan para salir adelante.
Perla es miembro de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, es una buena vendedora y sus clientes siempre están muy contentos con los productos que les ofrece. Cuenta que empezó con muy poco, pero que gracias a su esfuerzo está saliendo adelante.
Solicita de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de buzos, camperas, medias, gorras y demás, ya que se acerca la época de frío y quiere poder tener un buen stock para poder seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Las Emprendedoras [The Entrepreneurs] is a group with 17 female members from the city of Villa Elisa. They are well-known in the neighborhood due to their strong unity and hard work. They do their utmost to get ahead and help their families, so that they can have everything that they need to move forward in life.

Perla is a member of this group, and works selling all kinds of clothing. She is good at this job, and her customers are always really happy with the products that she offers. She says that she started her business with very little but, thanks to her hard work, she is doing well.

Perla has requested this loan to be able to buy sweatpants, jackets, socks, caps, and other items. The cold season is coming soon, so she wants to have good stock levels so that she can continue offering items to her customers.

loans.use: To buy sweatpants, jackets, socks, caps, and other items.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 62 years old and lives in Marapong, Sibutad. She is married and has 4 children.

Norma has a rug and potholder making business and earns approximately 3500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to purchase used cloth needed to make a product.

Norma has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing needed to make a product

loans.name: Edelberto Antonio

texts.es:
El joven Edelberto Antonio vive en una comarca al sur de la capital casado, trabaja  como jardinero en una universidad es un joven responsable, honesto  realiza su trabajo con mucho entusiasmo ya que considera que con su trabajo  está aportando a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y es por esta razón que está solicitando a kiva y ceprodel  un crédito para hacer un anexo en su vivienda para acondicionar el área de  la cocina  para darles mayor comodidad y seguridad  a su pequeños hijos y su esposa.

Agradeciendo mucho por el crédito ya que de esta manera podrá ir mejorando su casa de habitación
texts.en:
Edelberto Antonio lives in a region to the south of the capital.  He's married and works as a gardener at a university.  He's a responsible and honest young man who does his job with great enthusiasm because he thinks his job is bringing better living conditions to his family.

This is why he's requesting a loan from Kiva and CEPRODEL.  He's going to put an addition on his house to set up the kitchen area and give his young children and his wife greater comfort and security.

He's grateful for the loan because he'll be able to keep on improving his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Sokong's Group

texts.en:
Sokong, 32, is married with four dependent children; three are in school while the remaining one is too young for school. Her family lives in a house with a thatch roof located in Battambang province's Moung Russey district and the main sources of her family's income are from farming rice and growing chilies. She has been running her business for 11 years, earning about 25,000 Riels (KHR) per day.

She has had five loans from Kiva's partner, VisionFund, and has effectively used them to sustain her family's business, support her family's needs and save some money from the earnings for the future. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields to earn more income to make a living better and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Santos Avilio

texts.es:
El señor santos avilio vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja  en un cetro de compra de Managua en el área de limpieza empezando su jornada de trabajo a las 7 de la mañana y terminando a las 4 pm.

Padre de familia responsable siempre pendiente por el bienestar de su familia.

Don santo está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de zinc  y madera para hacerle el cambio del entechado de su casa que está en mal estado.

Agradeciendo mucho a kiva y ceprodel porque gracias a los crédito que se le han otorgado ha mejorado su casa  para mayor comodidad para su familia.
texts.en:
Santos Avilio lives in the city of Managua.  He works in cleaning services in a shopping center in Managua, starting his day at 7 in the morning and finishing at 4 in the afternoon.  He's a responsible father, always looking after his family's welfare.

Santos is requesting a loan to invest in buying corrugated metal and wood to change the roof of his house, which is in bad condition.

He's very grateful to Kiva and CEPRODEL because thanks to the loans he has received he has improved his house so his family can be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Heb's Group

texts.en:
Heb is 47 and married. She has two children. Living in a village of the Ek Phnom district, Hem has farmed rice and raised cows for 4 years. She complements that income by selling desserts. Heb manages to earn about 70,000 Riels (KHR) per day to feed her family.

Heb has taken out and completely repaid five loans through VisionFund. The loans have helped her better support her family with enough food. Now leading her group to ask for a loan, Heb wants to use her portion to buy rice seeds for her farmland and to pay for plowing the field. She hopes to increase her crop yield so as to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Ben's Group

texts.en:
Ben, 63, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Ek Phnom district. She has six children. She has been farming rice and catching fish for 31 years, and the current business earns her family about 40,000 Riels (KHR) per day.

There are two members in this group and they both have had six loans from VisionFund. Ben completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her better support her current business. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy a boat to support her fishing business. She hopes to catch more fish so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: To buy a boat to support her fishing business

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en:
Ma. Linda is 43 years old and lives in Tugas, Baliangao. She is married and has 4 children.

To earn a living, Ma. Linda has a business selling snacks. She earns about 3200 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Ma. Linda has requested a loan to pay her son's tuition fees.

Ma. Linda has been a member of PMPC for almost 10 years.

loans.use: To pay her son's tuition fees

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr Francisco es comerciante hace más de15 años, tiene una despensa y carnicería en su casa en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo.
Está casado con la Sra. Ana hace mas de 30 años tuvieron 4 Hijos que ya son todos mayores de edad e independientes a ellos. También cuenta que comenzó desde muy abajo, que tuvo que aguantar muchas cosas para salir adelante, que gracias a su esfuerzo y el de su Señora ya tienen una despensa y carnicería bien surtida.
Cuenta que su mayor sueño es que su hija pueda culminar su estudio universitario, que sea una profesional y que pueda trabajar, para no pasar por los que ellos han pasado.
El solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de animales para la faena y venta en su carnicería, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Francisco has been a merchant for more than 15 years.  He has a store and butcher shop in his house in the city of Coronel Oviedo.

He has been married to Ana for more than 30 years.  They had four children, all of them adults now and independent.

He says he started at the bottom and had to suffer a lot to get ahead.  Thanks to his effort and his wife's, now they have a well-stocked store and butcher shop.

He says his biggest dream is for his daughter to finish her university studies, become a professional, and be able to work so she doesn't have to go through what they have.

He's requesting this loan to invest in buying animals to butcher and sell in his butcher shop.  This way he'll be able to continue filling his customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy animals to butcher and sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To build up his capital again by buying shoes for resale.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is 66 years old and lives in Salimpuno. She is married and has four children. Lydia has a shop that sells assorted groceries and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan to purchase additional inventory of groceries and beverages. Lydia has been a member of PMPC for almost six years.

loans.use: To purchase 20 boxes of assorted grocery items and beverages

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado 8 de Diciembre está en su ciclo número 14 del programa de comité, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde cinco integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, pero se esfuerza por salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Marta, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno. Ella comenta que se dedica a la venta de comidas, venta de ropas y otras actividades con lo cual tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y darles todo lo que necesitan. Ella se define como una persona muy luchadora y sacrificada.
Marta solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas, ya que con ello podrá seguir ofreciendo gran variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group called "8 de Diciembre" [December 8th] is in its fourteenth cycle with the committee program, where everyone works and helps one another to get ahead.  They are carrying out a poverty elimination survey; five members find themselves below the poverty line, but they work hard to get ahead. 

One of the group members is Marta; in her last survey, she showed a poverty level within level one.  She says that she makes a living in selling foods, clothing, and in other activities; through this, she has the means to to be able to help her family and to give them everything they need.  She is defined as a very fighting and self-sacrificing person.

Marta is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of items, so that she will be able to continue offering a great variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena, de 58 años de edad, está casada con Roberto quien es artesano y padre de sus 2 hijos Wilson de 27 años y Neri de 21 años de edad respectivamente.  Vive en compañía de su esposo, sus hijos y 2 nietos, en su propia casa.Elena se dedica a la venta de comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, pan, huevos, entre otros ,para esto estableció una bodega en su propia casa. Atiende amablemente a sus clientes desde muy temprano y afortunadamente le va muy bien porque ya tiene 2 años dedicándose a este trabajo y ha logrado crecer a base de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Trabaja sola aunque en algunas ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su hija. Considera que su negocio es rentable por las ganancias que a diario obtiene y por las ventas que a diario realiza, además estos ingresos económicos le sirven para comprar todo lo que hace falta en su hogar.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 400, está contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le permite avanzar con el progreso de su negocio y asegura que será puntal con el pago de sus cuotas . Con el monto solicitado comprará productos comestibles al por mayor para su bodega, como azúcar, arroz, huevos , entre otros.
texts.en:
Elena, 58 years old, is married to Robert who is an artisan and the father of her two children, 27-year-old Wilson and 21-year-old Neri. She lives in the company of her husband, her children and two grandchildren, in her own house.

Elena makes a living selling food such as rice, sugar, bread and eggs, among others. For this purpose she established a bodega in her own house. She attends to her clients with kindness from very early and luckily it has been going well because she has had this business for 2 years and she has succeeded in growing it through much effort and dedication. She works alone although on occasions she receives help from her daughter. She considers her business to be profitable based on the daily revenues and sales. In addition, this economic income helps her buy everything that she needs for her home.

At this opportunity she is requesting 400 soles. She is happy to know that she has the financial support to advance with the progress of her business and she commits to being punctual with her payments. With the requested amount she will buy edible products at wholesale for her bodega, such as sugar, rice and eggs, among others.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar and eggs, among others

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en: Age 53, Peninah is a married lady with five children who resides in Kagadi, Uganda. She operates a produce business where she sells beans and ground nuts. She has run this business for seven years now. She also farms to supplement her income. Her dream is to build a permanent house for her family despite having inadequate capital. Peninah is requesting a loan to buy beans and ground nuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and ground nuts to sell.

loans.name: Barrio Alegre Group

texts.es:
Barrio Alegre es un grupo de la ciudad de Caacupé, donde las integrantes vieron una gran oportunidad de progreso para ellas y sus familias. Son 24 mujeres que se esfuerzan día a día para salir adelante.
Nicasia es una de estas mujeres, y comenta que gracias a su grupo ha logrado mejorar mucho y salir adelante, su familia se ha visto beneficiada y su negocio ha mejorado. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y con ello está dando a su familia todo lo que necesitan, y que no les falte nada.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de frutas de estación, como ser bananas, piñas, naranjas, y demás. Agradecen todas las integrantes por la oportunidad que están ofrecieciendoles, pues les ayudarán a crecer.
texts.en:
Barrio Alegre [Happy Neighborhood] is a group in the city of Caacupe, where the members saw a great opportunity for progress for themselves and their families. They are 24 women who make an effort day by day to get ahead.

Nicasia is one of these women, and she says that thanks to her group she has succeeded in improving greatly and moving forward. Her family has benefited and her business has gotten better. She makes a living selling fruits and with this business she is giving her family all that they need, so that they do not want for anything. 

She is requesting this loan to buy seasonal fruits, such as bananas, pineapples, oranges and others. 

She is grateful to all of the members for the opportunity they are offering her, since they help each other to grow.

loans.use: to buy bananas, pineapples, oranges and other fruits

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 56 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga. She is married with three children. 

To earn a living, Concepcion has a business selling snacks. She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. Concepcion has requested a loan to buy raw ingredients needed to make snacks to sell.

Concepcion has been a member of PMPC for nearly eight years.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed to make snacks to sell.

loans.name: Faisi

texts.en:
Age 50, Faisi is a married woman with five children who lives in Kagadi, Uganda. For five years now she has been selling fish. The business is very lucrative since fish is a staple food in the area. She also farms to supplement her income.

Being the good mother that she is, Faisi desires to educate her children so they may attain college degrees. Faisi intends to use the loan to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Alexa

texts.en:
Alexa  is 65 years old and lives in Libertad, Sapang Dalaga. She is married with five children. 

Alexa has a shop where she sells ripe bananas. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan to purchase raw bananas.

Alexa has been a member of PMPC for nearly nine years.

loans.use: To purchase 200 kilos of raw bananas.

loans.name: Gladis Margarita

texts.es: Doña Gladis de 38 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de  maiz y maicillo, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en casa propia pero no posee los servicios basicos (agua y luz),pero con lo que vende de sus granos basicos puede llevar un poco de lo que su familia necesita junto con su esposo, ella solicita credito para poder comprar mas insumos agricolas y asi seguirle dando lo que su familia necesita.
texts.en:
Gladis, 38, cultivates corn and sorghum. She lives with her husband and their four children in their own home but do not have basic services (water and electricity), but with what she makes selling the grains, she can provide a little of what her family needs along with her husband.

She is requesting this loan to buy more agricultural supplies so she can keep providing what her family needs.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
This is Guillerma, age 45, who is a resident of Batasan, Quezon City in the Philippines. She is married to Elizaldy, a self employed man, and she is a mother to her children. She and her family manage their own business while sustaining their everyday expenses.

Guillerma operates a bookbinding business. This business is in demand, especially by schools and businesses. Aside from her bookbinding business, she also has a photocopy and printing center. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy cover binding, bond paper, toner and other things needed in her business.

Guillerma hopes to have other branches and dreams of attracting more customers. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for materials such as cover binding, paper and toner for her business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 57 years old, married, and has five children.  She is a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines.  She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Anita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by  the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Anita is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.  She hopes to make it big in business and become successful. She dreams of giving her family a good life.  Anita meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages .

loans.name: Mbabazi

texts.en:
Mbabazi is 30 years old, married, and has four children who attend school. She owns a retail shop in Kagadi, Uganda and has been in this business for two years. She also rears animals to supplement her income. She was inspired in this business by a good lifestyle that she wanted to live compared to the poverty that she was born in. 

Mbabazi is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy soda and general merchandise to sell.  She dreams of building a  house for her family and educating them up to the university level.

loans.use: to purchase soda and general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es: Deisy tiene la edad de 62 años, está casada y vive con el esposo. Ella el crédito lo quiere para la compra de abono y semillas y un poco de materiales para iniciar un proyecto de hidroponía. Ella desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al proyecto para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Deisy is 62 years old, is married and lives with her spouse. She would like a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds, as well as some supplies to begin a hydroponic project. She would like to be able to adequately maintain the project so that the can have better production and thus more economic gains. 

In the future, she hopes to give a better quality of life and economic stability to her family, and she also hopes to continue growing as a person and as a producer. This is the first loan that she has received from FEDECOSUR. She has never had a bank loan before, but FUDECOSUR has given her a loan that is easier to access and that has a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy hydroponic supplies.

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 34 year old woman with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She has a bar and with the proceeds she has been able to pay school fees for children.

Her main clients are bus an taxi drivers and hence she is assured of sales everyday.  Price fluctuation and lack of appropriate storage facilities pose a challenge to her business growth while her dream is to own a modern bar.  Jackline intends to use the loan to buy a deep freezer.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
This is Zenaida.  Her previous loan was a big help for her business.  She was able to buy all the needed products and supplies and she was able to generate more income.  She has been in this business for ten years now.  As a widow, she is working hard to provide income for her family's everyday needs and expenses.

She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of supplies and products like dresses and shirts.  Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Zenaida dreams to have a bigger place for her business and hopes to have a happy life.  She meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners that gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of supplies and products such as dresses and shirts that she needs in her business

loans.name: Blesilda

texts.en:
This is Blesilda.  She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of curtains, bed sheets, pillow cases and other dry goods.  Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy different kinds of dry goods like curtains, bed sheets, pillow cases and other products.  Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Blesilda hopes to have more goods to sell and to have more customers.  She dreams to give her children a good and high quality education.  She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for curtains, bed sheets, pillowcases and other dry goods needed in her business.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: .Silvia, de 30 años de edad, está casada con Jorge Luis quien es padre de su hijo de 2 años, además ella tiene 4 hijos más de su primer esposo, vive junto a toda su familia en su casa propia la cual llego a obtener gracias a su trabajo. La actividad que realiza Silvia es la venta de dulces de hielo conocidos en su ciudad como “chupetes”, cuenta con una refrigeradora y recipientes de congelación donde coloca sus productos para venderlos en un colegio ubicado cerca a su casa en donde cuenta con un puesto fijo. Prepara los chupetes con frutas frescas regionales como guanábana, mango,coco o banana. Se inició en esta actividad hace más de 6 años y hasta el momento lo realiza ella sola. Considera a su  negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tienen sus productos . Complementa este negocio con la venta de bebidas gasificadas de diversos tamaños y sabores.Le gusta su negocio ya que le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual puede solventar los gastos de su hogar y las necesidades de sus hijos quienes son su principal motivación para seguir progresando, por tanto tiene planes de seguir adelante y ampliar la capacidad de productos disponibles. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1200 soles, está contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le permite avanzar con el progreso de su negocio por otro lado asegura que será puntal con el pago de sus cuotas .Con el monto solicitado comprará ingredientes que usa en la elaboración de los dulces de hielo tales como frutas, azúcar y bolsas y tambien comprará bebidas gasificadas.
texts.en:
Silvia, 30, is married to Luis, the father of her two-year-old son. She has four more children from her previous marriage. Silvia lives with her family in their own house, which she bought thanks to her job. Silvia sells frozen sweets, known as “chupetes” in her city. She has a freezer and containers where she displays her products in a school located near her house, where she also sells them.
Silvia makes the chupetes with fresh fruits found locally, such as soursop, mango, coconut or banana. She started this line of work more than six years ago, and so far, she has worked alone. She considers her business to be fairly profitable because of the demand her products have. She complements this business selling different types and sizes of sodas. Silvia enjoys her work, because it gives her an income to support the home expenses and her children’s needs, which are her motivation to progress. She has plans to keep working and expand her capacity.

Silvia is requesting a loan of 1200 soles [PEN]. She is happy because she knows that this financial support will help her get ahead with her business. She promises to pay the installments on time. With the money, she will buy some supplies she needs for making her frozen sweets, such as fruits, sugar and bags, and she will also buy sodas.

loans.use: to buy fruits and sodas.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 29 year old businessman in Thika.  He is a shoe maker as well as a cobbler.  This is a business he has done for the past three years.  He is married to Ann and together they are blessed with two children.  Julius earns a monthly income of KES 13,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his second business loan from KADET LTD.  He will use the loan to purchase more leather and shoe soles for his shoe making business.  He will use the proceeds from the business to educate his children.  He hopes to have a well sustained family.

loans.use: to purchase  more leather and shoe soles

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 44 years old and lives in Landing, Baliangao.  She is a widow with 4 children. 

Juanita works in the fish industry and catches and sells fish for a living.  She has been doing this for 2 years.  She has requested a loan to purchase fishing tools.  Jaunita has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Jemmy

texts.en:
Jemmy is 39 years old, married, and has five children. She has been farming for about five years and earns an income of about 8,300 KES.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting. She hopes to be a great farmer and open a retail shop in order to boost her profits. Her income enables her to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 36 years old married with six children between the age of three and 15 years.  She has been running her retail shop for a period of two years with an income of approximately 7,500 KES a month. 

She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD and wants to use it to buy stocks of flour, soap and detergent for sale.  She hopes to own a wholesale shop and a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: to buy stocks of flour, soap and detergent for sale.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is married with 2 children.  Thelma is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Thelma is a farmer and grows cattle and pigs to earn a living.  She has been doing this for 5 years.  She has requested a loan to purchase construction materials needed for house repair.  Thelma has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials needed for house repair

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos de 25 años de edad, es un hombre muy responsable, honesto y trabajador. Actualmente vive con su familia, se dedica a ser agricultor su principal siembra es el maíz. Carlos solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Carlos is 25 years old. He says he is very responsible, honest and hardworking. He lives with his family and works as a farmer. His principle crop is corn.

Carlos is requesting this loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticide and other agricultural supplies. He hopes to receive this help because he has no other source of credit and he wants to continue to bring home bread to his family each day without interruption.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticide and other agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
Las 14 integrantes cuentan con actividades variadas, cada una de ellas se esfuerza y dan todo de sí, en las capacitaciones y son muy optimistas ya que desean crecer. Las Señoras están muy agradecidas con kiva y Fundación paraguaya por el gran apoyo que les brinda atreves de los créditos.
Maria es la presidenta de este grupo y dice que gracias a su trabajo su economía mejoro mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo y con ello da a su familia todo lo que necesitan para que no les falte nada. Maria se ha hecho de muy buena clientela ya que sus comestibles son muy ricos y sus clientes siempre le hacen muchos pedidos.
Pide este crédito para la compra de carne, verduras, condimentos y demás insumos para poder seguir deleitando a sus clientes con los ricos comestibles que hace.
texts.en:
The 14 members of the group carry out various activities; each one of them displays energy and in training sessions they give their all. They are very optimistic, now that they are committed to growth. And the women are very grateful to Kiva and the Fundacion Paraguaya for the great help that's offered through these loans.

Maria is president of this group and she says that, thanks to her work, her economic situation is much improved. She dedicates herself to selling foods of all types. And with her earnings, she provides her family with all they need so they will lack nothing. Maria has built a very good clientele because her foods are very tasty and her customers always have many requests.

Maria is requesting this loan to purchase meat, vegetables, condiments, and other supplies to be able to continue delighting her customers with the rich foods she prepares.

loans.use: buy meat, vegetables, condiments, and other food supplies.

loans.name: Olga Mercedes

texts.es:
Olga tiene 32 años de edad estado civil soltera vive con sus padres vive en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la Vrc Nuevos Horizontes, esta conformada por 13 socios se encuentra a  40 minutos de la comunidad santa Martha perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura.

Olga se dedica a la  agricultura a la siembra y venta de naranjilla, además se dedica a la crianza de ganado. Solicita el crédito para la compra de urea, fungicidas, semilla, abono para la naranjilla. Con el crédito que le otorga la cooperativa mejorara la calidad en el producto.

Sus compras las realiza en el cantón Guaranda. El sueño es ser mejores productores.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son no poder comunicarse no tener medio de transporte y las plagas. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir de paseo.

"Esta muy agradecida por el crédito anterior".
texts.en:
Olga is 32, single, and lives with her parents in the Guaranda province of Bolivar.

She is a member of the VRC Nuevos Horizontes (New Horizons), which is dedicated to agriculture, made up of 13 members and located 40 minutes from the town of Santa Martha in Guaranda.

Olga plants and sells naranjilla (an edible orange fruit cultivated in South America). She also raises cattle. She is requesting a loan to buy urea, fungicides, seed and fertilizer for the naranjilla. With the loan granted by the cooperative, she will improve the quality of her product. She makes her purchases in Guaranda. Her dream is to be a top producer.

Some challenges she faces are not being able to communicate, not having transportation and pests. 

During her free time she likes to take walks.

She is very grateful for the previous loan.

loans.use: urea, fungicides, seed, fertilizer for naranjilla.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius, now 51 years old, used his previous loan amount to buy more stock of goods to sell in his retail shop. These goods included cooking fat, sugar, flour, and tea leaves, among other items. It was profitable and he was able to pay back the loan amount. 

Besides the retail shop, he also has a butchery business. He sells meat and also supplies meat to several hotels and restaurants in town.

This is his fifth loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to use the amount to buy more stock of meat for selling. He anticipates that he will generate more income, since the demand for meat is high. He will use the generated profits to pay school fees for his children.

Pius hopes to open another butchery shop as well as expand his retail shop to a wholesale shop. This would make him more income and allow him to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Mujeres Divinas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está integrado por 20 mujeres, todas ellas madres de familias que se esfuerzan por salir adelante y dar todo lo que necesitan a sus familias. Son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que luchan por salir adelante.
Maria, una de las integrantes se dedica a la olería, hace todo tipo de materiales de construcción, con el cual surte a algunas empresas y construcciones. Cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela y que con esto está saliendo adelante y está creciendo en su negocio.
Ella pide este crédito para la compra de arcilla, ya que así podrá seguir haciendo los materiales para la venta, ya que tiene pedidos con los que le gustaría poder cumplir. Agradece ya que su grupo está muy contento con la oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
This group is composed of 20 women, all of whom are mothers and who make an effort to get ahead and provide all that is necessary to their families. They are hardworking and enterprising women who struggle to move forward.

Maria, one of the members, works in pottery. She makes all types of construction materials, which she supplies to various business and construction sites. She says that she has a very good clientele and that with this, she is getting ahead and her business is growing.

She is requesting this loan to buy clay, so that she will be able to continue making the materials that she sells, since she already has orders which she would like to deliver. She is thankful since her group is very happy with the opportunity they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy clay to make construction materials

loans.name: Saigo Enole

texts.en:
Saigo's faming business is doing well, and she has since paid off her loan successfully. She has now acquired a bigger portion of land where she plans to plant different types of crops.

Saigo is hardworking and has acquired a third loan of 40,000 KES to purchase sheep and goats for fattening and resale. She hopes to use the increased proceeds to expand her farming business as well as educate her children.

Saigo's hopes and dreams are to see her family's living standards improve.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent, a 41-year-old man from Bugesera District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda, is married to Grace and has two children. He is a shopkeeper, and in May of 2012 started selling LED lights. To this point he has sold 100 lights, providing clean energy to 500 people.

Vincent is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Vincent will reinvest the money he makes into expanding this enterprise to earn more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Reina Concepción

texts.es:
Reina tiene 27 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos. Se separo de su esposo, debido a que la maltrataba sus hijos tienen nueve años y una niña de tres años. Ella se dedica a vender frutas y verduras de manera ambulante de casa en casa en un canasto. Además, realiza trabajos agrícolas, cultiva 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz junto con su hermano. Así mismo, cría animales en su casa, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres. Desde la edad de los ocho años, salía a vender tamales y platos típicos. Su vida ha sido muy difícil desde pequeña, pero sigue adelante trabajando por un futuro mejor para sus hijos. Se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. a preparar a sus hijos y llevarlos a la casa de su mamá para que los cuide, mientras tanto ella se va a trabajar.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar tres toretes para repasto y pagar el alquiler del terreno en donde cultiva.  Con la inversión, podrá contar con animales para trabajar y venderlos cuando estén gordos y paguen un buen precio por ellos y tendrá seguro el terreno para seguir cultivando.  Su propósito, es que sus hijos estudien en la universidad, pues ella no tubo esa oportunidad y construir un muro de protección en su casa y cambiarle el techo; pues esta muy deteriorado.
texts.en:
Reina is 27 years old and a single mother of two children. She separated from her husband because he mistreated her children, a 9-year-old boy and a 3-year-old girl. She makes a living selling fruits and vegetables walking from house to house with a basket. In addition, she carries out agricultural work. She cultivates 7,000 square meters of corn together with her brother. Also, she raises animals in her house, an activity that she learned from her parents.

Since 8 years old, she went out to sell tamales and traditional food. Her life has been very difficult since she was young, but she continues forward working for a better future for her children. She gets up at 4:00 a.m. to get her children ready and to take them to her mother's house so she can care for them while she goes to work.

The loan she is requesting from Fundacion Campo is to buy three young bulls to raise and to pay the rent on the land that she cultivates. With the investment, she will be able to have animals that she can sell when they are fat and fetch a good price, and she will have secured the land so she can continue cultivating. Her goal is for her children to study in the university since she did not have that opportunity, and to construct a protective wall around her house and to change the roof since it is very dilapidated.

loans.use: to buy three young bulls to raise and to pay rent on the land that she cultivates

loans.name: Jacob Wanambisi

texts.en:
Jacob used his previous loan to to buy more firewood and 10 bags of charcoal, got into the brick-making business, and supplied bricks to people who are building and to developing plots.

Right now, his monthly income from the business is 60000 KES. He is borrowing a loan of 60000 KES, which he intends to use to purchase more stock of firewood. 

He will pay his kids' school fees with the anticipated profits from the business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood and charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two bicycles for his children to travel back and forth to school.

loans.name: Guarapi Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Guarapi está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde se están esforzando por salir adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Ellas son mujeres luchadoras y por sobre todo emprendedoras.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Blanca quien  se dedica a la decoración de eventos. Cuenta que se hizo de muy buena clientela ya que siempre hace muy buenos trabajos y sus clientes quedan muy satisfechos. Su sueño es poder tener un gran local de decoraciones para poder seguir dando a sus clientes lo que necesitan.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas para su decoración, lo que le ayudará a dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Ella y sus amigas agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo, ya que es ayuda no solo para ellas sino también para sus familias.
texts.en:
The Guarapi Group is in its third loan cycle of the women’s committee program. In this program, everyone is striving to get ahead and to help each other through teamwork. The members are all fighters and, above all, entrepreneurs. 

One of the members of the group is Blanca, who has an event decoration business. She says she has gained a very good following of customers because she always does a good job and her customers are very satisfied with her work. Her dream is to have a large decoration shop, from which she could continue to meet her customers’ needs. 

Blanca is requesting this loan to buy decorative fabrics to better serve her customers. She and her friends are grateful for the opportunity they are being given, because it not only helps them, but their families as well.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for her event decoration business.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 40 years old, married, and the mother of three children. For the last ten years, she has earned a living by selling water in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of 5,000 KES. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for her second loan of 20,000 KES to purchase a new water pump for use in her business. Charity will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children, as well as to expand her business.

Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she can help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to purchase a new water pump to be used for her business.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene la edad de 23 años, es casada y tiene un hijo. Ella el crédito lo quiere para la compra de semilla de plátano para iniciar este proyecto junto su esposo en una pequeña propiedad que tienen. Ella quiere iniciar este negocio para empezar a producir plátanos para venderlos en las ferias y en los supermercados. Ella manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y le ha brindaron muchas facilidades. Ella espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Isabel is 23 years old and married with one son.  She is requesting a loan to buy plantain seeds to start a project with her ​​husband on a small property they own.  She wants to start a business producing plantains to sell at fairs and in supermarkets.  

Isabel states that her credit committee has been helpful and provided her a lot of assistance.  She hopes that this project will grow and achieve its objectives and in the future will provide her family a better quality of life and improved economic stability.  

This is Isabel's first loan with Kiva partner FUDECOSUR.  She had not had other loans before through state banks because FUDECOSUR was able to provide a loan more efficiently and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy plantain seeds.

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Genie

texts.en:
Genie is 36 years old and lives in Libertad, Sapang Dalaga. She is married (but separated) with five children. 

To earn a living, Genie has a business selling ripe bananas. She earns about PHP 2800 each month doing this type of work. Genie has a requested a loan to purchase unripe bananas.

Genie has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: To purchase 50 kilos of unripe bananas

loans.name: Ray

texts.es: Ray, de 43 años de edad, está casado con Delia quien es ama de casa y madre de sus 4 hijos con quienes viven en su casa propia.Ray se dedica a la venta de repuestos para motos y mototaxis, brinda servicio de vulcanizado, cambio de aceite, lubricación, bajada de motor y otras funciones .Para desarrollar esta actividad cuenta con un local propio acondicionado en su hogar en donde pone a la venta todos los repuestos que requieren sus clientes como pistones, bujía, aros, llantas, frenos, entre otros , además atiende cuidadosamente a todos los clientes que acuden a solicitar su servicio ,razón por la cual lleva en este negocio 7 años y trabaja con la ayuda de su familia. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tienen sus productos gracias al constante crecimiento del sector vehicular en su ciudad. Afortunadamente gracias a los buenos resultados que esta obteniendo , sus ingresos económicos se han incrementado y su camino al progreso continúa, es por ello que desea complementar con nuevas funciones a su establecimiento y contar con el paquete completo de servicio vehicular . En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles y está contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le permite avanzar con el progreso de su negocio.Con el monto solicitado comprará repuestos de motos como ejes, llantas, bujías y frenos que son los productos mas solicitados en su puesto de trabajo.
texts.en:
Ray, 43 years old, is married to Delia who is a housewife and mother of their 4 children. They live together in their own house. Ray sells replacement parts for motorbikes and moto-taxis. He offers services such as vulcanizing, oil changes, lubrication, motor repair, and other functions. 

To carry out this activity, Ray uses his own shop, which he constructed in his house. Here he sells all the replacement parts his customers require, such as pistons, spark plugs, piston rings, tires, and brakes, among others. In addition, he attends with care to all the customers who come by to request his services. That's how he has survived in this business for 7 years. He works with the help of his family. 

Ray considers his business sufficiently profitable due to the demand that exists for his products, thanks to the constant growth of the vehicular sector in his city. Fortunately, thanks to the good results the business obtains, his economic income has increased and his path to progress continues. That's why he wants to complement it with new services in his establishment, and to count on a complete package of vehicular services. 

On this occasion, Ray is requesting 1,500 sols, and he feels content in the knowledge that he has the financial help that will permit him to continue the progress of his business. With the requested funds, he will purchase replacement parts for vehicles, including axles, tires, spark plugs, and brakes, which are the products most requested in his shop.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for motor vehicles, including tires, brakes, and spark plugs.

loans.name: Lomgoul Group

texts.en:
Widowed at a very young age and with her two kids to take care of, Henei is the featured member with the raised hand. She is a member of the Lomgoul Group. After her husband passed away, she moved back to her poor parents' home with her kids. Tragedy struck when her younger daughter was found drowned in the nearby pond, which shook Henei’s life and became the reason to continue to live her life. Starting a new life without her husband and her deceased daughter wasn’t easy at all, but her son would be an orphan if Henei lost hope and cursed herself for the plight she faces. Her son is the only reason why she is back in form to continue her life and start off the business to support her son and herself. Her group members also supported and encouraged her in all possible ways.

 Henei started her own business by selling cosmetic and grocery products.  She used to get the stock from the nearby Army canteen and sold it with a profit in the village and nearby markets. Her supplies consist of talcum powders, hair oils, detergent soaps, tooth-paste, milk powder, detergent powder, etc. With the little profit she made, she also started selling used clothes in her village and neighbouring villages. She gets the used clothes from the main town, which is about 30 kms from the village where she resides. 

 With the extension of the loan from Kiva, Henei decided to get more used clothes from the main market consisting of  T-shirts, Medi-Pants, summer pants, shorts, and cotton shirts as she feels that summer is approaching and selling these items will bring more money. She will sell used clothes as well as continue stocking army canteen supplies for the villagers and the nearby shops.

Henei's dream is to own a house of her own that she and her son can share without feeling any obligations towards anyone. Her community has shown her more support than she feels she and her son deserve. Thus, she is hopeful that with the loan, she will formulate a way to earn her monthly income and do some saving to let her dreams come true.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a 38-year-old man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He operates a shop and  he started the business in order to get daily income since farming and his salary as a teacher could hardly facilitate him in meeting the family basic needs. The high cost of rent and price fluctuations affect his business while his dream is to own a wholesale shop and upgrade his studies. Wilson intends to use the loan to pay his own school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en:
Sambath is 36 years old and a married mother of three schoolchildren. She resides in Sangke district of Battambang Province. She deals with her family’s hardships through rice farming with support from her husband who uses his spare time to earn extra income via working for other for a fee.  Her original loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) was three loan cycles ago. She has made good use of her previous loans to relieve the family’s burden and keep up a good living standard gradually. 

Now, she is leading a group of four to apply for a new loan. Her group's requested microloan with VisionFund is 4,000,000 KHR.  Sambath whose loan portion is 1,400,000 KHR, will spend her loan portion to pay plowing fees for her farmland. She really hopes that she can double her income and better her living conditions.

loans.use: To pay plowing fees for farmland

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Age 58 and a local farmer from Battambang Province’s EK Phnom district, Sopheap is married and blessed with eleven children. Her main source of income is from her vegetable selling business and the supplementary income is from small-scale vegetable planting, which she has been doing for about 30 years to support herself. This is the seventh time that Sopheap has taken out a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She has successfully repaid her past loans which have enabled her to sustain her living and have returned a good income to feed her family and for other necessary expenses. 

Now, she and her fellow group member are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each. Sopheap, the leader, will use her loan portion to buy more vegetables to resell. She hopes to replenish fresh vegetables on time and sell them at a high price; thereby, she will earn more income to support herself.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a thirty-eight-year-old married man with six children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. For ten years he has been selling fish and with the proceeds he has been able to buy land and support his family. Lack of appropriate preservation equipment and inadequate capital pose a challenge to his business growth while his dream is to buy a refrigerated van. Wilson intends to use the loan to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Savoun's Group

texts.en:
Savoun, originally from Battambang Province, is 31 years old and strives to make a living through a single business, rice farming, which she has been with for 10 years. Currently, she has one son who still needs her support as he is still in school. Savoun, a fifth time borrower, joined this group consisting of two female members to apply for a new loan; the other borrower is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

Savoun has supported her living in a good manner from the past loans which she has completely paid back. Now, she is seeking 1,200,000 KHR while her co-borrower is applying for half of her requesting loan amount, 600,000 KHR only. Savoun, the leader, will use her loan portion to buy rice seed for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice seasonably so she can gain triple yield with high profit for her child’s sake.

loans.use: To buy rice seed for her farmland

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
Phally, 40, is a citizen from Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. Besides working for others for a fee, she also has her own businesses including tailoring and chicken raising in order to support the daily basic needs of her family. Phally has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for ages, and has taken out nine loans which she has repaid successfully. She feels very confident that she can upgrade her living status progressively especially in providing daily food for her family. 

Now, her current requested loan amount is 1,000,000 KHR, the same amount as her co-borrower. She is the group leader and will use her loan portion to buy necessary materials to build a new, decent house for her family. She hopes this purchase will help her to renovate her house in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials to build a new, decent house for her family

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos  un hombre emprendedor , tiene 39 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su cosecha , para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Carlos, age 39, is an enterprising man.  He is married, and he lives with his wife and four children.

He currently requested a loan to buy supplies like manure and fumigants.  He wants to help his coffee crops in order to keep them in good condition during the harvest.  He will do this in order to get a good quality product.

The only limitation that this gentleman has is the lack of money to continue growing.  They are dependent upon this business activity in order to be able to get ahead.  That is why he is making this loan request.

It is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He does not have other loans in state banks.  FUDECOSUR has given him the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.es:
Merlita, de 39 años de edad, esta casada con Jorge quien es el padre de sus dos hijos de 20 y 12 años de edad respectivamente.  Vive en compañía de su esposo y sus  hijos en su casa propia, la cual logró construir con  el fruto de su esfuerzo.
Merlita se dedica a la carpintería, desarrolla este trabajo en un taller cercano a su vivienda en el que trabaja desde hace 5 años. Compra la madera que necesita y luego traslada toda esta materia prima a su punto de trabajo en donde su función principal consiste en pulir la madera cuyas piezas serán unidas posteriormente para formar muebles para el hogar y oficinas.Considera que ya tiene los conocimientos básicos para desarrollar sola este trabajo es por eso que poco a poco espera instalar su propio taller.Le gusta su actividad  porque puede estar en su casa el tiempo necesario para cumplir con las funciones que requiere la crianza de sus hijos sin descuidar sus actividades laborales, también le gusta el ingreso económico que le genera su trabajo con el cual puede apoyar a su esposo. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000 soles para la compra de cinceles , brochas, madera y otros materiales de carpintería que son usadas en su trabajo a su vez está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le permite avanzar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Merlita is 39 years old and is married to Jorge. Together they have two children, ages 20 and 12. She lives with her husband and children in their own home, which they managed to build through their own hard work.

Merlita works in carpentry. She has worked for five years in a workshop near her home. Merlita buys the wood she needs and transports it to the workshop. She then sands the pieces of wood before they are joined to make home and office furniture. 

Merlita believes that she already has the basic knowledge to carry out this work by herself, and she hopes to gradually open up her own workshop. She says she likes carpentry because it allows her enough time to be home to care for her children without having to neglect her work. She also likes the earnings she receives, which allow her to help her husband. 

Merlita is requesting this loan of 2000 PEN to buy chisels, paintbrushes, wood and other carpentry materials that she uses to make furniture. She says she is very happy to know she has financial support that will allow her to move ahead with her business.

loans.use: to buy chisels, paintbrushes, wood and other carpentry materials.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is a 26-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. They live in Talibon, Bohol. Angeline is engaged in a tricycle transport business together with her husband for more than three years now. Angeline is asking for a loan to buy spare  parts for her tricycle such as tires, nuts and bolts, and fuel for the tricycle. With this, they will be able to maintain the good working condition of the tricycle. 

In the future, Angeline has hopes of making their business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy spare  parts for tricycle like tires, nuts and bolts, and fuel for the tricycle

loans.name: Rey's Group

texts.en:
Rey is a 45-year-old widowed mother of five children, two schoolchildren and three paid workers, who lives in Battambang province, Cambodia. To support her family, she solely relies on one single business, chicken raising. This is the business that she has been with for three years. Rey is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), including this cycle. She is very much pleased with her past loans as they have improved her livelihood at a good pace.

 Now, Rey is leading a group consisting of four female members and the total requested loan amount is 4,700,000 KHR. Rey will use her loan portion in the amount of 1,400,000 KHR to buy more chickens to raise. She hopes to raise more chickens in healthy conditions and sell them at a high price to triple her income.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to raise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy grocery items to sell at a profit

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción es una mujer de 47 años de edad casada y madre de 5 hijos los cuales juntos en familia se dedican a la siembra y cultivo de café. Ella tiene un grado de educación de primaria no completado el cual pudo cursar con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio hasta el 5 grado y no pudo continuar por falta de ayuda económica ya que sus padres son de bajos recursos económicos por lo cual las entradas de efectivo las distribuían realizando la compra de los alimentos para el sustento de su familia. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron el cultivo y siembra de café hace mas de 30 años y que hasta hoy en día sigue practicando dicha actividad la cual es el único medio de ingreso y sustento para su familia. El terreno que ellos cultiva lo adquirió el esposo por medio de una herencia familiar la cual les ha dado mucho fruto y esta ubicado a una distancia de 100 metros al cual se trasladan diariamente para darle mantenimiento y asistencia esto les permite mantener muy limpio sus cultivos. Su producto es comercializado y vendido por los diferentes intermediarios que llegan a la comunidad para su adquisición.

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizante y abono para sus cultivo de café el cuales les permitirá mantener limpio de plagas y de enfermedades las cuales destruyen cultivos completos de no ser tratados a tiempo.

Su sueño es seguir aumentando su cultivó para de esa manera generar mas ingresos que le permitan seguir invirtiendo en su producción de café ya que uno de los mas grandes desafíos es el constante aumento y el alza de los precios de los insumos mismos que son de gran ayuda para que la producción se pueda aprovechar en un 100% esto permitirá darle una mejor educación a sus hijos y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Concepción is a 47-year-old woman.  She's married and the mother of five children, who make a living growing coffee together as a family.  She didn't finish primary school, though she went through fifth grade with a lot of effort and sacrifice.  She lacked the financial help to continue because her parents had a low income level and had to use their cash input to buy food to support the family.

It was her parents who taught her how to grow coffee more than 30 years ago, which she continues doing up to the present.  It's the only income and means of support for her family.  Her husband acquired the land they cultivate from a family inheritance, and it has been fruitful for them.  The land is located 100 meters away, and they go there every day to maintain and weed it, which allows them to keep their crop free of weeds.  They sell their crop through various intermediaries who come to the community to acquire it.

Currently she's requesting help to buy fertilizer and manure for her coffee crop so she can keep it free of pests and diseases that destroy entire crops if not treated in time.

Her dream is to expand her crop to generate more income so she can continue investing in coffee production.  One of her greatest challenges is the constant increase and rise in prices of the very supplies that are a big help in guaranteeing a 100% crop.  This will allow her to give her children a better education and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure for her coffee crop

loans.name: Sreyoun

texts.en:
A local farmer on five hectares of farmland from Battambang province, Sreyoun is married and 29 years old. She has two children; both of them still rely on her as they are too young for school. The ten years of experience in her current business provides about 30,000 KHR per day. 

Sreyoun, a third time loan borrower, has utilized her past loan smartly to better support a good standard of living. 

Now, she is seeking 2,500,000 KHR to pay a plowing fee and to purchase potash. She hopes that she can earn more income and sustain her lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay a plowing fee for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tins for making bread and to pay for the return of the roller which has been in for repairs for the past month

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of three grown-up children from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a 'sari-sari' or variety store business selling various goods to the people in her place. Angelita is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, rice, sodas, soap and toiletries, cooking materials, snack foods and others. With this, she will be able to attract and cater for more buyers in her store. In the future, Angelita has hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, rice, sodas, soap and toiletries, cooking materials, snack foods and others

loans.name: Cesar Alberto

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 22 años de edad estado civil soltero vive con sus padres vive en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la Vrc Nuevos Horizontes, la comunidad se encuentra a unos 40 minutos en la comunidad santa Martha perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda.

Cesar se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra y venta de naranjilla, además se dedica a la crianza de ganado.

Utilizara el dinero del crédito para la comprar  urea, fungicidas, semillas, abono para la naranjilla. Con el crédito que le otorga la cooperativa podrá aumentar la cantidad de la siembra. Sus compras las realiza en el cantón Guaranda. 

El sueño es llegar a tener mayor cantidad de productos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan es no poder comunicarse no tener medio de transporte y las plagas en los cultivos. En el tiempo libre se dedica a pasear.
"Esta muy agradecido por el anterior crédito.
texts.en:
Cesar is 22 years old, single, and lives with his parents in Guaranda Canton in the Province of Bolívar. He is a member of the Nuevos Horizantes [New Horizons] Community Bank, which is located 40 minutes away in the community of Santa Martha, also in Guaranda Canton. 

Cesar works in agriculture, growing and selling naranjilla [a citrus-flavored fruit]. He also raises cattle. He will use this loan to buy urea, fungicide, seeds and fertilizer for his naranjilla crop. He says that with the loan he will be able to increase the size of his crop. He will buy his supplies in Guaranda Canton.

Cesar’s dream is to have a larger variety of products. The challenges he faces include isolation from neighboring areas, lack of transportation, and pests that harm his crops. In his free time he likes to take walks. He says he is very grateful for the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy urea, fungicide, seeds and fertilizer for his crop of naranjilla.

loans.name: Sokmara

texts.en:
Sokmara, 43, is a married mother of three children who are students in the local state school. She struggles to earn a living through working as a local school teacher in the area and does agricultural activities, vegetable growing and dragon-fruit planting. She has been engaged in the current business for 22 years, earning about 40,700 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for Sokmara with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use her loan in the amount of 3,000,000 KHR in order to buy more posts to grow more dragon fruit. She really hopes that she can grow her fruit so that it will be healthy and she will have more yield.

loans.use: To buy more posts to grow more dragon fruit

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José  tiene   32 años de edad, está casado y vive con la  esposa y dos hijos actualmente. El  con crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abonos, fumigantes, y a su vez ayudarse con la mano de obra. El piensa dar mantenimiento a las plantaciones, para que este no sufra ningún daño, y no se pierda la producción, y así con su proyecto cafetalero poder generar más ganancias para contribuir con su familia, el no cuenta con el capital necesario para dicha compra, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: José is 32 years old.  He is married and currently lives with his wife and two children.  With this loan, José intends to buy supplies such as fertiliser and insect sprays as well as using it to pay for labourers.  He wants to look after the plantation so the plants do not get damaged or produce a low yield.  That way his coffee-growing project will make higher profits that he will be able to use for his family.  José does not have enough to make these purchases on his own as he is poor and has no other way of finding the money that he needs.  So, he is applying for his first loan with "Fudecosur".  He has not had any other loans with state banks and "Fudecosur" is providing José with a loan with better conditions and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and insect spray and to pay for labourers.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 36-year-old business lady. She is married to Bernard and together they are blessed with two  children. She has been running a salon business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 12,000 which she uses to support her family. 

Gladys is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD after she was introduced by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to purchase hair chemicals, hair oils, weaves and hair extensions. With the anticipated profits from her salon, she will educate her children and start up a cosmetics shop. 


Her hopes and dreams are to provide her children with the best education.

loans.use: to purchase hair chemicals, hair oils, weaves and hair extensions

loans.name: Liova

texts.en:
Liova comes from the Akhalkalaki district. He is married and lives with his wife and 28-year-old son. Liova requested a loan from some local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Liova is a welder. He gets orders and produces different kinds of iron products such as iron doors and ovens. The income from this business is not stable, and it is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Liova requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit Liova will cultivate a plot of agricultural land, and he will buy fertilizers and potato seeds. After the land is cultivated and fertilized, he will grow potatoes to sell. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To cultivate the land and purchase fertilizers and potato seeds

loans.name: Akuélé

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits d‘alimentation générale, madame Akuélé vit avec son conjoint  et leurs 03 enfants à Lomé. Ces derniers vont tous à l’école. Elle a démarré son activité en 1997 et fait son premier crédit à WAGES pour renforcer son activité dans l’achat des produits alimentaires. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle espère agrandir la zone de service et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille. Elle est âgée de 45ans.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akuélé, age 45, is a reseller of general food products. She lives in Lomé with her spouse and their three children, who all go to school. She launched her activity in 1997, and she is seeking a first loan from WAGES to strengthen her business by stocking up on food products. 

In the long term, she plans to expand her business territory and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to stock up on general food products for resale.

loans.name: Tezalia

texts.es:
Tezalia, de 64 años de edad, esta casada con Hilario quien se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte, fruto de esa unión tiene 1 hija Lily de 30 años de edad.
