Juntos viven cómodamente en su propia casa en compañía de sus 2 nietos a los que quieren mucho.Tezalia se dedica al servicio de transporte de pasajeros en un mototaxi que se compró con el fruto de sus ahorros, al empezar con este negocio alquilaba su mototaxi pero viendo que se deterioraba rápidamente por el mal uso que le daban a su vehículo decidió que su esposo lo conduciría para realizar el servicio. Se inició hace 4 años cuando se compró su primer vehículo y en el transcurso del tiempo fue renovando otras unidades mientras se deterioraban por el uso cotidiano que se le da.
Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual puede solventar sus gastos familiares, empezó a desarrollar esta labor por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico ya que no podía conseguir un empleo estable, ahora se siente con mayor seguridad y que no le gusta cuando su mototaxi se malogra muy seguido pues le ocasiona gastos que no planea, pero aun así logra obtener buenas ganancias. .En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles y está contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le permite avanzar con su negocio además se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas .Con el monto solicitado comprará repuestos y renovará el tapizado de su mototaxi para brindar mayor comodidad a los pasajeros .
texts.en:
64-year-old Tezalia is married to Hilario, who provides a transport service.  The couple have 1 daughter, Lily, who is 30 years old.  They live together in their own home together with their two grandchildren who they love very much.  Tezalia's business is providing a passenger transport service with a motorcycle taxi that she bought with her savings.  When she first started out in this business she hired a motorcycle taxi.  She saw that its condition was deteriorating rapidly owing to the hard conditions that it was being put through and decided that her husband could drive it in order to provide a service.  Four years ago, Tezalia bought her first vehicle and, over the years, she has also refurbished other vehicles as they deteriorate rapidly owing to the daily stresses that they are put through.

Tezalia enjoys her business as it makes her income with which she is able to cover her family's expenses.  She started working in her business because she needed an income and was unable to find a stable job.  She now feels more secure.  She doesn't like it when her motorcycle taxis experience problems very quickly as it creates unforeseen expenses.  However, she is still able to make good profits.

On this occasion, Tezalia is requesting a loan for 1,000 soles.  She is happy to know that she has financial support which allows her to make progress in her business.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  Tezalia will use the sum of money she has requested to buy spare parts and refurbish her motorcycle taxi's upholstery.  This will make her passengers' journeys more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her vehicle

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi âgée de 39ans vit avec son conjoint et leurs 02 enfants scolarisés à Lomé. Pour prêter main forte à son mari dans les charges du foyer, elle revend des pagnes qu’elle expose sur étalage. Sa clientèle étant constituée de femmes, elle désire les garder c’est pour cela elle fait un second prêt à WAGES pour achat de pagnes. Elle désire servir un grand nombre de clientèle et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Afi, age 39, lives with her spouse and their two school-aged children in Lomé. To help her husband with the household expenses, she started selling pagnes (colorful West-African cloth) which she puts on display. 

To retain her clientele, which consists of women, she is seeking a second loan from WAGES to buy pagnes. She wants to increase her customer base and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pagnes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Haydee De Jesús

texts.es:
Haydee tiene 46 años de edad, es viuda y tiene dos hijos. Ella realiza los oficios domésticos en su casa y a trabajar en el campo, en los cultivos de caña de azúcar y granos básicos. Esta labor la ha realizado desde hace unos 20 años, sus padres fueron quienes le enseñaron. Actualmente, esta cortando caña de azúcar. Su esposo falleció y le ha tocado sacar adelante a sus hijos sola. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar plátanos, yuca, etc para preparar comida típica, debido a que ya no quiere seguir cortando caña; sino establecer su propio negocio en casa y estar mas cerca de sus hijos. Ella además, piensa cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de pipían, ya que es un fruto que tiene buen precio.
texts.en:
Haydee is a 46-year-old widow with two children.  She takes care of her housework and also works in the fields, looking after sugarcane crops and basic grains.  She has been in this line of work for 20 years, having learned from her parents.  She currently works cutting sugar cane.  Her husband died and she is now responsible for bringing up her children alone.

Haydee is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy plantains, cassava and other produce so that she can prepare traditional food.  She no longer wants to work cutting sugar cane but would rather set up her own home-based business so that she can be closer to her children.  In addition, she also plans to grown 7,000 square meters of pipían squash as this crop fetches a good price.

loans.use: to buy plantains, cassava, etc. for preparing traditional food to sell

loans.name: Decita

texts.en: Decita, a married woman from Talibon, Bohol who sells clothes and other fashion accessories, is requesting a loan to buy more to sell. This will enable Decita to cater to more buyers, thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, she hopes to make her business a sustainable success.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of clothes and other accessories to sell.

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en:
Miraflor is a fruit vendor particularly selling bananas. She buys them at a wholesale price and re-sells them at retail. She is 35 years old, married and has two children. Her spouse works abroad. The couple works hard to earn an income for the education of their children. 

Miraflor is now asking for a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy more bananas to sell. It will add to her capital and allow her to develop her small business. 

Some day, with good sales and income, Miraflor will be able to save funds for education and future expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Ntepeko

texts.en:
Tepeko, now a father of four, has continued with his farming business, and successfully managed to pay off his loan. He used part of the proceeds to lease a bigger portion of land with the view to expanding his business.

He has been funded for his fourth loan of KES 50,000 which will help him prepare land for cultivation as well as acquire more seedlings for the extra piece of land. He plans to use the proceeds to pay school fees for his children and also build the family a permanent house.

His dream is to become a prominent commercial farmer and also improve the living standard for his family.

loans.use: to cultivate his land and buy seedlings.

loans.name: Mbaapora Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado MBAAPORA está en su ciclo 2 del programa de comité de mujeres. Están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas, quieren mejorar sus ingresos para poder ayudar a sus familias. Quieren crecer no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal.
Maida es una de las miembros de este grupo, ella es comerciante, cuenta que tiene una despensa bien surtida, con la cual surte a sus vecinos y personas de todos lugares. Maida cuenta que para empezar su negocio fue un poco difícil, pero que hoy en día ya tiene muy buena clientela y está creciendo.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de carne, fideos, arroz, azúcar y otros para tener bien surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
The MBAAPORA group is in its second loan cycle of the women's committee programme. They are learning to work together and they want to improve their income to be able to help their families. They want to grow not only in the economic but also in the personal sense.

Maida is one of the members of this group. She's a trader and says she has a well-stocked grocery store, from which she supplies her neighbours and people from everywhere. 

Maida says that starting her business was quite hard, but now she has very good customers and is growing. She is applying for this loan to buy meat, noodles, rice, sugar and other things to stock her business well.

loans.use: to buy meat, noodles, rice, sugar and more.

loans.name: Mwanaharusi

texts.en:
Mwanaharusi, a 36-year-old married woman, owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. She operates a grocery store, her customers her fellow residents. Seasonality and transportation of her goods are her main businesses challenges.

Mwanaharusi is requesting a loan of Kshs 50000 to buy more mangoes, oranges, nuts, etc. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation and access to loans.

loans.use: to buy more mangoes, oranges, nuts, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 38 years old. She is married and they have been blessed with three kids of the following ages 14, 12 and nine. She runs a cereal shop and she has been in business for six years. Right now her monthly income from the business is KES 35,000.

She is borrowing KES 40,000 which she intend to use to purchase more stock of assorted cereals. This is her fourth loan and she successfully paid her previous loan.

loans.use: To buy more stock of assorted cereals.

loans.name: Jorge Jr

texts.en:
Jorge is 34 years old, married and has three children. He grows hogs and butchers them too. He sells them at the public market. He has been in the business for over eight years now. He usually gains PHP 15,000 each month. It goes for meals, bills at home and education fees of his children. 

He wants to keep raising healthy hogs but has insufficient funds. That is why he is now asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy hogs, their feed and vaccines for sustainability. 

Some day, Jorge would like to keep making the business profitable in order to acquire more funds for education and the overall welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy hogs, their feed and vaccines for sustainability.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.en:
Rufino Jr. is 37 years old, married with four children. All his four children go to school. Rufino Jr. is a hard-working and business-oriented man. He aims to improve his financial stability, have a comfortable lifestyle and let his four children finish their studies.

Rufino Jr. plans to buy boxes of fish sauce, five kilos of dried flying fish, five gallons of cooking oil, three kilos of dried squid and trays of eggs for his general store. In this situation, he is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000. 

He knows that this loan amount will keep his general store profitable and progressive. He would be thankful enough if his requested loan amount is granted.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish sauce, five kilos of dried flying fish, five gallons of cooking oil, three kilos of dried squid and trays of eggs for his general store.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda earns a living through her seaweed farming business in Talibon, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been engaged in the business together with her husband for more than three years now. This is their source of income. 

Esmeralda is asking for a loan to buy seaweed seedlings, rope, straw and to pay for the labor. With this, they will be able to improve their seaweed farming ventures as well as their income.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, rope, straw and to pay for the labor.

loans.name: Joselyn

texts.en:
Joselyn is 45 years old, separated and has been blessed with six children. She operates a stall wherein she offers rice, salt, cosmetic products and auto load max. Joselyn would like to buy an additional 50 cavans of rice but her income is not sufficient due to an abrupt increase of her household expenses and the daily allowances of her six children.

For this reason, Joselyn is seeking a loan of PHP 50,000. She hopes that her rice retailing business will continue to grow smoothly so she can earn greater income, improve her way of living and educate her six children.

Joselyn hopes and prays that her requested loan amount will be granted.

loans.use: to buy 50 cavans of rice for her stall.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia earns a living through her hog-raising business. She has been in involved in this business for more than three years now. This is her source of income. 

Florencia is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs. In the future, Florencia hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the repayment of her loan.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a thirty-five-year-old man, married to Beatrice and a father of three children. He is a charcoal dealer in Kangemi and has been in this business for three years now. He gets a monthly income of six thousand five hundred shillings.

This will be Robert's first loan with KADET Ltd. He plans to use the entire loan to buy twenty sacks of charcoal to sell. In future he wants to open another shop in a different area.

loans.use: To buy twenty sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is 27 years old. He lives in the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi with his 27-year-old wife Rusudan, parents and sister. Levan requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is Levan’s monthly salary. He is working in a computer accessories shop. Levan repairs damaged computers which are sold in the shop. 

Levan requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of new a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

Levan plans to open a computer shop. The family owns a commercial space, where they plan to sell and repair computers. With the received credit Levan will purchase show model products to put on the counter in their shop. As he is very experienced in this field and has many contacts in the warehouses, in case of orders he will purchase requested products at a low cost and sell them with the price markup. The expenses of the business will be reduced as they will not have to hire anybody or pay rent and also will be working on repair services. This business will increase the family income as and they will be able to have better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase show model computer products to put on the counter in their shop.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a single man. He describes himself to be a hardworking man. He operates a food retail business where he sells cakes. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a heavy-traffic business area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be having insufficient funds for improving his business. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to purchase a fridge and water dispenser. His business goal is to be a supplier of cakes  within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: To buy a fridge and water dispenser

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman, aged 37 years, and she has five school-going children. She owns a house with no electricity or piped water.  

She has a business of selling dry food at the market. With the loan of Kshs 20,000, she will buy more rice, dry maize, beans and other food items and accomplish her goal of opening a new kiosk.

loans.use: To buy more rice, dry maize, beans and other food items

loans.name: Rogelito

texts.en:
Rogelito is a business-oriented man. He offers various kinds of dental supplies to Region II and to some other parts of Visayas. He has been doing this kind of business for five years. He is thankful, because through his hard work and determination in life, he is able to earn a greater income.

Rogelito would like to take out a loan of PHP 50,000, allowing him to buy braces, fluoride, and ortho products for his dental supply business. He just hopes that his requested loan amount will be granted so that he can supply his customers. In this way, he could earn a greater profit, enabling him to pay for his household expenses, continue to make his dental supply business profitable, and to expand someday.

loans.use: To buy braces, fluoride, and ortho products for his dental supply business

loans.name: Doria

texts.es:
La  Sra. Doria es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 45 años, está casada con el Sr. Fermin de 44 años. Tienen 5 hijos, quienes ya son todos mayores e independientes.
Doria tiene una Casa Comercial  en su casa, tiene clientela formada, es una señora muy trabajadora, expelente cliente. Cuenta también que su esposo tiene una hamburguesería con lo que ellos se ayudan por salir adelante y con los que pudieron criar a sus hijos.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar azúcar, fideos, harina, arroz y demás, y con esto tener bien surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Doria is from the city of Santaní. She is 45 years old and is married to Fermín, who is 44 years old. Together they have five children, who are all now adults and independent.

Doria has a store in her home with a well-established customer base. She is very hardworking and an excellent client of Fundación Paraguaya. Her husband has a hamburger bar, and the two of them help each other so that they can get ahead and so that they were able to raise their children. Doria is requesting this loan to buy sugar, noodles, flour, rice and other products to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, flour, rice and other products to stock her store.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene  48 años de edad, esta casada y vive con el esposo y tres hijos actualmente. Ella con crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abonos, fumigantes, y a su vez ayudarse con la mano de obra. Ella piensa dar mantenimiento a las plantaciones, para que este no sufra ningún daño, y no se pierda la producción, y así con su proyecto cafetalero poder generar más ganancias para contribuir con su familia, ella no cuenta con el capital necesario para dicha compra, ni dichos contratos, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Carmen is 48 years old, is married, and lives with her husband and three children.  With this loan, she intends to purchase supplies such as fertilizers, pesticides, and help with labor.  She plans to maintain her crops so that they do not suffer harm or lose productivity, and therefore generate more revenue from her coffee project to contribute to her family.  

Since she is of few resources, she does not have the necessary capital for the purchase or the labor contracts, and does not have the means to acquire the money needed.  For these reasons, she has requested this loan, the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR.  Prior to this, she had never had another loan from a national bank, but FUDECOSUR has given her loan with great ease and a very low interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, de 40 años de edad, esta casada con Juan quien se dedica al transporte, vive con su pareja y sus dos  menores hijos de 14 y 9 años de edad respectivamente.Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de pescados frescos y plátanos, su negocio está instalado en el frontis de su hogar, ahí atiende desde muy temprano a sus clientes , desde hace 9 años realiza esta función sola y con mucho entusiasmo. Afortunadamente le va muy bien ya que diariamente logra vender todos los productos que ofrece a la venta y le gusta este trabajo porque le permite tener un ingreso económico que le da la tranquilidad necesaria para su familia ,por tanto tiene muchas ganas de ampliar su negocio mejorando la infraestructura de su pequeño puesto, además quiere comprar un mototaxi para alquilarlo y generar asi más ganancias.
En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles para la compra de pescado fresco tales como palometa y bagre ya que tienen mucha demanda en está temporada además está contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le permite avanzar con el progreso de su negocio.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40 years old and married to Juan, who works in transportation. She lives with him and their two children, ages 14 and 9. Elizabeth sells fresh fish and plantains from a stall attached to the front of her home. She begins waiting on her customers very early in the morning. 

For nine years Elizabeth has worked at this business on her own and with a lot of enthusiasm. Fortunately, she says she does well because she manages to sell everything she offers for sale, and she likes the work because it gives her a source of income and the peace of mind her family needs. She is very eager to expand her business and improve the structure of her small stall. She also hopes to buy a motorcycle taxi, which she would like to rent out to generate more income. 

Elizabeth is requesting this loan of 1500 PEN to by fresh fish such as palometa [a silver freshwater fish] and catfish, both of which are in high demand at this time of year. She says she is happy to know she has financial support that will allow her to move ahead with her business.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish such as palometa and catfish.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis  tiene 54 años de edad, es casado, y vive con la esposa. El vive en la administración con su esposa. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de vacas doble prosito, para cría y leche. El quiere aumentar un poco la cantidad de animales, para tener más posibilidad de vender más crías. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Luis is 54 years old, is married, and lives with wife. He lives on the administration [possibly a building on an agricultural estate - more info needed] with his wife. He wants the loan to buy cows for two reasons - for breeding stock and for milk. He wants to increase the quantity of animals a little bit to give him the possibility of selling more offspring. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had other loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has offered him an easier loan with much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca, de 65 años de edad, es viuda y madre de 12 hijos,los cuales son mayores de edad e independientes. Vive en su casa casa de madera junto a uno de sus hijos, su nieto y su nuera.Blanca tiene una tienda de comestibles el cual esta instalado en su hogar y desde ahí atiende de manera amable y cordial a todos sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos. Ofrece a la venta diversos productos de primera necesidad como sal, arroz, pan, leche, huevos, verduras y otros , además los productos no perecibles los renueva semanalmente invirtiendo alrededor de 100 a 150 soles en cada compra. Lleva en este negocio más de 3 años y trabaja sola. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar en su casa y contar con la tranquilidad de un ingreso económico,por esta razón tiene planeado ampliar su negocio  y además quiere adquirir un mototaxi para poder alquilarlo e incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles para la compra de productos tales como sal, té , arroz , azucar , leche , entre otros para si seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes los productos necesarios para su hogar , además está contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le permite avanzar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca, 65 years old, is a widowed mother of 12 children who are adult and independent.  She lives in her wooden house with one of her sons, her grandson and her daughter-in-law.  Blanca has a grocery store that is located in her house.  From there she serves all of her customers, who for the most part are her neighbors, in a friendly and cordial manner.  She has a variety of essential goods for sale such as salt, rice, bread, milk, eggs, vegetables and others.  Additionally, she replaces the non-perishable products on a weekly basis, investing about 100 to 150 soles in each purchase.  

She has had this business for over three years and works on her own.  She enjoys her business as it allows her to be at home and count on the peace of mind of an income.  For this reason, she plans on growing her business and wants to acquire a mototaxi in order to rent it and increase her earnings.  

She is requesting 1500 Soles in order to purchase products such as salt, tea, rice, sugar and milk among others so that she can continue to offer her clients the products they need for their homes.  She is pleased to know that she has the financial support to allow her to advance her business.

loans.use: to purchase products such as salt, rice and sugar among others.

loans.name: William

texts.es: William, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 46 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y tres hijos actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar semilla e insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea realizar un almacigo de café para su posterior siembra en una pequeña propiedad y para resembrar café perdido , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
William, an enterprising man, is 46 years old, married and currently lives with his wife and three children. He is applying for a loan with the hope of buying seed and supplies such as fertilizers and fumigants. He wants to make a coffee plot for his next sowing period on a small piece of land to re-sow lost coffee. 

The only limitation that this man has is a lack of money to continue growing considering that they depend on this business to carry on. For this reason he is applying for a loan. 

It's the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not registered for other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him an easier loan with much lower interest rates....

loans.use: with a coffee plot.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria owns her grocery store wherein she offers rice and grocery items. She is married and has five children. Maria's husband works as a manufacturer of rice mills. The couple works hard in order to get ahead in life and improve their financial status.

Maria would like to increase the volume of grocery items and bags of rice she offers in her grocery store, but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000. She hopes to obtain this loan amount in order for her to satisfy her customer demand and have a comfortable living condition someday. 

Maria also hopes for continuous access of financial assistance so she can keep her grocery store progressive.

loans.use: to buy a volume of grocery items and bags of rice for her grocery store.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en: Stanley is a 27 year old single man. He describes himself to be honest and trust worthy. He operates a general store where he sells cereals, sugar, soda, bread, cooking oil etc. He has been involved in this business for 8 years. His business is located in a viable profitable business environment. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor infrastructure in the area leading to low bargaining power. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to to buy sugar, salt, soda, flour, and cooking fat. His business goal is to be a distributor within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM after managing to repay a loan of Kes 10,000 successfully. In addition, Stanley does farming which increases his business income.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, soda, flour, and cooking fat for resale

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Medalla Milagrosa está en su ciclo número 2  del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Repatriación distrito de Caaguazú, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. 
La Sra. Maria es una de las integrantes, quien tiene su pequeña despensa, quiere que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de sus compañeras puedan ir mejorando sus vidas y las de sus familias, también poder procurar para ellos un mejor futuro.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de productos para su negocio, como ser fideos, azucares, panes, golosinas y articulos varios que son de primera necesidad para montar un pequeño almacén de consumo.
texts.en:
The Medalla Milagrosa [Miraculous Medal] Group is in its second loan cycle of the women’s committee program. It is located in the city of Repatriación, in the district of Caaguazú, which is a somewhat remote area that is still developing.

One of the members of the group is Maria, who has a small store. Her wish is for the members of the group to help each other, so that as time goes by, they can improve their and their families’ lives and find better futures. She is requesting this loan to buy products for her business, such as noodles, sugar, bread, candies and various other items that are necessary for setting up a small store.

loans.use: to buy noodles, sugar, bread, candies and various other items for her store.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina and her husband are engaged in mango fruit production. They live in Trinidad, Bohol together with their children. 

Marina is asking for a loan to buy pesticides and fruit enhancer chemicals for mango production. With this, they will be able to improve their business as well as their income.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fruit enhancer chemicals for mango production.

loans.name: Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Maendeleo is a group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District represented by Justine. The group has 8 women and 2 men. Justine is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum. Justine is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to the best input prices of hybrid seed and fertilizer.

Justine described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one as a One Acre Fund farmer. She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Justine’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereal to sell

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en: Mary is a forty-nine year old widow and mother of five. She farms maize, cowpeas and green peas. Her major challenge with her farming is the pests that frequently destroy her crops, and without capital, she is unable to purchase pesticides. With the income from her KOMAZA trees she hopes to buy a dairy cow, some goats, install a water tank and start a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, some goats, install a water tank and start a grocery store

loans.name: Maduma Group

texts.en:
Ernest is a member of Maduma Group in Kakamega North District. He is pictured with 10 One Acre Fund farmers, 4 women and 6 men. Ernest is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Ernest joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Ernest joined One Acre Fund so that he could grow enough food for the family and use increased profits to send his children to school.

Ernest described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and repair his home. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Ernest’s group will receive 5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela has earned a living through her food vending business for more than five years now.  She sells home-cooked snack foods to the people in her area in Talibon, Bohol. Pamela works hard in order to provide support to her husband in meeting the needs of the family. Pamela is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients like milk, sugar, flour, margarine, and food flavorings. With these, she will be able to cook and sell more food, thus increasing her profit. Pamela believes that through this loan, her dreams of improving her family's way of living will be achieved.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like milk, sugar, flour, margarine, and food flavorings.

loans.name: Francisco Octavio

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 53 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos. Desde muy pequeño sea dedicado al cultivo de maíz; fue un tío quien le enseño. Trabajaba junto a sus primos y su hermano, al pasar el tiempo se caso a su 30 años de edad y empezó a trabajar más fuerte para sus hijos y su esposa. Los insumos que necesita para cultivar, los adquiere en una ciudad que esta a dos kilómetros de su casa; para trasportar los insumos paga para que los trasladen hasta su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar insumos agrícolas, pagar alquiler del terreno donde cultivara y preparar la tierra para sembrar 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Con la inversión, podrá sembrar más y obtener una mejor cosecha para incrementar sus ingresos y poder brindar el estudio universitario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Francisco is 53 years old, married and has three children.  Taught by his uncle, he has been involved in the cultivation of corn since he was very little.  He worked alongside his cousins and brother, and after some time, he married at the age of 30 and began working harder for his children and wife.  

He purchases the supplies he needs to farm in a city located two kilometers from his house.  In order to transport the supplies, he pays for them to be delivered to his home.  The loan he has applied for from Fundacion Campo is to purchase agricultural supplies, pay the lease for the land he will grow on, and prepare the ground to plant 21,000 square meters of corn.  With this investment, he will be able to plant more and obtain a better harvest to increase his earnings and be able to pay his children's college tuition.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies, pay the lease on the land where he plans to grow, and prepare the ground to plant 21,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Maduma Group

texts.en:
Jafred is a member of Maduma Group in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He is pictured with 10 One Acre Fund farmers: eight women and two men. Jafred is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for a half acre of Sweet Potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Jafred first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Jafred joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for his family and use increased profits to send his children to school.

Jafred described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and repair his home. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive a half-acre's agricultural inputs on credit. Jafred’s group will receive a total of five acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of Sweet Potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José  , tiene 46 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y tres hijos actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar semilla e insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea realizar un almacigo de café para su posterior venta a los vecinos y otra parte la piensa sembrarla  en una pequeña propiedad que tiene junto con la esposa , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
José, age 46, is married and lives with his wife and three children.  He requested a loan to buy seeds and supplies like manure and fumigants.  

He wants to sow a coffee seedbed, which he will later sell to his neighbors.  He plans to use the other part to sow on a small property that he has with his wife.  

The only limitation that this gentleman has is the lack of money to continue growing.  They depend upon this business activity in order to be able to get ahead.  That is why he made a request for a loan.  

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not taken out other loans with state banks.  FUDECOSUR has offered him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson, now 30 and a father of four, is doing well in his farming business and has successfully managed to pay off his previous loans. Since his last loan, he has diversified to farming potatoes in addition to barley. This has given him additional gains, since the crop takes a much shorter time to mature.

Dickson has applied for another loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) which he will use to ready his land and buy seedlings in preparation for the upcoming planting season. He plans to use his additional proceeds to educate his children to higher levels of learning. His dream is to attain financial stability.

loans.use: to prepare land and buy seedlings.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is basketweaver from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has been involved in this venture for more than 20 years now. This is her source of income. Rosalina is asking for a loan to buy materials for basket weaving, like bamboo, straw, and others. With this, she can increase the number of baskets that she can weave. Rosalina dreams of expanding her business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy materials for basket weaving, like bamboo and straw.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana Julia, tiene 50 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos, vive en una aldea cerca de la ciudad de Puerto Cortes junto a dos hijos.
Doña Ana Julia, siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, ella vendía todo tipo de mercadería. Hace  6  años decidió establecer un  negocio de venta de comidas ya que es rentable. Anexado a su casa hizo un local donde vende refrescos, golosinas, comidas como pollo frito con tajadas, chuletas fritas, tacos, y otros. Ella ha solicitado  varios préstamos lo que ha permitido que su negocio se mantenga en crecimiento. Hasta el momento ha logrado tener un buen record crediticio con la institución y eso le motiva a seguir trabajando. 
El préstamo que solicita actualmente es el octavo ciclo y es por 25,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar insumos para la elaboración de comidas como ser harinas, carnes, frijoles, refrescos, lácteos, manteca, condimentos etc.  Su meta es seguir trabajando con el negocio para satisfacer a sus clientes y crecer con la familia.
texts.en:
Ana Julia is 50 years old, married, and has four children. She lives with two of her children in a small village near the city of Puerto Cortes. Ana Julia has always worked in sales, and she used to sell all kinds of merchandise. Six years ago, she decided to start selling food because it is profitable. She built a small addition to her home, from which she sells soft drinks, candy and meals such as fried chicken with plantains, fried chops, tacos and others. 

Ana Julia has requested various loans in the past, which have allowed her business to keep growing. She has managed to maintain a very good credit history with the field partner and this motivates her to continue working.

This is Ana Julia’s eighth loan cycle. She will use the loan of 25000 HNL to buy ingredients for the meals she sells, such as flour, meat, beans, soft drinks, dairy products, lard, condiments and others. Her goal is to continue working to satisfy her customers and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, meat, beans, soft drinks, dairy products, lard, condiments and other ingredients.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a hog farmer within his local community. He has been in this business for five years. The profits from his hog-raising business are used for his family's daily consumption, an allowance for his only child, and other household expenses.

William is 30 years old, and married to a teacher. They have only one child. He aims to ensure proper nutrition for his hogs, but due to insufficient funds, he is asking for financial assistance amounting to 25,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP). This loan amount will enable him to buy livestock supplies such as hog feed and vitamins for his hogs. He hopes to obtain this amount so his hogs can get healthier and reach their optimum growth. In this way, he could generate more income and sustain his family's basic necessities.

loans.use: to buy livestock supplies such as hog feed and vitamins for his hogs.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
El señor Eduardo es originario de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo, tiene ya mas de 40 años vivienda en ese domicilio, es casado con la señora Galdina y tiene tres hijos quienes ya formaron su propia familia.  
El señor Eduardo trabaja para una compañía de trasportes como chofer de un camión de carretera desde hace más de 2 años y la señora Galdina se dedica al cuidado de los nietos.
Esta solicitando un préstamo ya que desea cambiar la instalación del hidro sanitario de su vivienda, ya que por el paso del tiempo se encuentra en muy malas condiciones y necesita cambiar toda la tubería, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para llevar acabo dicha mejora.
Con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo será para pagar el crédito.  Así su familia estará en un lugar mas seguro de enfermedades.
texts.en:
Eduardo is from the city of Nuevo Laredo. He has been living here for over 40 years. He is married to Galdina and has three children who already have their own families.
 
Eduardo has worked as a truck driver for a transport company for over 2 years, and Galdina is committed to looking after the grandchildren. 

He is asking for a loan to change the plumbing in his home, since over time it has deteriorated to a very bad state, and he needs to change all of the piping. However he does not have the money he needs to carry out this improvement. 

He will use the income he obtains from his work to repay the loan. In this way his family will be kept safe from disease.

loans.use: to install new piping in the plumbing system.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos , un hombre emprendedor y muy trabajador  y dedicado a su familia , tiene 47 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y tres hijos  actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su producción , ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Carlos is an enterprising and hardworking man who is dedicated to his family.  He is 47 years old and lives with his wife and three children.

He is seeking a loan so that he can buy supplies such as fertilizer and insecticide for his coffee bushes.  His aim is to keep these crops in good condition throughout the growing season.  He depends on the income from this activity.

This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He has not taken other loans through state banks, but FUDESCOR has made it easier to obtain a loan, and their interest rates are much lower.

loans.use: to buy supplies for growing coffee.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 37-year-old married woman with three children. She operates a stall where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 11 years. Her business is located in a potential business area. Catherine describes herself as an optimistic woman. She says her biggest business challenge is the lack of permanent space for storing the fruits and vegetables.

Catherine will use the loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to run a well-stocked grocery store within five years. Catherine managed to pay her previous loan of 20,000 KES successfully.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish adding rooms on the upper floor of her home.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es: Lorena, tiene la edad  de 30 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo y un hijo  actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar un poco de abono para asistir la plantación de café ya que esta en producción y si no lo abona la cosecha se le cae. Ella tiene pensado tener una buena producción para obtener más ganancias y poder vender la producción  en el mercado de la localidad y alrededores,  para obtener buenas ganancias y una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Lorena is 30 years old, married, and currently lives with her husband and son.

With this loan, she is trying to buy a little manure to tend to the coffee plantation. Since it is already in production, if she does not fertilize, the harvest will fail. 

She intends on having a good harvest so she can have more earnings. She also wants to be able to sell it at the local and nearby markets so she can earn good money, have a higher quality of life, and financial stability. 

This is the first loan she received from FUDECOSUR. She has never had other loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given her a loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as manure.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, de 34 años de edad, está casada con Marco quien es padre de sus 2 hijos, Vivian de 14 años y Marco de 7 años de edad respectivamente, con quienes vive cómodamente en su propia casa .La actividad que realiza Elizabeth es la venta de bebidas gasificadas, dulces de hielo , hielo y jugos envasados, ya que cuenta con refrigerador que usa para cumplir con esta actividad, además vende sus productos entre sus amistades, familiares y otros clientes eventuales. Realiza este trabajo desde hace 5 años y lo hace con ayuda de su hija o sola , por otra lado, también cuenta con 2 mototaxis que alquila diariamente por los cuales recibe un pago fijo. Le agrada realizar su trabajo pues puede manejar su tiempo libre para atender a sus pequeños hijos a quienes quiere mucho y son su motivación para salir adelante, además se siente feliz por los ingresos económicos que recibe. Elizabeth Tiene planeado seguir trabajando ya que se siente bien y conforme con sus ganancias económicas, pues le da la independencia que ella necesita.
En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 para la compra de bebidas gasificadas de diferentes tamaños y sabores ,además comprará los ingredientes necesarios para elaborar los dulces de hielo como azúcar, leche, bolsas y frutas , a su vez está contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le permite avanzar con el progreso de su negocio y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
34-year old Elizabeth is married to Marco; they have two children, Vivian aged 14 and Marco aged 7. They live comfortably in a house of their own. Elizabeth sells soft drinks, popsicles, ice, and frozen drinks and uses a freezer for this activity. She sells to friends, family, and other occasional customers. She’s had this job for five years; sometimes her daughter helps out and sometimes she works alone.

Elizabeth also has two mototaxis which she rents out for a fixed amount. She enjoys her work because she has enough free time to look after her children whom she loves very much. They are the reason she wants to get ahead. She is content with the income she receives. Elizabeth plans to continue working as she is happy with the money she earns as it gives her the independence she needs.

She is now seeking a loan of S/. 1500 to buy soft drinks of different sizes and flavours. She will also use the money to buy the ingredients necessary to make popsicles such as sugar, milk, bags, and fruit.

Elizabeth is happy in the knowledge that she has financial support to grow her business. She promises to make the repayments punctually.

loans.use: buy soft drinks, fruit, sugar etc.

loans.name: José Balbino

texts.es:
José tiene 57 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene siete hijos. Él se dedica a realizar trabajos agrícolas y a la crianza de ganado desde la edad de los 12 años;  su padre quien le enseño. Gracias a ese aprendizaje, él ha podido mantener a su familia que es muy numerosa, sus hijos se encuentran estudiando y al mismo tiempo aprender a trabajar con él. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar insumos agrícolas, y preparar la tierra para sembrar y otra parte la utilizara para comprar dos puertas para la vivienda de un hijo. Con la inversión, asegurara parte de la alimentación de sus hijos y desea comprar más ganado para vender leche.
texts.en:
José is 57 years old. He has a live-in partner and seven children. He has been working in agriculture and raising cattle ever since he was 12 years old. His father taught him this line of work. Thanks to this knowledge he has been able to support his family, which is very large. His children are currently studying and they also learn the trade from him.

The loan he's requesting from Fundación Campo is to purchase farming supplies and prepare the land for sowing. He'll also use part of it to purchase two doors for one of his sons' house. With this investment he'll ensure part of the food he provides for his children. He wishes to buy more cattle in order to sell milk.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies, to prepare the land for sowing and to purchase two doors for one of his sons' house.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 35 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos. Él se dedica a realizar trabajos agrícolas desde la edad de 8 ocho años; fue su padre quien le enseño. Antes se dedicaba a cultivar hortalizas con sistema de riego y hoy ha decidido trabajar con ganado y espera obtener buenos beneficios. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una ternera para la producción de leche y dos quintales de concentrado para alimentarla. Con la inversión busca, aumentar el numero de animales para producir más leche y venderlos y dedicarse también a las actividades agrícolas.
texts.en:
Miguel is 35 years old, has a partner, and has three children. He has made a living doing agriculture work since he was 8 years old. It was his father who taught him.

Before, he grew vegetables with an irrigation system, and now he has decided to work with cattle. He hopes to get good money.

The loan Miguel is requesting from Fundación Campo [Field Foundation] is to buy a calf for milk production and two quintals [100 lbs. or 46 kg.] of feed to nourish it.

With the loan he is seeking, he will increase the number of animals to produce more milk, to sell them, and to make a living through agriculture.

loans.use: to buy a calf for milk production and two quintals [100 lbs. or 46 kg.] of feed to nourish it.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.es:
Danilo, originario  de Estelí, de oficio comerciante fue beneficiado con un crédito Kiva, el cual le permitió comprar envases para almacenar leche y pagar mano de obra, esto fue beneficioso logro vender más leche y  mejoraron sus ingresos. 
Actualmente él quiere emprender un nuevo proyecto como es  trabajar con ganado propio. Es por eso que desea el crédito para utilizarlo en compra de terneros y leche. El desea seguir progresando y convertirse en un empresario exitoso.
texts.en:
Danilo, a Estelí native and business man, benefitted from a Kiva loan. This loan allowed him to buy containers to store milk and pay labor costs. This was a beneficial achievement, selling more milk and improving his income. 

Currently, he wants to undertake a new project which is work with his own cattle. It is because of this that he wants a loan so he can buy calves and milk. 

He hopes to continue his progress and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy calves and milk.

loans.name: Eddy Martin

texts.es:
Eddy, 37 años de edad, casado, tiene un hijo, el vive en la ciudad de Estelí, de oficio comerciante, su negocio es un pequeño Cyber café , lleva 2 años con este negocio. Comenzo con solo dos computadoras, con el tiempo agrego otras más poco a poco  ha salido adelante junto con su familia. Él quiere hacer su prosperar cada día agregando un mejor servicio y de igual forma vender artículos nuevos de uso escolar pues la mayoría de sus clientes son estudiantes. 
El está solicitando del crédito para una impresora multifuncional, dos  escritorios, bolsos, lapiceros, accesorios de celulares.  
Dentro de sus planes futuros desea poner otro  Cyber café con más computadoras para atender más clientes.
texts.en:
37-year-old Eddy is married and has a son. He lives in the town of Estelí and he's a merchant by trade. His business is a small internet café which he has run for the past two years. He started with only two computers, then in time he added others. He has gradually gotten ahead along with his family. He wishes to prosper on a daily basis by providing better service and also by selling new school supplies, because most of his customers are students.

He's requesting the loan in order to purchase a multifunctional printer, two desks, bags, pens and cell phone accessories. Among his plans for the future is to set up another internet café with more computers, so that he'll serve more customers.

loans.use: to purchase a multifunctional printer, two desks, bags, pens and cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Rehema's Group

texts.en: Rehema is a twenty-six-year-old mother of three children. She is a farmer of maize, cowpeas, and cassava, and her husband is a watchman. The challenge she faces with her farming is that pests frequently attack her crops, and she does not have the capital to purchase pesticides. With the income from her KOMAZA trees, she hopes to be able to build a more permanant house and to send her children to a university.

loans.use: To pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training, and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Mariela, tiene la edad  de 31 años, está soltera, vive con los padres   actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar un poco de abono para asistir la plantación de café y ayudarse con la mano de obra. Ella tiene pensado tener una buena producción para obtener más ganancias y una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Mariela is 31 years old. She is single and currently lives with her parents. She plans to use the loan to buy some fertilizer to help with the coffee plantation and also to help with the work force. She looks forward to a good crop and to earning more income so that she can have a better quality of life as well as economic stability.  This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR. She has not had previous loans from state banks. Furthermore FUDECOSUR has provided her with a loan with less red tape and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Jackson's Group

texts.en: Jackson is a fifty-seven-year-old father of eighteen children. He and his wife are farmers. He faces various challenges on his farm, namely that his crops are frequently attacked by wild pigs. He lacks the capital to purchase fertilizers to increase his crop yield, and there are frequent droughts in the area. He is excited to join KOMAZA because he hopes the trees will provide fresh air for his farm. He plans to use the income from his KOMAZA trees to pay school fees for his children and hopes that this will lead to a positive change in his life!

loans.use: To pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training, and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Simeona

texts.es:
Simeona, es originaria de la comarca San Antonio, en las afueras de Estelí, es casada y tiene un hijo el cual ya es mayor de edad tiene 33 años y vive en otra localidad de manera independiente.

Ella inicio  las labores de siembra de café hace 10 años a la edad de 53 años cuando en conjunto con su esposo juntaron cierta cantidad de dinero producto de la venta de maíz y frijol, decidieron cultivar una manzana de café así año con año fueron ampliando el área cultivada  hasta lograr  establecer cuatro manzanas que es con lo que cuenta hoy en día. En esta actividad tiene el apoyo de su esposo y de MiCredito. Su producto lo comercializa en un centro de acopio ubicado en la comarca donde vive y este centro se lo vende a una exportadora de café. Cuenta con otros ingresos los que obtiene de la venta de frijol y maíz.  


Le gustaría vender su producto a compradores directos de Europa sin intermediario porque le quedaría mejores ganancias.
Las expectativas que tiene su negocio son seguir ampliando el área de siembra de café. Renovar los cafetales viejos y que mejore el precio del producto para este próximo ciclo 2013 – 2014.
 El crédito lo solicito para la compra de fertilizantes , abonos y otros insumos agrícolas, pago mano de obra para darle mantenimiento a una plantación de 4 manzanas de café. Este crédito le ayudara a crecer su negocio, espera vender a un mejor  y ampliar el área de siembra.
Sus planes futuros son comprar más tierras para cultivar café. Sus metas próximas son obtener buena producción de café en el próximo ciclo y renovar los cafetales que fueron afectados por una plaga.
texts.en:
Simeona is a native of the community of San Antonio located on the outskirts of Estelí. She is married and has an adult son aged 33 who has left home and lives in another area.

Simeona began growing coffee ten years ago at the age of 53. She and her husband got together a sum of money from selling corn and beans and decided to plant a manzana (approximately 1.7 acres) with coffee. As the years passed they increased the area and today they have four manzanas under cultivation. Simeona gets help from her husband and from the bank MiCredito. She sells the coffee at a distribution centre located in the area where she lives; the coffee is then exported.

She also earns money from selling beans and corn. She would like to sell direct to buyers in Europe as without an intermediary she would earn more money. Simeona hopes to expand further the coffee plantation and replace the old plants with new ones. She hopes that the price of coffee will improve in the 2013-14 cycle.

The loan that Simeona is seeking will be used to buy fertilizer, manure and other agricultural supplies, as well as hire labourers to help look after the four manzanas of coffee. The money will help her grow the business, increase sales, and expand the area under cultivation. Her future plans include buying more land. Her goals are to have a better harvest in the next cycle and replace old diseased plants with new ones.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, manure and other agricultural supplies, and hire labourers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fertilizer, manure and insecticide, and hire laborers

loans.name: Serina

texts.en:
Serina is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. They live in Talibon, Bohol. She works in clothing sales. This is her source of income. Serina gives her best in order to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family.

Serina is asking for a loan to buy more clothes, accessories and other items. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store. Serina hopes to make her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, accessories, and other items

loans.name: Grandes Comerciantes Group

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 51 años, ha salido adelante a pesar de varios obstáculos que se presentaron en su vida. A pesar de su deseo de ser una profesional, ella sólo alcanzó a terminar sus estudios de instrucción secundaria.  Se separó de su esposo y fue un obstáculo muy difícil de sobrellevar, no tuvo la oportunidad de tener hijos por lo que ella vive sola. Vive en la Parroquia de Chigüilpe a 15 minutos del centro de Santo Domingo la ciudad capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, un lugar que  tiene un comercio muy activo ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio entre sierra y costa de Ecuador. Esta parroquia tiene varias viviendas de cemento y mixtas de madera con cemento. Tiene un río que es muy visitado y en donde los turistas y habitantes practican varios deportes y además tienen la oportunidad de conocer una cultura tsáchila que suele contar sus leyendas a los visitantes en medio de una fogata y camping. Santo Domingo que es la tercera ciudad más habitada de la región, también contribuye con actividades como la agricultura, ganadería, pesca y manufactura, ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio comercial entre las regiones Sierra y Costa del país. 
María lidera el Grupo “Grandes Comerciantes”, un grupo de 4 personas que se unieron tras el mismo objetivo; buscar apoyo para mejorar y crecer con el negocio que  emprendieron hace algunos años para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus familias.
María se dedica a la comercialización de frutas y verduras en un pequeño espacio de su casa. Ella emprendió con esta actividad desde hace 10 años ya que era necesario aportar con los gastos de la casa. Ahora tiene que sustentar sola sus necesidades y todos los gastos del hogar como son servicios básicos, arreglos eventuales, etc.  Esta mujer emprendedora requiere el crédito para comprar mayor variedad de frutas y verduras y así incrementar sus ingresos que le ayudarán a tener una mejor  calidad de vida. 
Sus amigos emprendedores como ella; Karen, Jaime y Carmen se dedican a diferentes actividades.   Karen es una joven de 19 años, es soltera y tiene un hijo que se está educando, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de forma ambulante y requiere comprar productos de promoción para obtener mejores precios. Jaime al igual que María se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras y desea invertir en la compra de frutas de temporada para incrementar sus ventas. Carmen tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a la venta de calzado y ropa casual. Invertirá en la compra de mayor variedad de productos. Estas personas se han encontrado con obstáculos para el crecimiento en sus negocios debido a la falta de capital y oportunidades de créditos, ahora para lograr este objetivo acudieron a la sucursal que Fundación Alternativa tiene en Santo Domingo y en donde les brindaron agilidad y confianza. Los integrantes de este grupo tienen en común el trabajo duro y esforzado que realizan cada día y que  sin embargo nada ha sido causa para que alguno se dé por vencido, pues sus motivaciones personales y familiares les fortalecen para seguir adelante y luchar por sus sueños.
texts.en:
María, 51, has gotten ahead despite various obstacles that have arisen in her life.  Despite her wish of becoming a professional, she was only able to finish secondary school.  She separated from her husband and this was a very difficult obstacle to overcome.  Because she lives alone she never had children.  She lives in Chigüilpe Parish, 15 minutes from the center of Santo Domingo, capital city of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas Province, a very commercially active place that’s become a land port of exchange between the mountain and coastal regions of Ecuador.

This parish has several cement dwellings and others that are a blend of wood and cement.  It has a river that’s very popular with tourists and residents partake of various sports while also having the opportunity of learning about the Tsáchila culture through sharing legends and storytelling around campfires.  Santo Domingo is the third most populous city in the region and also has agriculture, animal husbandry, fishing and manufacturing since it’s become a place for commercial interchange between the country’s mountain and coast regions.

María leads the “Grandes Comerciantes” (Great Merchants) group, a group of four persons who joined together seeking the same goal: to find support to improve and grow in businesses they started some years ago to improve their and their families’ quality of life.

María sells fruit and vegetables in a small space set aside at home.  She started this activity ten years ago because she needed to contribute towards household expenses.  She now must cover her needs and all household expenses like utilities, occasional repairs, etc. by herself.  This enterprising woman needs a loan to buy a larger variety of fruit and vegetables to increase income to help her have a better quality of life.

Her enterprising friends like her, Karen, Jaime and Carmen, carry out a variety of activities.  Karen, 19, is single and has a son attending school.  She sells cosmetics from place to place and needs to buy products that are on special sale to get better prices.  Jaime, like María, sells fruit and vegetables and wants to buy seasonal fruit to increase sales.  Carmen has two children.  She sells shoes and casual clothes.  She will invest in a wider variety of products.

These people have faced business growth obstacles due to lack of capital and credit opportunities.  In order to reach their objective now, they called on a branch office Fundación Alternativa has in Santo Domingo where they were met with trust and flexibility.  The members of this group have hard work and effort they do daily in common and none of them have ever given up because the personal and family motivation the group has in common is hard, dedicated work they do every day to reach their dreams.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Nevis

texts.es: Nevis compró materias primas para empacar aliños y artículos que le habían encargado sus clientes y que contenía su guía de productos con muchos descuentos. Sus clientes compraron a un buen precio y ella también ganó dinero. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva con el cual comprará nuevas promociones de productos y ganará una vez más premios por su excelente venta, la cual se traduce en artículos que vende y le gana mucho mas. Ella dice a sus financiadores de Kiva :”Gracias por el apoyo financiero, por brindarme la oportunidad de seguir teniendo otra entrada económica a mi hogar. “
texts.en:
Nevis bought raw materials to package seasonings and discounted articles that her customers ordered from her product catalogue.  Her customers bought at a good price and she earned money as well.

Currently she's applying for a Kiva loan to buy new special offers on products.  Once again she'll earn prizes for her excellent sales; she'll turn them into articles to sell, which will earn more for her.

She says to her Kiva lenders: "Thank you for the financial support, for giving me the opportunity to continue having another income for my household."

loans.use: to buy special offers on cosmetics

loans.name: Niza Esther

texts.es: Niza con su anterior credikiva hizo muchas cosas,  se le presentó la oportunidad de genera otros ingresos mediante un nuevo servicio y aprovechó el recurso de Kiva para  comprar 3 lavadoras, que beneficiaron el servicio de arrendamiento de ellas, con las utilidades producidas por el servicio de arrendamiento de estas máquinas, compró mercancías con las que surtió su negocio;  la economía de su hogar mejoró y ahora tiene vida crediticia y conocimiento de nuevos clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando aun nuevo financiamiento mediante el cual comprará  calzado, ropa y artículos deportivos. Ella envía su gratitud a los financiadores de Kiva por todo lo que realizan en ayuda para los empresarios.
texts.en: With her previous Kiva loan Niza did many things, which gave her different opportunities to earn income.  She took advantage of the opportunity to buy 3 washing machines, which benefited her washing machine rental service.  With the income generated from her washing machine business, she was also able to stock her business.   Her family's finances improved, and now she has a credit history and knowledge of new clients. Currently she is applying for yet another loan, which she will use to buy shoes, clothing, and sporting goods. She sends her gratitude to the Kiva lenders for all they do to help businesspeople.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothing, and sporting goods

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: Maria de 60 años de edad es la propietaria de un negocio de confecciones, ella tiene un taller que está ubicado en su domicilio, en el municipio de Malambo. Cuando joven aprendió el oficio y elaborando vestidos para sus amigas, fue poco a poco adquiriendo experiencia y creando su propia clientela,  hasta convertir su actividad en un negocio generador de ingresos. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y ella  desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, trabaja  sin cesar en las operaciones de taller. En la actualidad ha recibido 2 financiamientos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo (nunca con Kiva), mediante los cuales ha logrado adecuar su infraestructura, comprando maquinarias y equipos, mejorando la calidad de sus prendas y aumentando su bienestar. Últimamente los clientes le han hecho pedidos, sobre los cuales debe trabajar muy pronto para responderles, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente, para hacer sus compras, lograr descuentos y con ello ser mucho más competitiva. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a credikiva, mediante el cual comprará en volumen, telas, hilos y accesorios, con los cuales fabricará nuevos diseños y será mucho mas oportuna, razón por la cual su inversión planea ser mas exitosa.
texts.en:
Maria is 60 years old and owns a fabric store. She has a workshop in her home in the town of Malambo. She learned this profession when she was young, and through making dresses for her friends she slowly built up experience and created her own customer base, until she turned this activity into a profit-making business. She makes cash sales and and works tirelessly in the workshop from eight in the morning until six in the evening. 

She has received two loans from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo (never through Kiva), through which she has managed to fit out her workshop, buying sewing machines and equipment, improving the quality of her clothes and increasing her profits. Recently, customers have made orders, and she has to work very quickly to meet them. However, she doesn't have enough working capital to buy everything she needs, get discounts and, through this, be much more competitive. 

For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Kiva, with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy fabric, threads and accessories in bulk. She will use these to make new designs and work faster, which is why she thinks her investment will be a success.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads and accessories in bulk.

loans.name: Fredy Marcelo

texts.es:
Fredy es un joven emprendedor de 23 años, es soltero, no tiene hijos. Ha estudiado algunos niveles en la universidad y su mayor sueño es terminar allí sus estudios para convertirse en profesional y aportar en el crecimiento de su país. Vive con su hermano Mario en Quito la capital de los ecuatorianos, en el barrio llamado “Chillogallo” ubicado al sur de la ciudad, sector que hasta hace pocos años no era tomado en cuenta dentro de los sectores económicos fuertes de la capital de la República del Ecuador, ahora este sector es considerado una fuerza de la economía de la ciudad. En este lugar se encuentran familias emprendedoras que han luchado para sobresalir. Entre nativos y migrantes de otras ciudades y países, ha sido el punto de encuentro de habitantes de varias provincias, y está reconstruido con extensas calles, un sector en el cual su alta actividad comercial es cada vez más fortalecida y aporta en gran manera al crecimiento económico de la ciudad. Se destaca en esta zona los parques con amplias zonas verdes en los cuales se dan cita las familias los fines de semana. Hay gran accesibilidad a todo tipo de servicios y sus habitantes son emprendedores que aprovechan cada oportunidad que se presenta con establecimiento de nuevos negocios.
Fredy emprendió con el establecimiento de una tienda de artículos de primera necesidad en este sector desde hace 3 años; lo aprendió de algunos familiares e invierte al menos 6 horas en la atención del mismo. Con su esfuerzo este negocio se ha ido fortaleciendo, sin embargo la dificultad de conseguir financiamiento para el crecimiento de su negocio, ha sido un obstáculo que se ha presentado muy seguido. Fredy requiere un préstamo con el cual pueda comprar productos para llevar a su tienda y ofrecer surtido a sus clientes, además comprar algunas legumbres y frutas que siempre son solicitadas por quienes llegan a comprar al lugar. Con los ingresos adicionales que obtenga, Fredy podrá financiar la continuación de sus estudios universitarios a distancia para así no descuidar su negocio. Gracias a Fundación Alternativa, este joven emprendedor podrá obtener el capital que no ha conseguido antes y así crecer personal, laboral y profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Fredy is a hardworking young man who is 23 years old and single. He does not have children. He has taken several courses at the university and his greatest dream is to finish his studies in order to become a professional and contribute to his country’s development.

Fredy lives with his brother, Mario, in Quito, the capital of Ecuador, in a barrio called “Chillogallo,” which is located in the southern part of the city. Until recently the neighborhood was ignored as an area of strong economic growth in the capital. Now, however, this area is considered a strong center of economic growth. Here, hardworking families have struggled to succeed. The area’s inhabitants include both native-born and migrants from other cities and countries. It has been a meeting point for people from various provinces and it is being re-built with broad streets. It is an area with a high level of commercial activity and it is constantly growing and contributing to the economic growth of the city. Parks form spacious green zones where families get together on weekends. The people here have access to all kinds of services and they are entrepreneurs who take advantage of every opportunity to establish new businesses.

Three years ago, Fredy opened a store selling basic necessities in the area. He learned the business from some relatives and devotes at least six hours a day to it. Through his efforts, this business has been growing. Nevertheless he has often encountered difficulty in obtaining funding to expand his store. He needs a loan so that he can purchase products to stock his store and sell to his customers. In addition he wants to buy vegetables and fruits, which are in high demand from his customers.  With the additional income he will receive, Fredy will be able to finance his university studies at a distance so that he can also tend to his business while he studies. 

Thanks to Fundación Alternativa, this enterprising young man will be able to finally accumulate the capital that he has been unable to acquire until now. Thus he can continue to grow personally, as a business man and professionally.

loans.use: to purchase products to expand the selection of goods in his store.

loans.name: Loani Group

texts.es: Loani, es un Banco Comunal ubicado en la ciudad de Concepción; lo conforman  17 socios, los cuales tiene distintos rubros en los que aprovecharon su crédito. Constanza, que en la foto aparece sentada al costado inferior izquierdo y vestida de gris con un bolso blanco cruzado, participa como socia en este Banco Comunal, ha querido darnos su testimonio de cómo ha sido poder acceder a este crédito. Ella nos cuenta que el crédito que solicitó lo ocupara principalmente en comprar joyas de plata y también tiene la opción de comprar más accesorios como carteras y billeteras para poner a la venta. Constanza es muy positiva que esperar ganar el doble de lo que ha invertido y así además tener más tiempo para compartir con su hija y tener una oportunidad para salir adelante. Espera además tener cambios positivos en su negocio y vida personal, y que de esa manera además se le abran las puertas en el comercio.  Su único desafío hasta el momento es de poder salir adelante con su negocio. Y espera también que el crédito le ayude a superarse, ya que lleva mucho tiempo sin trabajo y ella necesita salir adelante por su hija y por su bebe que está esperando, espera además con ansias las capacitaciones que tendrá. Dentro de sus metas de encuentra tener un negocio establecido, y de todas maneras seguir participando en la Fundación ya que ayuda mucho de forma integral.
