During the sowing season Narzullo has sowed wheat and now to process the land he needs mineral fertilizer and also he wants to sow vegetables. With this purpose he has come for a loan. Narzullo is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds of potatoes, onion and carrots.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and also seeds of potatoes, onion and carrots.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Cándida, de  52 años de edad, es dueña de una  humilde venta o  pulpería como popularmente se le conoce, habita en la ciudad de León , solo finalizo la primaria. Es madre de 9 hijos de los cuales solo dos están a cargo los demás viven independiente. Ella comenzó su negocio hace 4 años, pues anteriormente sobrevivían de la pensión de su esposo pero no era suficiente y necesitaba terminar de preparar con estudios a hijos menores por ese motivo puso  la pulpería pues las ganancias son diarias y con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mantener su negocio. Ella utilizara el crédito para comprar arroz, aceite, azúcar gaseosas, pan, queso, crema, caramelos, galletas y sopas.  Ella anhela convertir su pulpería en una miscelánea y que su familia tenga lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
Cándida is 52 years old and owns a small grocery store where she lives in the city of León. She only finished primary school. She has nine children, of which two still live at home with her – the rest are now independent.

Cándida started her business four years ago. Before starting her business, she survived on her husband’s pension, but it wasn’t enough and her young children still needed to finish their education. For this reason, she started the small grocery store, which gives her daily profits, and with a lot of effort she has been able to maintain her business. She will use this loan to buy rice, oil, sugar, carbonated soft drinks, bread, cheese, cream, candies, cookies, crackers and soup. She dreams of expanding her small grocery store into a larger general store so that her family would have what they need to live.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, carbonated soft drinks, bread, cheese, cream, candies, cookies, crackers and soup.

loans.name: Ana Amparo

texts.es:
Ana, de 43 años de edad, de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una pulpería desde hace 6 años tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 16 años de edad. Ella decidió poner una pulpería porque en su vecindario son escasos este tipo de negocios pero son de mucha necesidad, además que era una oportunidad de conseguir ingresos por sí misma y a la vez estar cerca de sus hijos ya que el negocio lo tiene en su casa. 
Ana espera en lo futuro tener una distribuidora de alimentos donde sus clientes encuentren de todo para el hogar.  
Ella quiere el préstamo para comprar ropa para dama y caballero, ropa interior, granos básicos, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, leña.  Son parte de los productos más demandados y los que a diario solicitan sus clientes. Uno de sus planes es cancelar su crédito y sacar otro para invertir en la compra de más productos comestibles y mantener surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is 43 years old and has two children, ages 18 and 16. She has had a small grocery store in her home for six years now. She decided to start her business because there weren’t many small grocery stores in her neighborhood but there was a great need for them. Moreover, it was an opportunity to earn income for herself while at the same time being close to her children.

Ana hopes in the future to expand her business into a larger store where her clients can find everything for the home.

She is requesting this loan to buy men’s and women’s clothing, underwear, basic grains, oil, sugar, bathroom tissue and firewood. These products are what her customers request the most on a daily basis. One of her plans is to pay off this loan so as take out another loan to buy more groceries to keep her store well stocked.

loans.use: to buy clothing, basic grains, oil, sugar, bathroom tissue and firewood.

loans.name: Filwende Group

texts.fr:
Mme BINTOU est responsable du groupe FILWENDE. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 26ans et le moins âgé a 10ans. Un va à l’école.
Mme fait la restauration depuis 13ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Toecin. Ses clients sont les hommes, les femmes et les enfants.
Elle veut s’acheter 01sac d’igname et du pain.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle désir épargner. Elle ambitionne améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et construire sa parcelle.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bintou is the leader of the FILWENDE group. She is married and the mother of four children, the eldest of whom is 26 and the youngest 10 years old. One child attends school.

She has been active in the restaurant business for 13 years.She resupplies at the Toecin market. Her clients are men, women and children.

She wants to buy one bag of sweet potatoes and bread. She will put her profits into savings. She aims to improve her family's living conditions and build on her plot.

loans.use: buy one bag of sweet potatoes and bread

loans.name: Kenia Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Kenia una humilde joven de  23 años de edad, originaria de Granada, casada, madre de 1 hijos de 3 años, de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una pulpería de la que es propietaria hace más de 2 años, debido a sus condiciones de pobreza solo logro finalizar su tercer años de secundaria. Inicio desde muy joven en el ámbito del comercio vendiendo cajetas, ya que su mama es una persona muy trabajadora y le enseño a ganarse la vida de manera honrada y generar ingresos por sí misma, la cual con mucho esfuerzo y arduo trabajo ha podido salir adelante cada día, pero con las ganancias que le genera este negocio no se siente muy satisfecha, fue por eso que   decidió vender ropa para obtener ingresos extras, con el objetivo de ir invirtiendo mas en su pulpería, con productos que aún no tiene en inventario y poder satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela, actualmente solo se dedica a su pulpería.
Kenia está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar azúcar, arroz, frijoles, gaseosa, aceite, etc. Ella dice que este préstamo le ayudara a comprar en mayor cantidad todos los productos para su pulpería, dentro de sus planes futuros es poder mejorar la infraestructura del local en donde tiene su negocio.
texts.en:
Kenia is 23 years old, married, and has one child, who is three years old. She is a native of Granada and describes herself as being of humble means. 

Kenia has owned and worked in her own small grocery store for more than two years now. Because she was poor, she only finished her third year of secondary school. She started work in sales at a very young age, at first selling dulce de leche. She says her mother is very hardworking and showed her how to make an honest living for herself. Through her effort and hard work, she was getting ahead every day, but she was not satisfied with the earnings she was receiving from selling dulce de leche. For this reason, she decided to sell clothing to earn more income. She invested this income in her grocery store to add products to her inventory that she did not have but would satisfy the needs of her customers. Now she only works at her grocery store.

Kenia is requesting this loan to buy sugar, rice, beans, carbonated drinks, oil and other groceries. She says that this loan will help her to buy all of the products for her grocery store in larger quantities. One of her future plans is to make improvements to the building where she has her store.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans, carbonated drinks, oil and other groceries.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe, una humilde comerciante de 63 años de edad, habitante de la ciudad de León, casada, madre de 6 hijos todos mayores de edad. Ella  estudio para ser maestra de primaria, pero también tiene su negocio de venta de sandalias al dejar de dar clases se dedicó por completo al comercio pero un día le llamo la atención un programa de televisión donde enseñaban manualidades en especial la elaboración de piñatas aprendió y decidió emprender este negocio variando formas, estilos, tamaños. Tiene 7 años con el negocio, sus productos los distribuye en los mercados,  por encargos, en su casa. El uso de colores diferentes, personajes de caricaturas, tamaños son atractivos que  buscan su principal clientela que son los niños. Por tal motivo necesita materia prima para trabajar, requiere comprar papel crepe, cartulinas, pegamentos, ollas de barro, alambre, fomi, máscaras, muñecas de plásticos, mecate, silicón, etc.   
Uno de sus proyectos es comprar una máquina de coser para elaborar manteles, cortinas, almohadas, cobertores para  vender y ofrecer variedad a su clientela.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a humble 63 year old merchant. She lives in the city of León. She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are grown. She studied to be a teacher but she also has has a business selling sandals. When she stopped teaching she became a merchant full time but one day a television program caught her attention where they taught crafts, especially making pinatas. She learned and decided to start this business with different shapes, styles and sizes. She has had this business for 7 years. She distributes her merchandise in markets, by order and from her house. The use of different colors, characters and sizes are things that her customers look for, who are mainly children. For that reason, she needs raw materials to work. She requires crepe paper, cardboard, glue, clay pots, wire, craft foam, masks, plastic dolls, cord, silicon, etc.  
 
One of her projects is to buy a sewing machine to make table cloths, curtains, pillows, and bedspreads to offer variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy crepe paper, cardboard, glue, clay pots, wire, craft foam, masks, plastic dolls, cord, silicon, etc.

loans.name: Claudia Mercedes

texts.es: Claudia es habitante de la ciudad de León, casada, madre de dos hijos, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a vender muebles, lleva 6 años  con esta actividad. Inicio con muy poco capital poco a poco fue notando que era un negocio rentable pues los muebles que fabrican son artesanales, esta actividad la comparte junto con su esposo, en su pequeño taller elaboran camas, sillas , mesas, cunas de madera , llevan 6 años con esta actividad y de la cual sobrevive su familia y paga la escuela de sus hijos. Actualmente vende mesas de noche, roperos, sillas mecedoras. Poco a poco quiere aumentar la variedad de muebles para ofrecer a su clientela. Ella  esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar madera, pegamento, clavos, tornillos, pintura, barniz y lijas. Esto le ayudara a conseguir con mayor facilidad la materia prima que necesita para elaborar variedad de muebles para el hogar.  Ella sueña con tener una gran mueblería  y poder mejorar sus ingresos y construir su casa para darle un techo digno a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Claudia lives with her husband and two children in the city of León. For the past six years she has worked selling furniture. She says she started out with very little capital but gradually saw that the business was profitable because the furniture they make is crafted by hand. Claudia shares this business with her husband. In their small workshop they make beds, chairs, tables and wooden cribs. Their business has allowed them to provide for their family and pay for their children’s school. She currently sells night tables, wardrobes and rocking chairs. She hopes to gradually increase the variety of furniture she can offer to her customers.  

Claudia is requesting this loan to buy wood, glue, nails, screws, paint, varnish and sandpaper. She says the loan will make it easier for her to obtain the raw materials she needs to make a variety of home furniture. Her dream is to have a large furniture store to improve her earnings and build a suitable house for her children.

loans.use: to buy wood, glue, nails, screws, paint, varnish and sandpaper.

loans.name: Nelson Celestino

texts.es:
Nelson, 33 años de edad originario de Telica municipio de León, casado, padre de 2 hijos. Él es carpintero lleva 10 años dedicándose a fabricar muebles, este oficio lo aprendió desde muy joven con la idea de poner su propio taller y así lo hizo. Actualmente este es el único negocio con el cual sostiene a su familia, cuenta con la ayuda de tres trabajadores. El sale a vender de manera ambulante todo lo que elabora en su taller, también hace reparaciones de muebles. Su esposa se dedica a dar clases de primaria. El desea ampliar su taller de carpintería, fabricar variedad de muebles de calidad, poder dar empleo a más personas y lograr tener su propia tienda de muebles finos en el centro de la ciudad. 
Él está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar madera y máquina para lijar y pulir madera.
texts.en:
Nelson is 33 years old. He is from Telica, municipality of León. He is married and the father of 2 children. He is a carpenter and for 10 years has made furniture. He learned this profession when he was very young with the plan of opening his own workshop, which he did. Right now, this is the only business with which he supports his family and he has the help of three workers. He goes out to sell everything he makes in his workshop as a street vendor. He also repairs furniture. His wife is a primary school teacher. He wants to expand his workshop, making quality furniture and serving as an example for more people, with his own fine furniture store in the center of town.
 
He needs the loan to buy wood and a machine to sand and polish wood.

loans.use: to buy wood and a machines to sand and polish wood.

loans.name: Erling Del Carmen

texts.es:
Erling, una humilde joven ,24 años de edad, es madre de 2 dos pequeñas niñas  de 5 y  2 años de edad. Ella  vive en uno de los barrios más pobres de Estelí, trabaja vendiendo productos de belleza.

 Ella empezó en este negocio a los 19 años de edad, trabajando con su cuñada pero después ella vio que era un buen negocio y le producía ganancias   entonces decidió hacerlo por  cuenta propia además que le permitió con sus ingresos contribuir al sustento de su familia, su esposo trabaja lavando carros en una gasolinera con lo que el  gana ella compra la comida y paga la escuela para su hija mayor.
 Ella solicita este crédito para poder comprar cremas, perfumes ropa y artículos de cocina y zapatos todos de la misma línea que ella vende ella se siente muy contenta por la oportunidad que le damos al darle financiamiento para este fin cree que le ayudara mucho porque tendrá más inventario para mostrar a sus clientes sus productos y aumentar sus ingresos.  Una de sus metas próximas es mejorar la infraestructura de su humilde casa ya que el techo y la madera  están deteriorándose y desea brindarles un techo digno a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Erling is a humble 24 year old woman. She is the mother of 2 little girls, aged 5 and 2. She lives in one of the poorest neighborhoods of Estelí and sells beauty products.  

She started this business when she was 19, working with her sister in law. Later she saw that it was a good business and produced earnings, so she decided to do it on her own. This allowed her to have income to contribute to the support of the family. Her husband works washing cars at a gas station and what he earns pays for the food and schooling for their oldest daughter. 

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy creams, perfumes, clothing, cooking items and shoes, all from the same line that she sells. She is happy for the opportunity that we are giving her for this. She thinks it will help her a lot because she will have more inventory to show her customers her products and increase her income. One of her main goals is to improve the infrastructure of her humble home, since the roof and the wood are deteriorating and she wants to give her daughters a dignified life.

loans.use: to buy creams, perfume, clothing, cooking items and shoes.

loans.name: Tubeho Group

texts.fr:
Elie fait partie du groupe Tubeho et   habite à Ngozi. Il a 41 ans et est marié à Césarée, une  cultivatrice. Ensemble ils sont 6 enfants âgés  âgés de  1  à 12 ans, dont 3 étudient.
Il prend soin de son neveu qui étudie.

Elle fait le commerce des pièces de rechange, de postes de radio et il vend aussi le service de charge batterie.

Il  est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  un chargeur batterie et de pièces de rechange de poste de radio à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Elie is a member of the Tubeho group and lives in Ngozi. He is 41 years old and married to Césarée, a farmer. The couple have 6 children, aged between 1 and 12, three of whom attend school. He is also taking care of his nephew, who is a student.

Elie sells spare parts for radios and also provides a battery-charging service. This is his 5th loan with Turame. His Kiva-sponsored loan will increase his capital and allow him to buy a battery charger and replacement parts for radios for resale, so that he can earn more.

loans.use: to buy a battery charger and replacement parts for radios.

loans.name: Bagiramahoro Joseph

texts.fr:
BAGIRAMAHORO est marié et a 39 ans , il a 4 enfant dont 3 vont à l`école.le plus àgé a 17 ans et le moins agé a 4 ans. il a étudié les études primaires.

Il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter une moto .

les difficultes de non remboursement sont l`accident et la maladie.

Ses stratégies pour la croissance de son affaire est de travailler beaucoup pour gagner plus de profit.

Ses ambitions est de dévenir le chauffeur d`un véhicule et pour sa famille c`est éduquer ses enfants et assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en: Bagiramahoro Joseph is married and is 39 years old. He has 4 children, 3 of whom go to school. The eldest is 17 years old and the youngest, 4. He has a primary level education. He is requesting this loan to buy a motorbike. The difficulties he foresees in repaying the loan would be due to an accident, or illness. His strategy for the growth of his business is to work hard to make more profits. His ambition is to become the driver of a vehicle and, as far as his family goes, to make sure his children get an education and to ensure his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Leonille

texts.en: Leonille is 51 years old. She is divorced with three children. The oldest is 25 and the youngest is 19. She has been in business for 18 years. She wants a loan to buy more sorghum and bananas to sell. With the profit she will pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine is 20 years old and lives in the town of Hima in the Fortportal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Christine has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothes.  To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 800000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a variety of clothing for both men and women, and will help Christine to generate greater profits and make more profits. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to boost the business.
 
Christine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing for both men and women.

loans.name: Tania Olimpia

texts.es:
Tania, 24 años de edad, habitante de la ciudad de Estelí, es una joven emprendedora  que tiene  dos hijos pequeños pesar de ser madre soltera ha sabido salir adelante y con su trabajo ser el sustento para su familia. Actualmente tiene el negocio del salón de belleza el primer crédito lo utilizo para la compra de mercadería del salón como tintes tratamientos de belleza accesorios, cepillos, maquillajes pinturas de uñas, perfumes le ayudó mucho porque tenía inventario para atender a sus clientas y pudo obtener buenos ingresos.
Uno de sus proyectos que se ha propuesto realizar es establecer una mini tienda de ropa
Es por eso que está necesitando el financiamiento para comprar ropa, tintes, maquillaje etc. Poco a poco desea ir creciendo como comerciante y mejorar la calidad de vida para sus hijos y puedan tener una buena educación.
texts.en:
Tania, 24, is an enterprising young woman that lives in the city of Estelí. She has two children, and despite her being a single mother, she has been able to get ahead with her job and be her family’s support. Tania owns a beauty salon. She used the first loan she received to buy supplies like dyes, beauty products, accessories, make up, nail polish and perfumes. It helped her to stock her business, take good care of her customers and make good profits.

One of Tania’s projects is to start a small clothing store. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy clothes, dyes, make up, etc. She wants to expand her business step by step, improve her children’s quality of life and give them access to a good education.

loans.use: to buy clothes, dyes and make up, among other things.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en: Teopista is married with five children, three of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grand children). She has a business of poultry farming and has been in this business for 20 years, selling to all categories of people on both a retail and wholesale basis. She also generates additional income from selling chicken feed. She works from home seven days of the week. She has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of chicken feed. Her major business challenges include transportation, thieves and seasonality. She aspires to own a fully-stocked shop selling chicken feed and also to sell on wholesale only. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 36 years old and married. She and her husband have been blessed with four children. She is a poultry farmer and has been in business for three years. Right now her monthly income from the business is KES 7,000. She is requesting a loan of KES 42,000 which she intends to use to purchase more poultry.

She plans to purchase more poultry with the anticipated profit from the business. This is her second loan and she successfully repaid her previous loan.

loans.use: To buy more chicks and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence used her previous loan to purchase cloth materials to sell, as well as sewing threads and needles. Right now her monthly income from the business is KES 36,000. She is borrowing KES 100,000 which she intends to use to purchase a modern machine and assorted cloth fabrics.

She plans to build rental houses with the anticipated profit from the business. This is her second loan and she successfully repaid her previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase a modern machine and assorted cloth fabrics.

loans.name: Itange Group

texts.fr:
Itange est composé de 7 femmes.Sur la photo Léoncie, et Générose ont été représentées par leurs maris respectifs: Tharcisse, et Sylvain.

Yvonne, la représentante de groupe, habite à Ngozi. Elle a 53 ans et est mariée à François, un commerçant et agriculteur. Ensemble ils sont 2 enfants âgés  âgés de  15  à 25 ans, dont 1 étudie.
Elle prend soin  de 2 orphelins.

Elle fait le commerce de viande de bière Primus, limonade, et elle fait aussi de l’agriculture.

Il  est à son  dixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bière à revendre et quelques chèvres à  abattre pour vendre de la viande, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
The Itange group is made up of 7 women. In the picture, Léoncie and Générose are represented by their respective husbands, Tharcisse and Sylvain. 

Yvonne, the group representative, lives in Ngozi. She is 53 years old and married to François, a retailer and farmer. The couple have 2 children aged 15 and 25, one of whom attends school. She is also taking care of 2 orphans. She sells Primus beer and lemonade, and is also a farmer. This is her 10th loan from Turame. Her Kiva-sponsored loan will increase her capital and enable her to buy a large amount of beer for resale and some goats for slaughter, so that she can sell the meat and earn more.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of beer for resale and some goats for slaughter, so that she can sell the meat.

loans.name: Dorayda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dorayda, de 31 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Estelí , madre de 1 hijo de 9 años de edad, casada, se dedica al comercio es dueña de una pulpería , a pesar de haber terminado solo la primaria ha salido adelante generando ingresos para su familia. Está muy agradecida por el respaldo recibido atravez de su crédito Kiva el cual le permitió surtir su negocio con productos que le solicitaban sus clientes. 
Está necesitando este  crédito para comprar pan, arroz, aceite, azúcar, gaseosas café, pan, productos de limpieza. Su sueño más grande es ver su pulpería prosperada y bien surtida para así tener todo de lo que demande la población y darle una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Dorayda, 31, is originally from the city of Estelí. She is married and the mother of a 9-year-old boy. Dorayda is a saleswoman and owns a grocery store. Although she did not continue studying after primary school, she has been able to get ahead and support her family. She is grateful for the support she has received through a Kiva loan, which helped her stock her business with products that her customers were demanding.

Dorayda is now requesting a loan to buy bread, rice, oil, sugar, beverages, coffee and cleaning products. Her biggest dreams are to see a well-known and well-stocked store, with everything locals might require, and to give her son access to a good education.

loans.use: to buy bread, rice, oil, sugar and other supplies for her store.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is 31 years old. He is married with three children. The oldest is seven and the youngest is three. His wife is a farmer. He has been in business for seven years. He wants a loan to buy more rice, sugar, and cooking oil to sell. He plans to use the profit to finish up his house.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is married with three children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (father). She has a business of selling cosmetics and weaves. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cosmetics as well as hairweaves, vaseline, powder and braids. She works in a shop and works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include thieves, seasonality and transportation. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to own a fully stocked cosmetics shop. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics  as well as hairweaves, vaseline, powder and braids.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 38 years old. She is married with nine children. The oldest is 14 and the youngest is nine. Her husband is her partner in business. She has been in business for three years. She wants a loan to buy more car spare parts to sell. She will put the profit towards finishing her house.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: La señora Cristina, 63 años de edad, casada, madre de dos hijos mayores de edad, habitante  de la ciudad de  Estelí. Se dedica atender una pulpería ,lleva 10 años con este negocio el cual inicio cuando solo vendía productos lácteos con las ganancias fue comprando otros productos de consumo alimenticio hasta que logro formar su pulpería pequeña pero con mucho esfuerzo ha salido adelante . El crédito lo está solicitando para comprar leche, mantequilla, crema, queso, yogurt, jugos, snacks, aceite, granos básicos, azúcar, pasta de dientes,  gaseosas, huevo, pan, galletas, etc. Con el  financiamiento podrá comprar más productos que a diario le solicitan sus clientes. Su meta próxima es surtir más su negocio y ampliar el espacio donde lo tienen ubicado.
texts.en: Cristina is 63 years old, married, mother to two adult children, and a native of the city of Esteli. She is dedicated to attending a grocery store. She has 10 years with this business, which she started when she sold only dairy products. With the income, she bought other consumable products until she managed to form her small grocery store. With a lot of effort she has moved ahead. The loan she is requesting is to buy milk, butter, cream, cheese, yogurt, juices, snacks, oil, basic grains, sugar, toothpaste, sodas, eggs, bread, cookies, etc. With the loan, she will be able to buy more products that her customers request on a daily basis. Her next goal is to stock her business more and expand the space where it is located.

loans.use: to buy milk, butter, cream, cheese, yogurt, juices, snacks, oil, basic grains, sugar, toothpaste, soda, eggs, bread, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Edik

texts.en: Edik is from Qajaran town. He works hard to sustain his family of four: his wife, 19-year-old son and 17-year-old daughter. Edik and his wife do their best to give their children appropriate living conditions and education. Edik's son is a student at State Engineering University of Armenia. He is a very proactive and hardworking young man who dreams of getting a qualification and finding a job. As it is very difficult for Edik to cover his son's educational costs, he has applied for this loan. The loan will help Edik to pay for his son's university tuition and give him an opportunity to get a higher education and make his dreams come true.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es: La señora Maria, habitante de la ciudad de León , se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y sopas , ha sido una de nuestros mejores clientes pues paga sus créditos anticipadamente, ella dice que el ser beneficiado con el financiamiento le ha permitido tener capital de trabajo para surtir su negocio con variedad de prendas para vender en su negocio al igual poder vender sus sabrosas y típicas sopas durante la semana santa, está muy agradecida por permitirle crecer poco apoco.  Estamos en la época de verano donde la moda de ropa playera esta muy de moda quiere aprovechar para vender, es por eso que está solicitando el crédito para comprar short, chinelas, camisetas, trajes de baño, toallas, etc. Ella dice que las ventas son muy buenas no quiere dejar pasar la oportunidad de mejorar sus ingresos y trabajar por un futuro mejor.
texts.en: Maria, a resident of the city of Leon, is dedicated to selling used clothing and soup. She has been one of our best clients since she pays her loans early. She says that to be the beneficiary of the loan has allowed her to have the working capital to stock her business with a variety of clothing to sell in her business as well as be able to sell her tasty and typical soups during holy week. She is very thankful for allowing her to grow gradually. We are in the summer season when beach clothing is very in fashion. She wants to take advantage of this to sell. It is for this that she is requesting a loan to buy shorts, slippers, T-shirts, bathing suits, towels, etc. She says that her sales are very good. She does not want to pass up the opportunity to improve her income and work for a better future.

loans.use: to buy shorts, slippers, T- shirts, bathing suits, towels, etc.

loans.name: Marjorie Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marjorie, vive en la ciudad de León, es madre de tres hijos de 10,7 y 2 años de edad, ella se dedica a vender comida desde hace 4 años , anteriormente tenía un bar pero decidió quitarlo y comenzar la venta de comida. Actualmente tiene 2 trabajadores que le ayudan con el negocio mientras ella cocina , ella reparte comida en las terminales de buses al igual que vende en su pequeño local , uno de los platillos más buscado durante esta época de semana santa es la famosa ´´Sopa de queso´´ su clientela se la solicita muy constantemente, también vende comida casera y trata d variar el menú para atraer a su clientela vende frescos naturales y gaseosas . De esta manera se gana la vida y sostiene a sus hijos. 
Ella está requiriendo el préstamo para comprar arroz, aceite, frijoles, pollo, carne, gaseosas, huevos, aceite plátanos, salsas, azúcar, frutas para frescos etc. Este crédito le ayudara a comprar materia prima para la elaboración de comidas que vende sobre todo los platillos que se preparan durante la semana santa. Uno de sus planes futuros es poner una venta de asados por las tardes para que su clientela tenga variedad y opciones de comida.
texts.en: Marjorie lives in the city of Leon. She is mother to three children who are 10, 7 and 2 years old. She has been dedicated to selling food for four years. Previously, she had a bar but she decided to leave it and begin selling food. Currently, she has two employees who help her with the business while she cooks. She sells food in the bus terminals as well as selling in her small restaurant. One of the most requested dishes during this season of  holy week is the famous "sopa de queso" (cheese soup). Her customers request it constantly. Also she sells home cooking and she tries to vary the menu to attract her customers. She sells natural drinks and sodas. In this way, she makes a living and supports her children. She requires a loan to buy rice, oil, beans, chicken, sodas, eggs, banana oil, sauces, sugar, fruit for drinks, etc. This loan will help her to buy ingredients to make food that she sells, above all the dishes she prepares during holy week. One of her future plans is to sell roasts in the evenings so her customers have variety and options of food.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, beans, chicken, meat, sodas, banana oil, sauces, sugar, fruit for drinks etc.

loans.name: Silvio Ramon

texts.es:
Silvio, es un humilde agricultor originario de la comarca Lechecuagos, en las afueras de León, padre de 4 hijos de 27,24, 21 y 14 años de edad de los cuales los tres menores están estudiando. Él se dedica a sembrar desde su infancia pues su familia se dedicaba a trabajar en las siembras de hortalizas y vegetales tales como la yuca. Actualmente siembra yuca y ajonjolí actividad que realiza junto con su esposa y un trabajador, la mayoría de sus cultivos los vende a compradores mayoristas en los mercados de la ciudad de León. Su expectativa es sacar buenas cosechas de calidad para vender a un buen precio. 
Él está solicitando el financiamiento para comprar fertilizantes, abonos, semillas para sembrar yuca, uno de los vegetales que más utilizan las comiderias para preparar las sopas típicas que se comen durante la semana santa y que forma parte del menú de comidas tradicionales de León.  Uno de sus proyecto que desea realizar es comprar ganado al igual fortalecer la venta de miel para aprovechar que tiene colmena de abejas y de esta manera conseguir otras formas de ingresos que le ayuden a darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Silvio is a humble farmer, native of the region of Lechecuagos, in the suburbs of Leon. He is father to four children who are 27, 24, 21 and 14 years old, of whom the three youngest are students. He has been dedicated to farming since infancy since his family was dedicated to the planting of vegetables and vegetables like cassava. Currently, he plants cassava and sesame, an activity that he does along with his wife and a worker. He sells the majority of his crops to wholesale buyers in the markets of the city of Leon. His expectation is to have good quality crops to sell at a good price.

He is requesting the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds to sow cassava, one of the vegetables that is most used by restaurants to prepare the typical soups that they eat during holy week and that form part of the traditional menus of Leon. One of the projects that he wishes to complete is to buy cattle, as well as strengthen the sale of honey to take advantage of having beehives and, in this way, obtain other forms of income that help give a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds to plant cassava.

loans.name: Wanza

texts.en:
Wanza is married and works as a merchant. She is the owner of a food stall where she's been working for nine years. She says that she's making headway with the business because she's attracted a good number of customers. This is due to the fact that she always has a very well-stocked food stall. 

Wanza is a very enthusiastic person who wants to keep growing and investing in her business so she can help with the household expenses and continue to improve her business over time.

She is requesting a loan to buy drinks, dairy products, bread, vegetables and other products. This way, she can continue to provide her customers with a good variety of products and also attract new customers.

loans.use: to buy drinks, dairy products, bread, vegetables and other products.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana, una humilde comerciante de 46 años de edad, habitante de la ciudad de León, se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde los 26 años de edad. Ella dice que  haber sido beneficiada con su primer crédito le trajo cambios positivos a su negocio pues logro comprar maíz y leña para almacenar y producir más tortillas, además que le permitió comprar más barato y lograr mejorar un poco sus ganancias.  
Está solicitando este financiamiento para comprar  maíz, leña,y 4 recipientes plásticos para preparar el maíz. Su producto tiene más demanda y por tanto requiere materia prima trabajar ahora tiene a 2 personas que le ayudan a elaborar tortillas. Otro proyecto que desea realizar para semana santa es la venta de tamales  pues durante esta época se venden bastante.
texts.en:
Ana is a humble storekeeper who is forty-six years old.  She lives in the city of León and has made a living selling tortillas since she was twenty-six years old.  She says that her first loan was beneficial in that it brought positive changes to her business; she was able to buy corn and firewood to store and to produce more tortillas.  This also allowed her to buy items at a cheaper price, and to make more of a profit.

She is requesting this financing in order to buy corn, firewood, and four plastic containers in which to prepare the corn.  Her product has more demand and for this reason, she requires raw materials and extra help; she currently has two people that help her to make her tortillas.  

Another project that she hopes to carry out during Holy Week is selling tamales; they are able to sell a lot during that season.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and four plastic containers in which to prepare the corn.

loans.name: Kristina

texts.en:
Kristina is a Romanian woman. She is 25 years old and married with three young children who are not attending any schools yet. The family lives in a Romanian neighborhood in the central region of Albania.

Kristina is requesting her first loan to buy secondhand items to resell. Usually she resells used clothes and drapes. She says that the money she has generated from this activity has been a great help to her family.

"I have been able to earn enough for our basics and this is very important because some families in our community don’t even have the basics," Kristina says.

loans.use: To buy secondhand items to resell at the local market.

loans.name: Mwangaza Group

texts.en:
Martha is a member of the Mwangaza Group in Kakamega North District. She is pictured with 10 One Acre Fund farmers, 7 women and 3 men.  Martha is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Martha is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season.  She joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to get the best prices on hybrid seed and fertilizer.

Martha described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one as a One Acre Fund farmer. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and repair her home. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Martha’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each.  In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Delia Delvie

texts.es:
Delia, 38 años de edad, es una humilde comerciante, ama de casa que a pesar de no haber culminado, sus estudios a como ella hubiera deseado, es una persona muy trabajadora con deseo de salir adelante, originaria Siuna Rosita, pero actualmente vive en Managua, solo finalizo la secundaria, orgullosa madre de 3 hijos de 9, 10 y 14 años. Actualmente los 3 están estudiando, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortilla, desde hace 8 años. Inicio su actividad, con capital propio, dinero que tenía ahorrado, esta ha sido su primer negocio del que se siente muy satisfecha porque le genera ganancias a diario, cuentas con clientes  fijos, además de vender tortillas, también vende  frijoles para obtener otros ingresos extras, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y sus hijos, recibe otros ingresos como es la venta de recarga telefónica.
Delia esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar maíz, leña, frijoles,gas, etc. Ella estima que este crédito le ayudara a comprar toda la materia prima que necesita para la elaboración de sus tortillas, con el objetivo de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, dentro de sus planes futuros es ampliar mas su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Delia is thirty-eight years old.  She is a humble tradeswoman and a housewife, despite not having completed her studies as she would have wished.  She is a very hardworking person with a desire to move ahead.  She is originally from Siuna Rosita, but she currently lives in Managua.  She only completed high school.  She is the proud mother of three children, ages 9, 10, and 14, and they are all currently in school.

She is a tradeswoman and has made a living in making and selling tortillas for eight years.  She began this business with her own capital; she used the money she had saved.  This is her first business, and she feels very satisfied with it because she makes profits every day and has regular customers.  In addition to selling tortillas, she also sells beans in order to generate additional income.  She counts on the support of her husband and children.  She also receives extra income from other activities, like phone recharge services.  

Delia is requesting this financing in order to buy corn, firewood, beans, gas, etc.  She believes that this loan will help her to buy all of the raw materials that she needs to make her tortillas and to satisfy the needs of her customers.  

Her future plans include growing her business in order to obtain higher profits.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, beans, gas, etc.

loans.name: Wema Group

texts.en:
Wema is a group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District represented by Mathew. The group has 6 women and 4 men. Mathew is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of sweet potatoes, millet and sorghum. Mathew first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Mathew joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices and grow enough food for the family.

Mathew described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to buy cattle and save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Mathew’s group will receive 5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potatoes, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 50-year-old married lady who lives happily with her family. Her poultry farm has since improved with the loan she borrowed from KADET LTD as her monthly income is now KES 15,000.

Mary has now asked for a third loan of KES 70,000 after she paid the previous ones successfully. She wishes to use this loan to purchase more chickens for rearing and also to pay the school fees for her children.  

Her dream is to be financially stable and have a happy family.

loans.use: To purchase poultry for the farm.

loans.name: Hycinthe

texts.en:
Hycinthe is 38 years old. She is married with two children, the oldest of whom is 9 and the youngest is 6. Her husband works for the government. 

Hycinthe has been in business for five years. She requests a loan to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. She will apply the profits toward her savings.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 37 years old and married with three children. She has a butchery business in Kangundo town where she sells and supplies meat to hotels and other butcher shops. She also sells roasted meat, fish and chicken at the same place, and this has enabled her to generate more income.

This will be her first loan term and she plans to use the amount to buy more meat to sell and to supply to her customers. She also plans to buy more stock of fish and chicken. She will use part of the loan amount to expand her business premises so as to accommodate more customers who come to eat roasted meat, fish and chicken.

She hopes to grow her business by supplying meat to other towns in the region and thereby make more income. This will enable her to provide for the needs of her family as well as educate her children.

loans.use: To buy a stock of meat, fish and chicken.

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en:
Specioza is married with six children and all her children go to school. Specioza doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a business of poultry farming and has been in this business for ten years. 

She has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bags of chicken feed, vaccine and chicks. She also generates additional income from a hardware shop. She works in the shop six days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include transportation, seasonality and thieves.  

She is aspiring of owning 3,000 laying chickens and also to see her hardware shop grow into a wholesale one. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying for school fees and utility charges.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed, vaccine and chicks.

loans.name: Muungano Group

texts.en:
Rose is a member of the Muungano Group in Kakamega North District. She is pictured with 11 One Acre Fund farmers, 9 women and 2 men. Rose is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Rose is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and to grow enough food for the family.

Rose described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one as a One Acre Fund farmer. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and repair her home. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Rose's group will receive 5.5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potatoes, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty  is a single mother of five children and none of them goes to school.  She takes care of additional family members (her grandchildren). She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings to buy more bags of charcoal. Besides this charcoal business she also generates additional income from rental rooms. 

Resty works from her home seven days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality, thieves and defaulters.  She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also of building more rental rooms.  She resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees for her grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is single and she has sold various types of handbags for more than three years. She is a very hard-working person who is thankful for her efforts for getting ahead and helping her family day by day. She tells us that things are very difficult, but in spite of that she makes an effort to move forward.

She is asking for this loan in order to purchase handbags of all types to sell to her customers and in this way to be able to continue working and having sales that will give her the income to maintain her home.

loans.use: to purchase handbags of all types to sell to her customers

loans.name: Klodian

texts.en:
Klodian is requesting a loan to buy second-hand clothes and electrical appliances to sell.

Klodian is a 25-year-old single Roma man who lives in a major city in central Albania. Just like the majority of young people, he’s got dreams as well. He wants to get married, have children, and open a store to sell his items instead of selling in the streets or at the Roma market. “But before I make my dreams a reality, I need to work and figure things out on my own,”  Klodian said. 

"I have been selling used clothes for almost seven years and believe I have done well, but I could do better,“ Klodian said, smiling.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes and electrical kitchen ware to sell.

loans.name: Ednah

texts.en:
Ednah lives in Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married business lady running a video cafe. The business has been in operation for two years. Besides this, Ednah also runs a laundry shop.

She learned about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is that the video business needs a lot of supervision, which necessitates reliable staff--difficult to find.

Ednah is applying for a loan of 52,250 Kenyan shillings to buy a washing machine to use in setting up another service centre. Her future aspiration is to open a cinema hall.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine

loans.name: Vjollca

texts.en:
Vjollca has been selling used items at the Roma market in her city for the last ten years. She comes from the Roma community and lives within the community. She is divorced and has only one fourteen-year-old child, and together they live under the extreme poverty level. Both of them work hard to earn some money to secure their living. Her son collects trash cans from the large trash bins of the city and sells them for cash. 

Vjolica dreams of educating her son. Unfortunately, that dream won’t be fulfilled due to poverty reasons, because even though primary and secondary schools are free of any tuition fees, there are other costs associated with being a school goer, such as clothing and shoes and food…according to Vjollca.

loans.use: To buy used clothes and electronic appliances to resell.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 26 years old and single; he does not support anyone else. His daily source of income is a transportation business, for both people and goods in the Kapsabet area.   He has been in operation for three years, earning an income of KES. 6,000.

Alex is taking his second loan of KES. 40,000 with KADET LTD; he wants to purchase fresh green tea leaves from local farmers to sell.  The anticipated profits will be used to purchase more green tea leaves to sell. 

His dream is to become financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase green tea leaves to sell.

loans.name: Settlement Group

texts.en:
Settlement is a group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District represented by Alfred. The group has 5 women and 5 men. Alfred is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Alfred’s first season with One Acre Fund. He joined this year in order to gain access to the best input prices of hybrid seed and fertilizer.

Alfred thought his harvest last year was poor. He hopes that as a One Acre Fund farmer he can have an excellent harvest. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and repair his home. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Alfred’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each.  In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Telman

texts.en:
Telman, 52, and his wife are pensioners. They have two children, ages 19 and 20. To be able to provide his family with products, medicine and other needs, he started his own farming business. He had one cow in the stable when he started, and now he has three cows and one cattle. 

He breeds cows and cattle and sells milk and milk products as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. Milk, yogurt, as well as beef and mutton, are very popular and profitable products in Azerbaijan. Telman has 19 years of experience in this field, thanks to his parents who taught him the best way to look after cattle. 

This activity is the main financial income in his family but still not enough to cover their basic needs. Telman has applied for a loan of 1,600 AZN to purchase two milk cows. This is his second loan with VFAC and he has a good client history.

loans.use: To purchase two milk cows.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is 38-year-old man married to Benter. He comes from Kisumu town center in Kisumu county. He supports a family of five people and he is blessed with three children whose ages are twelve, seven and three years old.

He operates a music and movies disc selling business, which he has been doing for the last 5 years. He makes a monthly income of about KES 15,000. He is applying for his second loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase blank DVDs and CDs to sell. He will use the anticipated profit to increase his business.

He has a dream of making his business become big so as to enable him to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase more music and movie discs.

loans.name: Wema Group

texts.en:
Clementina’s group has 11 farmers and is located in Kakamega North District. Clementina is pictured on the right of Wema Group with her hand raised. Clementina is pictured amongst the 11 women of her group. She will receive a loan sufficient for planting ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and sweet potato. Clementina joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2010 season, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Clementina joined One Acre Fund so that she could access the best prices on planting materials and grow enough food for the family.

Clementina described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Clementina’s group will receive 5.5 acres' worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Aurora, 50 años de edad, casada, de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una pulpería, desde hace 18 años, originaria de Managua, madre de 4 hijos, ella realizo sus estudios hasta su primaria, pues su situación económica no le permitió culminar sus estudios. Inicio su actividad laboral a la edad de 32 años, con capital propio, dinero que tenía ahorrado de su anterior trabajo quien se dedicaba solo a vender granos básicos,  pero miro que este negocio no le generaba mucho ingresos, fue por eso que decidió dejar este negocio y dedicarse solamente a su pulpería, Aurora dice que se siente bien en el lugar donde se encuentra pues cuenta con clientes fijos , además que es un negocio muy rentable, genera ingresos a diario, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de su esposo, también cuenta con otros ingresos  como es el dinero que le genera el servicio de taxi que ofrece su esposo que trabaja manejándolo.
Ella solicita el financiamiento para comprar mercadería en general, arroz, azúcar, sardinas, galletas, embutidos como atún, vasos plásticos, platos, cerveza, etc. Con el objetivo de ofrecer otros tipos de productos a sus clientes, además de los productos básicos que ofrece a diario en su negocio, unos de sus planes futuros es seguir luchando cada día para seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Aurora is fifty years old, is married, and is a shopkeeper.  She has been the owner of her own grocery store for eighteen years, and is originally from Managua.  She is the mother of four children.  She studied through primary school, but her economic situation did not allow her to complete her studies.  

She began this type of work when she was thirty-two years old and with her own capital that she had saved up from a previous job selling bulk grains.  She realized that selling bulk grains did not generate a lot of income, and so she decided to leave that business and to only dedicate herself to her grocery store. 

Aurora says that she feels good about her current situation; she has regular customers and her business is very profitable and generates a daily income.  She also has the support of her husband in her business.  She has other sources of income too, like the taxi service that her husband offers.  

She is requesting this financing in order to buy general merchandise, like rice, sugar, sardines, crackers, canned items like tuna, plastic glasses, plates,  beer, etc.  Her objective is to offer other types of products to her customers while still having the basic products that she offers every day in her business.

One of her future plans is to continue fighting every day in order to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, like rice, sugar, sardines, crackers, canned items like tuna, plastic glasses, plates, beer, etc.

loans.name: Yesu Anaweza Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nzigire est conseillère  du groupe d’affaire  Yesu anaweza, jeune entrepreneur,  âgée de 25 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Son conjoint est un commerçant de divers. La cliente est sociétaire d’un restaurant. Elle commença cette affaire avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle beneficia des fonds additionnels de crédit de l’IMF Hekima.  Il ya 2 ans, elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter les stocks d’aliments (pommes de terre, haricots, huile, braises, viandes, poissons, Fanta, laits, etc.).  Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle et scolariser ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit. Il sied de signaler que, certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Nzigire is a member and advisor of the Yesu anaweza group. A young business entrepreneur, she is 25 years old, married with four children. Her husband is a retail merchant of various products.

She is an associate partner of a restaurant. She started the business using funds received from her husband. Later, she was granted additional funding through Hekima MFI credit loans. She has been in business for two years. 

This new loan will be used to buy stocks of food (potatoes, beans, oil, charcoal, meat, fish, Fanta soft drinks, milk, etc..). She wants to buy a plot and educate her children. 

At the end, she greatly thanks Hekima for its support to micro-credit. It should be noted that some group members are carrying their babies.

loans.use: buy stocks of food (potatoes, beans, oil, charcoal, meat, fish, Fanta soft drinks, milk, etc..)

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Rafael está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas se unieron ya que vieron una gran oportunidad de progreso, no solo para ellas sino también para sus familias, es por eso que formaron este grupo solidario.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien con mucho esfuerzo está saliendo adelante, y también lo hace gracias a su trabajo, que consiste en la venta de perfumes de todas clases. Cuenta que tiene temporadas altas y bajas y que pese a ello no se cansa de esforzar y luchar, ya que todo es por su familia. Su sueño es poder seguir trabajando con su grupo y llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de perfumes, ya que así va a tener una mejor variedad para sus clientes y sumado a eso tiene pedidos con que cumplir.
texts.en:
The San Rafael group is in its first cycle with the Women’s Committee program.  They got together because they saw a great opportunity for progress, not just for themselves, but also for their families.  That is why they formed this communal bank.

Maria is one of the members, and she is getting ahead with great effort.  She does so thanks to her work of selling all types of perfume.  She says that she has high seasons and low seasons.  Nevertheless, she does not tire of struggling and putting forth great effort because everything is for her family.

Her dream is to be able to continue working with her group and to reach the program’s highest level.

She is requesting this loan to buy perfumes.  This way she will have a greater variety for her customers.  She also has orders to fill.

loans.use: to buy perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Ernestine

texts.en: Ernestine is 31 years old. She is married with two children. The oldest is four and the youngest is three months. Her husband is a farmer. She has been in business for three years. She wants a loan to buy more cows to sell. She will use the profit to finish up her home.

loans.use: To buy more cows to sell.

loans.name: Amada

texts.es:
Doña Amada una humilde señora, ama de casa de 48 años de edad, originaria de Estelí, pero actualmente vive en Managua, casada, madre de 4 hijos, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de comida, debido a las condiciones de pobreza en que vivía solo logro finalizar la  secundaria. Inicio su negocio a la edad de 38 años, con pequeños préstamos que le dio una institución financiera, la cual logro emprender su propio negocio como es la venta de pizza de forma ambulante, ya que este negocio no le generaba muchas ganancias fue por eso que decidió dejarlo. Actualmente solo se dedica a vender comida en su casa, la cual con mucho esfuerzo y arduo trabajo ha podido salir adelante, con su negocio porque le genera ganancias a diario, cuenta con clientes fijos, recibe el apoyo de su hija y esposo.
Doña Amada está necesitando el préstamo para comprar arroz, pollo, carne, aceite, mantequilla, vitrina para exhibir su comida. Con el propósito de comprar toda la materia prima que necesita para la elaboración de su deliciosa comida, dentro de sus planes futuros es poder mejorar la infraestructura del local en donde tiene su negocio para darle una mejor presentación y atraer más clientela.
texts.en:
Amada is an unassuming, a forty-eight-year-old homemaker.  She's originally from Estelí but now lives in Managua.  She's married, the mother of four children, and sells meals for a living.  Due to poverty conditions where she lived, she managed to complete only high school.  She started a business when she was thirty-eight with small loans from a financial institution that allowed her run her own mobile pizza business.  It didn't generate much profit so she shut it down.  Now Amada just sells food from her house and with a great deal of effort and tough work she's been successful with the business because it makes a daily profit.  She has steady customers and has the support of her husband and daughter.

Amada needs a loan to buy rice, chicken, meat, oil, butter, and a display case so she'll have all the supplies she needs to make her delicious food.  Among her future plans is to be able to improve her locale so it presents better and attracts more clientele.

loans.use: to buy rice, chicken, meat, oil, butter, and a display case for her food.

loans.name: Plamedi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nsimire est présidente adjointe du groupe d’affaire Plamedi,  entrepreneur, âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un chômeur. La cliente est vendeuse de maïs. Elle installe ses produits devant son domicile. Elle commença cette affaire avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le crédit de Hekima.  Il ya 5 ans, elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 3 sacs de maïs et de payer le transport de ses marchandises. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle et poursuivre avec la scolarité de ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit.
texts.en: The client Nsimire is assistant president to the business group Plamedi, entrepreneur, 40 years old, married and mother to 8 children who all study. Her spouse is unemployed. The client sells corn. She sets up her products in front of her residence. She started this business with her own funds received from her husband. Later, she benefited from a loan from Hekima. She has been practicing this business for 5 years. This new loan will serve to buy 3 bags of corn and to pay for the transport of her merchandise. She hopes to buy a plot of land and pursue the schooling of her children. In conclusion, she strongly thanks Hekima for its microloan support.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of corn and to pay for the transport of her merchandise.

loans.name: Gloriose

texts.fr:
Gloriose  fait partie du groupe Remesha et est une des victimes de  l’incendie du marché central de Bujumbura. Elle est cliente de Turame depuis 6 ans. Elle  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle est mariée à Cyrille. .

Elle faisait le commerce  des  produits vivriers (oignons, pomme de terre,…) au marché central de Bujumbura. Elle a perdu des marchandises d’une valeur de  3  000 000FBU (1923,11$) par l’incendie. 
Elle avait un projet d’importer ses produits du Rwanda.

Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  reconstituer son capital en achetant  des  produits vivriers (oignons, pomme de terre,…), à revendre pour  continuer de gagner sa vie.
texts.en:
Gloriose is a member of the Remesha group. She is one of the people who have suffered losses during the fire in the Bujumbura central market. She has been a customer of Turame for  six years. She lives in Bujumbura. Her husband’s name is Cyrille. She sells staple foods (onions, potatoes etc) at the   Bujumbura central market. She has lost merchandise in the value of 3,000,000 FBU (US $1923.11) in the fire.
At some point she had planned to import her products from Rwanda.

With this Kiva loan, she will rebuild her capital and stock up on staple foods (onions, potatoes etc) for resale in order to continue making a living.

loans.use: rebuild her capital and stock up on staple foods (onions, potatoes etc) for resale in order to continue making a living.

loans.name: Safi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kasengaire est présidente et doyenne  du groupe d’affaire Safi,  entrepreneur, âgée de 53 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants qui ont déjà leurs propres foyers. Son conjoint est un chômeur. La cliente est vendeuse des articles divers (magasin). Elle commença cette affaire avec  le crédit de l’IMF Hekima.  Il ya 2 ans, elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter les articles divers (sucres, savons de toilettes, cartons de biscuits, jus, sardines, lotion de beauté, bombons,  etc.).  Elle souhaite acheter construire en matériaux durable dans sa parcelle et poursuivre avec la scolarité de ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit.Il sied de signaler qu'une cliente porte son bebe.
texts.en: The client Kasengaire is president and dean of the business group Safi, entrepreneur, 53 years old, married and mother to 4 children who already have their own homes. Her spouse is unemployed. The client sells a variety of items in a store. She started this business with a loan from the MFI Hekima. She has been in this business for 2 years. This new loan will serve to buy a variety of items (sugars, soaps, cartons of biscuits, juice, sardines, beauty lotion, candies, etc.). She hopes to buy and build with durable materials on her plot of land and pursue the schooling of her children. In conclusion, she strongly thanks Hekima for its microloan support. It should be noted that one client is carrying her baby.

loans.use: to buy a variety of items (sugars, soaps, cartons of biscuits, juice, sardines, beauty lotions, candies, etc.).

loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en: Hellen is a forty-year-old mother of five children. She and her husband farm coconut trees, cowpeas, cassava, and green peas. The greatest challenge she faces in her farming is not having enough capital to purchase pesticides to protect her crops against pests, or fertilizer to increase her yields. Hellen is excited to join the KOMAZA microforestry program because she believes that it is bringing change to the lives of many people in her village. She hopes to use the income from her KOMAZA tree farm to educate her children.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training, and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: One Way Group

texts.en: Suzan managed to hire more staff with the previous loan. She is also now able to pay school fees for her children with no hassles. She is requesting a new loan of $750 to buy clothes and shoes for resale. Susan still wants to open her own clothing shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals, etc.

loans.name: Topister's Group

texts.en:
Topister's group is comprised of 2 hard working women. Topister is 20 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. For the past three years, Topister has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells books, soap, and other products. 

To help expand her business, Topister  has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more items such as books, soap, and other products to sell, and will help Topister generate greater profits and income. 

Topister hopes that in the future, she will be able to add more money to the business. 

Topister is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to stock more items such as books, soap, and other products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Marie Gorette

texts.en: Marie Gorette is 27 years old. She is married with one child who is a year and a half old. Her husband is in both farming and business. She has been in business for 10 years. She wants a loan to buy more locally produced beer for sale. With the profit she will be able to feed her children and also keep some in her savings.

loans.use: To buy more locally produced beer for sale in the bar.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: This marks Alice's fifth loan from KADET LTD., which she will use to pay school fees for her daughter, who has joined a secondary school. Her business is doing great since its expansion and her last loan is being well repaid. She hopes to excel in her business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child and purchase a variety of foodstuffs.

loans.name: Ricardo Arnulfo

texts.es: El Sr. Ricardo es un hombre muy trabajador, está casado y tiene 4 hermoso hijos.  El siempre cuida el bienestar de su familia y día con día se cerciora de que nada les falte. El necesita construir con cemento el techo de su vivienda ya que actualmente lo tiene de lámina. El requiere ayuda por medio de kiva para poder mejorar su techo ya que no quiere que le pase algún accidente a lo que más quiere, su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Ricardo is a very hardworking man. He is married and has four beautiful children. He always takes great care of his family and checks every day that they want for nothing. 

Ricardo wishes to make a permanent roof for his house which is currently made from sheeting. He is seeking help from Kiva so that he can fix the roof as he doesn’t want any accident to happen to his beloved family.

loans.use: build a concrete roof on his house

loans.name: Tembiapo Porave Rekavo Group

texts.es:
En su ciclo 2 se encuentra el Grupo Tembiapo Porave Rakavo, donde cada una de las integrantes esta luchando por salir adelante y crecer. Son madres de familias que decidieron tomar la posta y ayudar a sus hijos.
Arminda quien es parte de este grupo cuenta que ella es costurera, tiene un pequeño taller en su casa, con el que atiende todos los pedidos de sus clientes. es una costurera muy buena ya que hace todo tipo de confecciones, con las que siempre quedan muy contentos sus clientes. Con este trabajo tiene los medios para ayudar a su familia y cubrir el día a día.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, botones y demás para poder seguir con sus confecciones y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Tembiapo Porave Rakavo group is in their second loan cycle. Every one of the group members is working hard to get ahead and grow. They are mothers who decided to take up the charge and help their children.

One of the members is Arminda who is seamstress. She has a small workshop in her house where she makes whatever her customers have ordered. She is a very good seamstress and sews all kinds of clothing, making her customers very happy. With the income from this work, she has the means to support her family on a daily basis.

Arminda is seeking a loan to buy fabric, thread, glue, buttons and other items so she can continue making clothes and serving her customers.

loans.use: buy fabric, thread, glue, buttons etc.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is the mother of two children who are students. Together with her husband Edik, she works hard to sustain her family and give her children an opportunity to get a higher education. Narine's husband has applied to SEF International for a loan for their son's education.

Now Narine wants to get this loan for their daughter's education. Their daughter, Jenia, studies in the philological department at Armenian State Pedagogical University, which is named after Khachatur Abovyan.  Jenia dreams of completing her education and becoming a teacher. 

This loan will help Narine pay for her daughter's university tuition. It is very important for Narine and her husband to ensure a prosperous future for their children.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition for her daughter.

loans.name: Teresia's Group

texts.en: Teresia is a 30-year-old mother of six children, and her husband is a teacher. She farms maize, cowpeas and green peas. Teresia's farming faces the challenge of not enough capital to purchase fertilizer to increase the yields of her crops. She plans on using the income from her KOMAZA tree farm to pay for school fees and to build rental houses on her compound.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.en: Stephanie is 57 years old. She is married with six children. The oldest is 18 years old and the youngest is 12 years old. Her husband is a farmer. She has been in business for eight years. She wants a loan to buy more rice and maize flour for sale. With the profit, she will pay school fees for her children, and she will put the rest into her savings account.

loans.use: To buy more rice and flour for sale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and three of them attend school. She also looks after her brother and sister.

She has been selling second-hand clothes in the market at retail prices for eight years. She has no other source of income. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy more second-hand clothes for sale. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to expand her business to be able to stock all kinds of garments. She joined MCDT because she realized that it gives loans to low-income-earning women for the improvement of their households.  

She lives with her husband in a rented house with access to electricity but without piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción conocida cariñosamente como “CONCHITA”, de 54 años de edad, casada, originaria del departamento de Chinandega, ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer luchadora, responsables y con muchas ganas de superación personal, hace 26 años decidió colocar un negocio para salir adelante y tener un medio para obtener ingresos económicos y subsistir, Gracia a su espíritu de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, el cual consiste en  una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como sobre de café, sobre de shampoo, sobre de salsa de tomate, arroz, frijoles, jugos, pan, huevos, sal, azúcar, leche.  su actividad económica es una pulpería donde vende: granos básicos, productos congelados, golosinas, entre otros. Conchita es muy popular dentro de su reparto, ya que ella es muy cariñosa, factor que ha favorecido mucho en su negocio, porque de esa forma ha logrado la fidelidad de su clientela. Solicita este crédito para invertir en su pulpería y aumentar la oferta de productos a su clientela.
texts.en:
54-year old Concepción is affectionately called Conchita by her friends. She is married and comes from the department of Chinandega. She is known as a hardworking, responsible woman with a great desire to make something of herself. 26 years ago she decided to open a business as a way to earn money to live on. 

Through her strong desire to get ahead she managed to open a small store in her house where she sells groceries in small quantities such as coffee, shampoo, tomato sauce, rice, beans, juice, bread, eggs, salt, sugar and milk. In her store Concepción also sells basic grains, frozen items, candy etc. She is very popular in her neighbourhood as she is very friendly, something that has helped her a great deal and provided her with a faithful customer base.

She is seeking a loan to buy more products to offer her customers.
